Common.name: Armor-Piercing Rounds
Common.desc: Deal an additional 20% damage (+20% per stack) to bosses .
Common.notes:
Armor-Piercing Rounds are an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Advancement Challenge.
The item increases damage dealt by 20% (+20% per stack) against Bosses and Hordes of Many spawned by the Teleporter, Bosses spawned during the 5th and 10th wave of the Simulacrum, Special Bosses, and the Umbrae from the Artifact of Vengeance. 


== Notes ==
This item is also effective against the   Lunar Chimera Golems,   Lunar Chimera Wisps, and   Lunar Chimera Exploders that appear in phase 2 of the   final boss fight. It does not have an effect against any Lunar Chimeras that spawn in Phase 3, however.
The item will change damage numbers to orange when activated.
This item affects enemies with red health bars. This means they will deal extra damage to non-boss Horde of Many monsters, but will not affect naturally spawning boss monsters that are not spawned by the Teleporter Event.
Any monsters that have  Infusions will have their health bar changed to a reddish color as a result of the Infusions; these are not considered bosses. This is only relevant in the Void Fields, while the Artifact of Evolution is enabled, during the Simulacrum, or while fighting a   Scavenger that spawns with or finds Infusions.


== Tips ==
This item's damage bonus stacks multiplicatively with other damage-increasing items such as  Lens-Maker's Glasses,  Delicate Watch,  Crowbar and  Focus Crystal; stacking all of these can enable some truly impressive damage numbers.


== Lore ==

Common.name: Backup Magazine
Common.desc: Add +1 (+1 per stack) charge of your Secondary skill .
Common.notes:
The Backup Magazine is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Flawless Challenge.
The item grants the holder 1 extra charge (+1 per stack) of their secondary, or "M2" skill.  


== Notes ==
This item is especially strong when used with characters with powerful and/or low-cooldown secondary skills.
This item increases the maximum amount of   Engineer's mines that can be placed.
Unlike the  Hardlight Afterburner and  Lysate Cell, this item does not reduce the cooldown of the secondary skill.
The  Luminous Shot can instead be used to get a 20% cooldown reduction.
Having multiple Backup Magazines allows the player to quickly use multiple charges of their secondary skill back to back, and increased attack speed makes these multiple charges come out even faster. This burst potential is easier to obtain than reducing skill cooldowns to the minimum of 0.5 seconds through  Purity or  Brainstalks, although cooldown reduction is still effective for reloading the charges.
This item affects   MUL-T's secondary fire when in   Power Mode, although it can only be utilized by   Scrap Launcher.
However, upon exiting Power Mode, all charges of   Blast Canister granted by Backup Magazines will be refreshed, turning the ability from largely a stun utility to a genuine source of damage with enough charges. Alternating between activating the skill and entering sprint to reset the animation will launch Blast Canisters more quickly.
This item lets   Railgunner fire additional consecutive shots while scoped in with   M99 Sniper before having to reload. However, with   HH44 Marksman, this item is functionally useless.
The   final boss utilizes Backup Magazines during Phase 4, which can work to the player's favor, as the self-damaging Lunar Orbs ability resides in his secondary slot; repeated uses will quickly reduce his health and return the player's items.

Common.name: Bison Steak
Common.desc: Increases maximum health by 25 (+25 per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Bison Steak is an item introduced in the Hidden Realms Update.
The item grants the player a flat +25 maximum HP (+25 HP per stack).


== Notes ==
This item gets extra value out of health-increasing items such as  Transcendence,  Stone Flux Pauldron,  Spinel Tonic,  Pearl and  Irradiant Pearl. For instance, one Transcendence will allow the Bison Steak to provide a flat +37.5 maximum health instead of the usual +25.
Conversely, any reduction to maximum health (like from  Shaped Glass or  Tonic Affliction) will lessen the value of this item. One Shaped Glass will bring the health bonus down from +25 to a mere +12.5.
With Artifact of Glass this item only grants 10% (2.5 HP) per stack.
This item provides Growth when used on   False Son.
If used in the Wandering CHEF, this item can be upgraded into  Seared Steak if combined with a  Mocha,  Eclipse Lite,  Power Elixir,  Energy Drink,  Bustling Fungus,  Cautious Slug,  Monster Tooth, or another  Bison Steak. This will double the flat health increase and add a small percentage increase to max health as well.

Common.name: Bolstering Lantern
Common.desc: Increase your attack speed by 10% (+3.5% per stack) for up to 3 (+1 per stack) enemies and allies within 20 meters.
Common.notes:
Bolstering Lantern is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
Each enemy and ally within 20m grants the holder a   Lantern Buff stack, increasing the holder's attack speed by 10% (+3.5% per stack). The Lantern Buff can stack up to 3 (+1 per stack) times.


== Notes ==
The Bolstering Lantern's area of effect is indicated by a blue-green ring on the ground around the holder.
Individual stacks of the Lantern Buff are immediately added/removed as enemies and allies enter/leave the radius.

Common.name: Bundle of Fireworks
Common.desc: Activating an interactable launches 8 (+4 per stack) fireworks that deal 300% base damage .
Common.notes:
The Bundle of Fireworks is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the ...Maybe One More. Challenge.
When interacting with something (with the exception of Scrappers), the player launches 8 (+4 per stack) homing fireworks, each exploding in a 5m radius and dealing 300% damage with a proc coefficient of 0.2.  


== Notes ==
After interacting with something, fireworks rockets are launched one by one every 0.1 seconds, firing directly upwards.
Fireworks travel at 25 m/s, and accelerate at 2m/s.
Each fireworks rocket stops homing in on enemies after 8 seconds and will fall to the ground. If the rocket still has not hit anything after 16 seconds, it automatically explodes.
Critical chance is rolled upon activation. If the chance succeeds, all fireworks from that instance will deal critical damage.
The Bundle of Fireworks becomes substantially less useful with the Artifact of Sacrifice, since no Chests spawn.
This item cannot be obtained in the Simulacrum mode, and will appear locked if attempting to select it with the Artifact of Command.
Fireworks are affected by the  Pocket I.C.B.M.. Instead of launching 3 times as many rockets over a longer period, 3 rockets are launched at once every 0.1 seconds instead of the normal 1.


== Tips ==
The vending machine spawned by  Remote Caffeinator allows for easy, repeated use of the Bundle of Fireworks and  Squid Polyp while in boss arenas or other areas which do not typically have interactables.
Owing to its low proc coefficient, this item cannot reliably activate chance-based on-hit items like  Tri-Tip Dagger and  AtG Missile Mk. 1. To make the most out of this item, consider damage-increasing items that ignore proc coefficients entirely; these include  Lens-Maker's Glasses,  Delicate Watch,  Crowbar,  Armor-Piercing Rounds and  Brilliant Behemoth.
Special mention goes to the  Plasma Shrimp, not only for its ability to ignore proc coefficients entirely, but also for being affected by the  Pocket I.C.B.M. as well. The amount of fireworks will be tripled, and each firework will proc three missiles on hit, leading to exponential damage returns.


== Lore ==
"Hey, happy anniversary!

You really thought I forgot?

Ah, I thought I was the dumb one in our relationship. C'mon T, of course not! Well, I wasn't going to let a little alien death planet ruin our night. Right? Shh, just watch. Just watch. It's okay. Just watch. You'll love it - you really will. Then we can go home.

You can keep your eyes closed. Just listen. Ah - here it comes! In five... four... three... two... ONE...!"

Common.name: Bustling Fungus
Common.desc: After standing still for 1 second, create a zone that heals for 4.5% (+2.25% per stack) of your health every second to all allies within 3m (+1.5m per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Bustling Fungus is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
After the holder remains stationary for 1 second, the item creates a radius of 3m (+1.5m per stack) which heals any ally within for 4.5% (+2.25% per stack) health every second, as long as the holder remains still. 


== Notes ==
Correction: The radius starts at 3.5m instead of 3m.
The fungus heals 4 times per second, for approximately 1.13% (+0.56%) health every tick.
The fungus's healing scales with the max health of the recipient, not the holder. It also can affect minions, such as drones,   Aurelionite,  Squid Turrets, and even ghosts from the  Happiest Mask. As a result, it can keep multiple turrets or ghosts alive despite their constant health drain and keep nearby minions healthy.
Having 177 Bustling Fungus will reach more than 100% healing (100.125%) per tick, which is effectively a soft cap without items using overhealing such as  Aegis. The  Rejuvenation Rack will greatly reduce the number needed to hit this cap (87 with only one Rack).
The effective healing radius is visible as a bright green circle around the holder, and green mushrooms of various sizes growing and disappearing. Any entity receiving healing inside the radius is also outlined in green.


== Tips ==
The Bustling Fungus is extremely powerful to stack as   Engineer (with his   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turrets), due to his turrets' ability to inherit his item inventory and their immobility. Each turret will automatically create a healing radius, sustaining not just itself but Engineer as well.
This strategy is particularly effective when combined with Engineer's   Bubble Shield.
 N'kuhana's Opinion is extremely powerful with this item, especially with the aforementioned Engineer strategy.
  MUL-T can make excellent use of the Fungus while in   Power Mode, since the player's movement speed is already drastically reduced.
The bonus healing also further augments MUL-T's survivability, on top of the large armor bonus from Power Mode.
  REX can rapidly fire   Seed Barrage while remaining stationary using the Fungus, quickly regaining the health lost from using the skill.
The Fungus's healing can easily offset the burning damage from the  Helfire Tincture, especially if the damage is reduced with  Repulsion Armor Plates.
The healing radius is placed at the holder's feet, or any ground straight below within 500m.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM UES [Redacted] --//

“You have a problem.”

“What? How? These are good for me, they…”

“Yeah, they help promote cell repair, carbon neutral, blah blah blah… I’ve heard that spiel a thousand times already. Whether they’re good for you or not, you can’t just have a diet consisting only of them. It’s basic dietary science!”

“So what?”

“So what? Eating only mushrooms isn’t healthy, just like eating only meat or vegetables isn’t healthy!”

“Oh, so you’re attacking vegetarians, now?”

“Wh- No! I just mean--”

“Well, when you’re a bit more tolerant of my lifestyle, I’d be glad to continue this conversation with you. Until then, I’d suggest you open your heart and appetite to a more… fungal… palette.”


== Trivia ==
The Risk of Rain 2 community often refers to Bustling Fungus as "Bungus", a portmanteau of the two words.
The term gained such traction that the official Risk of Rain 2 Discord Server uses it for the Bustling Fungus emote.

Common.name: Cautious Slug
Common.desc: Increases base health regeneration by +3 hp/s (+3 hp/s per stack) while outside of combat.
Common.notes:
The Cautious Slug is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
After the holder avoids damage for 7 seconds, their health regeneration is increased by 3 HP per second (+3 HP/s per stack) until they take damage again. Additionally, this regeneration increases by 0.6 HP/s (+0.6 HP/s per stack) per player level. 


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of out of combat is wrong. It is active when you are out of danger.
The extra heal is treated as passive regeneration, so the Cautious Slug does not inhibit completing the Naturopath challenge.
This also means that this item is unaffected by the  Corpsebloom.
The Cautious Slug is very effective on the   Heretic, as two stacks can negate her negative regeneration entirely as long as the player avoids damage (which is made easier thanks to her   Shadowfade skill).


== Lore ==
“One of the most crucial things to remember about having an animal companion is that your relationship is built on trust. Though humans are perceptive, we tend to be blinded by what we see – and we ignore the dangers that lurk beyond our vision. Animals, and other xenobiology, can sense things we can’t. 

So always remember: if your companion warns you of danger in the dark, you had better well listen.”

- Caring for your Pets, Volume III

Common.name: Crowbar
Common.desc: Deal +75% (+75% per stack) damage to enemies above 90% health .
Common.notes:
The Crowbar is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the The Basics Challenge.
When the holder attacks an enemy that has more than 90% of its health remaining, they deal 75% more damage (+75% per stack). 


== Notes ==
After stacking two or more Crowbars, the total damage dealt is greater than a critical strike.
This item is best used with Survivors with high single-hit damage, such as   Loader,   Artificer,   Captain, and   Railgunner.
However, all Survivors can make effective use of the Crowbar with equipment such as the  Preon Accumulator or  Royal Capacitor.
The bonus damage from the Crowbar is calculated on a per-hit basis, so extra attacks from total damage items do not account for its bonus damage, unless they also hit an enemy that is above 90% health.
Crowbars, and similarly   Voidsent Flame, can become difficult to use in multiplayer or with damage-dealing allies, as they can reduce an enemy's health below 90% and prevent one from utilizing the damage increase.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM CARGO BAY 5 OF UES [Redacted] --//

“Hey, toss me a crowbar?”

Jesse walked over to the toolbox and rummaged around. Plucking a crowbar from the container, she went over to James.

“Thanks,” he grunted, attempting to pry the chest open. Jesse sat herself on the table next to James, idly watching him work. “I swear, this had to be the one chest that CAN’T be paid open... Crash must have... broken the circuitry inside.” James mumbled to himself.

“Yeah.” Jesse looked around, her eyes falling on a palette of chests that had been recovered from the recent expeditions. Sighing, she hopped to her feet. “I’m heading to the mess hall. Want anything?” 

“Yeah, how about a better crowbar? This thing is only a second edition.” James stretched, tossing the crowbar over his shoulder. Patting the still unopened chest, he chuckled. “It’s good, but to be honest… it’s getting a little old.”

Jesse laughed.


== Version History ==


== Trivia ==
The Crowbar is a reference to the Half Life series created by Valve, in which the main character Gordon Freeman uses a crowbar similar to the one depicted as his melee weapon.
The text from the first game's logbook entry, "until the 3rd edition arrives," as well as this game's updated entry adding that "the second edition" is "getting a little old" are digs at the long production time of the Half-Life series and Valve's seeming dislike of the number 3, going as far as making Half-Life 1, 2 and Half-Life 2: Episodes 1 and 2. Because of this, Half-Life 3 has become a well-known point of humor on the internet joking about how it will never come out.
The logbook entry may also be a reference to the Pokémon anime, in which a pair of characters also named Jesse and James are thieves for the criminal organization known as Team Rocket. In the series, James is often found doing all the physical labor, while Jesse slacks off or raids the remaining food or supplies the duo have. They also consistently have little to no money in the series, reflected by how the pair are breaking into a chest whose payment mechanism is broken.

Common.name: Delicate Watch
Common.desc: Increase damage by 20% (+20% per stack) . Taking damage to below 25% health breaks this item.
Common.notes:
The Delicate Watch is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion. 
It increases all the holder's damage by 20% (+20% per stack). However, when the holder takes damage that brings them below 25% of their maximum health, all stacks of this item is removed from the inventory and an equal amount of  Delicate Watch (Broken) is added. Broken Watches have no effect and cannot be scrapped.


== Notes ==
While the player is holding this item, a faint black line will appear over the health bar at the 25% mark, indicating when this item will break.
Despite the item description specifying that watch will break below 25% health, it is actually based on combined health (i.e. health plus shields), similar to the  Fuel Array. This allows the item and its drawback to function normally even for a character with more than three times as much shield as health, such as one holding a  Transcendence.
When falling below 25% health, the  Unstable Transmitter's effect has priority triggering, followed by the  Power Elixir's. Only when the Unstable Transmitter is on cooldown and all Power Elixirs are used will the Delicate Watch's effect trigger.


== Tips ==
Having an  Unstable Transmitter and/or a  Power Elixir can help prevent Delicate Watches from breaking, as their effects take priority over its own.
The Delicate Watch acts similiarly to  Focus Crystal but without the distance restriction. If the player can avoid breaking them, the Delicate Watch provides a damage increase at all distances.
Paying the second or third offering at a Shrine of Blood can break this item immediately. This can be negated with enough barrier or blocked by  Safer Spaces, among other methods.


== Lore ==
The wind blows over the plains. Two soldiers trudge along on their routine patrol, filling their boredom with casual conversation. "Hm. Hey, Shelly, have I ever showed you my new Patex?" Quinton mused. Shelly shot him a quizzical look. "Tell me you didn't bring a $75,000 watch with you on a dangerous expedition into unknown territories..."

Whirling around to face his partner, Quinton gave a hearty laugh. "Why, yes I did!" Rolling up his sleeve, a glint of gold revealed his collector's watch. The metal surface gleamed proudly, reflecting a ray of sunlight into the eyes of a hidden Lemurian. "What's the point of going through trials and tribulations in the middle of nowhere if I can't STYLE all over my fellow soldiers!?" Quinton laughed, pounding his fist to his chest. "I'm going to rub it in your face SO HARD when that thing inevitably breaks," Shelly chuckled. Quinton scoffed. "Oh, please. We've been along this route countless times, and nothing's happened. We're lucky to be stationed on a quiet sector of this hellhole, and I doubt our luck will run out any time soon."

As if on cue, the aggrivated Lemurian, annoyed by the glare, leapt from the bushes and shot a fireball. "Woah!" Shelly shouted, raising her gun and killing the beast. "Hah... So much about a quiet, sector, huh?" Shelly turned to her partner, who was doubled over on the ground. Shelly's face blanched.

"Oh no... Were you hit? We need to get you to a medic, fast...!"

"No." Quinton's voice was small and full of grief. "I'm perfectly fine, but..." Quinton looked up, revealing his gleaming Patex, having taken the fireball dead-on, had been reduced to a mangled mess of twisted metal and smoking polish. "L-Look what that BEAST did to my precious watch!"

For a moment, all was quiet on the plains. Then, the silence was yet again broken by Shelly's laughter and Quinton's desperate pleading.

== Trivia ==
This item's pickup quote on breaking is a reference to the common saying "A stopped clock is right twice a day".
This item's model in the Logbook displays accurate time according to the user's computer's time. Zooming in close enough will allow you to see the large clock hand move in real time.
The item's brand name of Patex in the log entry is most likely a reference to Patek Philippe, a famous Swiss watch brand that makes extremely expensive and, for the most part, delicate watches.

Common.name: Eclipse Lite
Common.desc: When a skill comes off cooldown, gain a temporary barrier for 1% (+0.25% per stack) of your maximum health per second of the skill's base cooldown.
Common.notes:
The Eclipse Lite is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
Whenever any of the user's skills come off cooldown, they gain barrier equal to 1% (+0.25% per stack) of their maximum health per second of the skill's base cooldown.


== Notes ==
Regaining charges of a skill through  Backup Magazines,  Hardlight Afterburner, and  Lysate Cell does not apply barrier.
Survivors that naturaly have extra charges to their skills (  Acrid's leaps,   Railgunner's mines,  False Son's spikes) can recharge barrier simultaniously.
It takes around 11 Eclipse Lites to combat natural barrier decay on its own.
  Bandit's Burst and Blast will not give barrier when reloading the barrel.


== Tips ==
  Mercenary can utilize the barrier gain very well due to his low skill cooldowns and   Expose  reducing them further.
  Drifter's   Trash to Treasure passive can make Eclipse Lite more effective by reducing her skill cooldowns while she is holding  Item Scrap, Yellow.
 Brainstalks allows you to gain large amounts of barrier as skills recharge quickly.
 Bandolier will activate Eclipse Lite for every skill on cooldown.
Reducing skill cooldowns through  Purity and  Alien Head is recommended, as getting skill charges don't give barrier and leave more time for skills to stay off cooldown, reducing barrier gains.
  Hungering Gaze grants a large amount of barrier when it reloads. This interaction may be unintended.

"Man, killing these aliens has got me all tuckered out. I could sure use a drink that restores my energy AND quenches my thirst!" Jean exclaimed as he finished off some Lemurians. Common.name: Elusive Antlers
Common.desc: Spawns orbs of energy nearby every 10s (-10% per stack) , giving +12% movement speed up to 3 (+3 per stack) times for 12s .
Common.notes:
Elusive Antlers is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
The item increases spawns 1-3 energy orbs every 10 seconds (-10% duration per stack). Energy orbs, when picked up, grant a 12% movement speed increase which can be stacked 3 times (+3 per stack) and lasts for 12 seconds.


== Notes ==
Energy orbs appear a short distance away in the direction that the holder is currently facing. Energy orbs will always appear on the ground, even if the holder is looking up.
Stacking the energy orb buff resets the buff's 12 second duration and further increases movement speed by 12% for each stack. Once 12 seconds pass without picking up another orb, all stacks of the buff are immediately removed.
The orbs have a minimum spawn time of 2 seconds, and cannot be lower than that.
Energy orbs from this item are a very consistent and easy way to help keep the stat buff from  Collector's Compulsion active for as long as possible.

Common.name: Energy Drink
Common.desc: Sprint speed is improved by 25% (+25% per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Energy Drink is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
While sprinting, the holder's movement speed increases by about 17.24% (+17.24% per stack). After accounting for the movement speed multiplier when sprinting, this comes to a final speed bonus of 25% (+25% per stack) while sprinting.


== Notes ==
This item is stronger on Survivors who have the Agile keyword on their skills, such as   Mercenary,   Huntress, or   False Son.
Like all speed-increasing items, grabbing an excessive amount will make it more difficult to maneuver.
The item does not raise the sprint speed multiplier; instead, it gives a movement bonus that only applies while sprinting. Because the multiplier is not affected, the Energy Drink does not improve other movement-related items, like  Paul's Goat Hoof.
When compared to  Paul's Goat Hoof while sprinting, the hoof provides a 20.3% increase in speed, while the energy drink's is of 25%. Keep in mind that while the hoof is active at all times, the drink is only of use if the character is sprinting, this also means energy drinks are of no use to the   final boss on the last phase.

Common.name: Focus Crystal
Common.desc: Increase damage to enemies within 13m by 20% (+20% per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Focus Crystal is an item introduced in the Skills 2.0 Update.
All damage the holder deals to enemies within 13m is increased by 20% (+20% per stack), whether direct or indirect. 


== Notes ==
The Focus Crystal's area of effect is indicated by a red ring on the ground around the holder.
All damage dealt by the Focus Crystal's holder is increased against nearby enemies, including damage-over-time effects such as {  Bleed.
The multiplier is applied to each hit individually, and total damage items are first calculated without the bonus. For example, assume that the player has 5 Focus Crystals and damages an enemy for 60 damage before accounting for the Focus Crystals. Assuming the enemy is within 13m of the player, the damage is boosted by 100% for 120 points. If this attack then activates an  AtG Missile Mk. 1, the missile will deal 300% of the base 60 damage, not the increased 120 damage, for a total of 180 damage. If the missile strikes an enemy within 13m of the player, it will then benefit from the Focus Crystals and deal an increased 360 damage.


== Tips ==
While this item is extremely powerful for melee Survivors who reliably fight close to enemies, all Survivors can expect at least some use out of this item.

Common.name: Gasoline
Common.desc: Killing an enemy ignites all enemies within 12m (+4m per stack) for 150% base damage . Additionally, enemies burn for 150% (+75% per stack) base damage.
Common.notes:
Gasoline is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
When the holder kills an enemy, it explodes in a burst of flame, dealing 150% damage to all enemies within 12m (+4m per stack) and   igniting them for 3 seconds (+1.5 seconds per stack), dealing 150% (+75% per stack) extra damage over the entire burn duration. 


== Notes ==
The in-game description is slightly misleading in that the damage dealt by the   ignite effect is not directly increased, only the duration of the effect is increased when additional stacks of Gasoline are acquired.


== Tips ==
The Forgive Me Please works well with this item, providing moderate damage over time in an area.
While generally outclassed by the  Will-o'-the-wisp, both the Gasoline and the Will-o'-the-wisp can work together to provide reliable area of affect damage.
It is worth noting that Gasoline applies a debuff which contributes to  Death Mark, while Will-o'-the-wisp does not.
The blast radius for Gasoline increases at a greater rate with additional stacks than Will-o'-the-wisp and has no delay to dealing damage when it triggers, making this an effective item to clear large groups of enemies.
Gasoline's   ignite damage is increased by  Ignition Tank, while Will-o'-the-wisp is unaffected by it.


== Lore ==
Audio transcription complete from signal echoes. Assigning generic tokens.

[Fire crackling]

MAN 1: D-do you think they're gonna come for us?

MAN 2: They'll try. It's going to be a very long while.

MAN 1: What? Why?

MAN 2: A long while. Even if they know where to look we'd be months out from the nearest port. And that's if they even have any ships as fast as ours – FTL ships are very rare nowadays.

MAN 1: Months...?! And what do you mean if they know where? What about the other ships on our shipping routes?

MAN 2: We weren't on the route.

[Fire pops]

MAN 1: What?!

MAN 2: We should've been halfway to Procyon by the time we crashed... but we weren’t. The ship never announced it was slowing down either, so that’ll make triangulating our positions even harder.

MAN 1: I-I don't get it. Who would take a UES train off course? That's completely insane!

MAN 2: I don’t know – only the Captain does. There’s no reason to slow down in this star system - there's not even supposed to be a habitable planet out here.

[Sizzling]

MAN 2: This looks cooked to me. Can't vouch for how it'll taste - but we have to eat.

MAN 1: I... I can't even think right now. I’m not hungry.

MAN 2: Eat. We've got a lot of traveling to do tomorrow and we'll need to keep our strength.

MAN 1: Sure. Okay. Okay. Um… do you think it's poisonous?

MAN 2: Eat.

End of requested transcript.

Common.name: Hiker's Boots
Common.desc: Striking enemies from a higher elevation grants +1% (+1% per stack) critical strike chance and critical strike damage , up to 10 times . Lasts 10 seconds.
Common.notes:
The Hiker's Boots are an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
When the player strikes an enemy below them, the item grants a buff that increases the player's critical strike chance and critical strike damage by 1% (+1% per stack), up to a maximum of 10 times. The effect lasts 10 seconds, and dealing any damage with a proc coefficient, regardless of elevation, refreshes the 10s duration. The buff will only be applied once in a proc chain.


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description does not specify the buff's duration resetting upon damaging enemies.
The buff's duration will be reset even if the player is below the enemy.
The item triggers when the attacker’s center is at least one radius (≈ half their height) above the target’s center, meaning the attacker’s feet only need to reach roughly the target’s mid-body to activate the bonus.


== Tips ==
 Hopoo Feather,  Faraday Spur, and  H3AD-5T v2 synergize very well with this item, allowing a consistent way to get above most enemies.
At 10 stacks or more of Hiker's Boots, you can reach 100% critical strike chance. Given this,  Lost Seer's Lenses are more appealing with Hiker's Boots, as  Lens-Maker's Glasses are no longer required to guarantee critical strikes.
Certain survivors will benefit greatly from this item, as they have ways to consistently stay above their enemies.
  Artificer's   Ion Surge combined with   ENV Suit.
  Mercenary can chain his skills together to stay in the air, along with his natural double jump.
  Operator's   Ascent Protocol with enough drones.
Due to   Railgunner's   Magnetic Accelerator, her critical strike damage will increase by 2% (+2% per item stack) per stack of the buff.

Common.name: Item Scrap, White
Common.desc: Does nothing. Prioritized when used with 3D Printers .
Common.notes:
Item Scrap is a group of items in Risk of Rain 2 with no passive effects. However, when using a 3D Printer or Cauldron, any Item Scrap of the required rarity will be prioritized and consumed before any other item. 
These items cannot be found normally. Instead, using a Scrapper to get rid of an item or a Drone Scrapper to get rid of a Drone will produce an Item Scrap of the same rarity:

White (Common) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, White
Green (Uncommon) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Green
Red (Legendary) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Red
Yellow (Boss) items produce  Item Scrap, Yellow


== Notes ==
The  Recycler cannot be used on these items, and they do not appear in Scrappers.
If the player uses a Shrine of Order while holding Item Scrap, it is possible for all their items of the same rarity as that Item Scrap to be transformed into Item Scrap.
If upgraded using  Benthic Bloom, it may transform into any item of the target rarity, unrestricted by category.
Despite working similarly to 3D Printers, no Item Scrap equivalent exists for use in Cleansing Pools.
If Artifact of Devotion is enabled, when a Lemurian follower is killed, it will drop one Scrap in the same tier as the item that was offered to hatch it.
Item Scraps  White,  Green, and  Red can be obtained through the Drone Scrapper.
Item Scraps can be duplicated via Crafting.


== Lore ==
All scrap have the same lore entry.

“While officially licensed materials are always recommended, hobbyists are known to take matters into their own hands when in a pinch. Don’t have any materials up to par? Make your own! Recycling old parts can be a fun way to create materials for your projects.”

- The Ultimate Hobby Guide: Kitbashing and 3D Printing

Common.name: Lens-Maker's Glasses
Common.desc: Your attacks have a 10% (+10% per stack) chance to ' Critically Strike ', dealing double damage .
Common.notes:
The Lens-Maker's Glasses are a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
The item increases the player's critical strike chance by 10% (+10% per stack). 


== Notes ==
Critical strikes are reflected by a sharper hit sound and a red tint on the damage numbers, if they are enabled.
Lens-Maker's Glasses have an effective stacking limit of 10. At 10 stacks a critical strike chance is guaranteed, effectively doubling all damage output.
Acquiring more than 10 stacks will bring no additional benefit unless the player is planning to eventually corrupt it to  Lost Seer's Lenses.
Critical strike chance is affected by Luck.
Critical strikes applies to the damage dealt by equipment, such as the  Royal Capacitor.
Critical strike chance is not affected by the damage source's proc coefficient. As an example, those using   MUL-T's   Auto-Nailgun will not have to collect additional Lens-Maker's Glasses to compensate for the skill's lowered chance to proc.
Critical strikes are calculated after items like  Focus Crystal and  Shaped Glass, doubling their effectiveness.
  Railgunner has a unique synergy with this item due to her   Magnetic Accelerator passive. Any critical strike chance is converted directly into critical strike damage, meaning this item would instead increase her critical strike damage by 10%. As such, this item can be stacked past 10 stacks and beyond for increased damage.


== Tips ==
While the effective limit for regular critical hit chance is 10 Lens-Maker's Glasses, it is wise to stop stacking at 9. The first stack of  Predatory Instincts,  Harvester's Scythe and  Shatterspleen all grant a 5% increase to critical strike chance, so holding at least two of the three items acts a substitute for a single Lens-Maker's Glasses.


== Lore ==
…What I didn’t see was that the golem was aiming its laser at my back. I managed to barely dodge it - just by pure luck - but the blast knocked me to the ground. My glasses flew off my face and I was on my back, stunned, barely able to make sense of myself…

And then... well, I can’t really explain what happened next. Adrenaline, some kind of divine intervention, I dunno. But I reached out, and managed to grab my glasses, raise ‘em up to my eyes so I could see, and BAM! Fired the last of my bullets.

And, well... I guess I managed to hit something vital in its head. Exploded in red stone and glass. It stopped moving after that. 

If it wasn’t for that shot, I wouldn’t be here telling this story.”

-Signal echoes, UES Contact Light

During the development of Risk of Rain 2, the Lens-Maker's Glasses had a different appearance than they do in the current version of the game.

Common.name: Medkit
Common.desc: 2 seconds after getting hurt, heal for 20 plus an additional 5% (+5% per stack) of maximum health .
Common.notes:
The Medkit is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Elite Slayer Challenge.
When the holder takes damage, they get the {  Medkit Heal buff for 2 seconds. When the buff expires, the holder recovers 20 HP, plus an additional 5% (+5% per stack) of their maximum health. 


== Notes ==
If the player takes damage again while they have the Medkit Heal buff, the buff's duration will be reset and they will have to avoid damage for another 2 seconds to receive healing. This makes the item ineffective for recovering from most damage-over-time effects or rapidly-firing attacks.
As {  Medkit Heal is a buff, it can not be cleared to activate its effects early by using  Blast Shower.


== Tips ==
At 20+ stacks, receiving Medkit healing will fully recover the player's health. The number required to do this is reduced by having any  Rejuvenation Racks; having one Rack requires half as many Medkits (10), having two Racks requires a third as many (7), so on and so forth.
If the player intentionally takes damage less than the amount they would recover, such as slight fall damage or suffocation from the   Void Fields, the Medkit can be used to gain net positive health, albeit slowly.
 Tougher Times can afford the player more opportunities to heal, as it can block damage that would otherwise reset the Medkit's charge time.
Obtaining the  Strides of Heresy affords the player enough time to receive the Medkit's healing, in addition to the extra healing that comes from   Shadowfade. This comes at the cost of that Survivor's utility skill.


== Lore ==
"I suggest you stay indoors and rest."

MED-E, the medical bot, has been working overtime. The survivors felt very grateful that their escape pod landed near Med Bay cargo - they would have most likely perished without it.

"I suggest you stay indoors and rest."

The robot was speaking to a tall man, gaunt but strong. "I'd love to, but we're running low on food." Even though his expression was hidden underneath his blue combat helmet, it was obvious the man was extremely tired. "And everyone else is recovering from last night's attacks. Without the enforcers, we probably wouldn't have-"

"I suggest you stay indoors and rest." 

It was apparent that MED-E only had a limited set of lines. However, the man continued to respond. "I can't, MED-E. They're counting on me. You know that."

"I suggest you stay indoors and rest." 

This time the man did not humor a reply. Grabbing his shotgun, he turned away from the echoing robot. Weaving his way between countless sleeping bags and stretchers, he set out into the wilderness again. Everyone was counting on him.

"Please stay indoors and rest." 


== Trivia ==
The soldier in the logbook entry might be an Enforcer, which is a playable character in Risk of Rain and Risk of Rain Returns. This is suggested by their blue combat helmet, shotgun, and their statement, "And everyone else is recovering from last night's attacks. Without the enforcers, we probably wouldn't have-"

Common.name: Monster Tooth
Common.desc: Killing an enemy spawns a healing orb that heals for 8 plus an additional 2% (+2% per stack) of maximum health .
Common.notes:
The Monster Tooth is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
When the holder kills an enemy, a healing orb spawns where that enemy died, which heals the player for 8 HP plus an additional 2% (+2% per stack) of their maximum health when collected. The orbs last for roughly 10 seconds each, and will blink when about to expire. 


== Notes ==
The player must approach the orbs to pick them up, although the orbs will automatically come to the player at a short distance.
This item is much stronger on melee Survivors, since the player will always be close to the enemies they defeat.
Obtaining 50 stacks of Monster Teeth grants 100% healing per orb. This is reduced with  Rejuvenation Racks; having one Rack requires half as many Monster Teeth (25), having two Racks requires a third as many (17), so on and so forth.
The Forgive Me Please works well with this item, since it will spawn the orbs 8 times while in its duration. The player must take care to throw the doll somewhere nearby, though, or else the orbs will be wasted.
Each stack increases the size of the healing orbs slightly, although this change is barely noticable at lower stack amounts


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM ROOM 5041C OF UES [Redacted] --//

“Hey, nice duds! Where’d you grab those?”

“Oh, this old thing? I’ve been making it, actually.”

“Making it?”

“Yeah, well, I found the first tooth in one of the chests. But every time we go out on patrol, we typically run into more of those aliens. Once we take care of ‘em, I try to pick myself out a souvenir. Y’know, to add to my collection.”

“Wow, uh… Is that like, allowed? I feel like that’s not allowed.”

“Eh, what the captain doesn’t know won’t hurt him. Besides, it IS cool, right?”

“I guess so. I’ll be honest man, that’s creepy as hell… but hey, do you have any more string? I might start one of my own.”

Common.name: Oddly-shaped Opal
Common.desc: Increase armor by 100 (+100 per stack) while out of danger.
Common.notes:
The Oddly-shaped Opal is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion.
After 7 seconds of not taking damage, the holder gets the {  Opal Armor buff, increasing armor by 100 (+100 per stack) until they take damage again.


== Math ==
The amount of damage that the Opal mitigates can be quickly found with Opals/(Opals+1). One Opal reduces damage by 50%, two by 66.66%, so on and so forth. This value differs slightly depending on the character's base armor, however.

Because armor stacks hyperbolically, having more than a few Opals quickly becomes redundant; for instance, having 5 Opals gives 83.33% damage reduction, while having 6 gives 85.71% damage reduction.


== Notes ==
If a hit is negated by  Tougher Times or  Safer Spaces, the Opal Armor buff is not lost.
Damage taken from the Shrine of Blood or   REX's "plant" skills that consume health will also cause the Opal Armor buff to be lost. These damage sources are also not reduced by armor, so the Opal will not decrease the costs.


== Tips ==
This item pairs exceptionally well with Safer Spaces, allowing the player to completely negate 1 incoming hit and then greatly mitigate another.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM UES [Redacted] --//

"...You think this planet is as bad as they say?"

Liz sat in silence among her fellow soldiers. She, like the rest of her squadron, had been taken from the middle of a firefight in the galactic outback and brought before an old UES veteran. Liz was used to debriefing by now, it all blended together in her head. Something about monsters, and the missing UES Contact Light.

"...Dunno." Liz murmured as she turned a small, oddly-shaped hunk of opal in her hand. It was one of the only things she had that reminded her of Parker. Of when things were calm, and peaceful.

"...Heh, I don't think a shiny rock will do much," A soldier joked. Liz's brow furrowed under her helmet. "Yeah, probably not... but..."

Liz took a deep breath and slipped the opal back into her pocket. "It just helps."

Common.name: Paul's Goat Hoof

Common.notes:
Paul's Goat Hoof is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.  It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the "Is This Bugged?" Challenge.
The item increases the player's base movement speed by 14% (+14% per stack).   


== Notes ==
This speed bonus is calculated before any other speed bonus in the game; speed gained from  Warbanner,  Berzerker's Pauldron, and other speed-boosting items is added on top of the speed from the amount of goat hooves in the player's inventory.
The  Spinel Tonic, however, multiplies final movement speed, thereby enhancing all speed-boosting items.
When compared to the  Energy Drink while sprinting, the hoof provides a 20.3% increase in speed, while the energy drink's is of 25%. Keep in mind that while the hoof is active at all times, the drink is only of use if the character is sprinting, this also means energy drinks are of no use to the   final boss on the last phase.

Common.name: Power Elixir
Common.desc: Taking damage to below 25% health consumes this item, healing you for 75% of maximum health .
Common.notes:
The Power Elixir is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion. 
When the holder takes damage that brings them below 25% of their maximum health, this item is consumed and they are healed for 75% of their maximum health. This effect will only consume a single stack of this item. Consumed Power Elixirs are transformed into  Empty Bottles, which do nothing and can not be scrapped.


== Notes ==
While the player is holding this item, a faint black line will appear over the health bar at the 25% mark, signifying when this item's effect will trigger.
Paying the second or third offering at a Shrine of Blood will immediately consume a Power Elixir.
If the player falls below 25% health with their   healing disabled from a   Malachite Elite, all Power Elixirs are consumed at once. No health is recovered, since healing is impossible, so all the Power Elixirs are wasted.
This scenario is more likely to occur than it seems, when considering that Malachite Elites deal 6 times as much damage as a non-Elite monster.


== Tips ==
If the player falls below 25% health while holding both a Power Elixir and a  Delicate Watch, the Power Elixir triggers first, healing the player and preventing the watch from breaking.
  Engineer's turrets can hold out longer against a overwhelming surge of enemies, as long as Engineer himself has some unspent Power Elixirs. Anytime a turret gets low on health, it will consume its own Power Elixirs and stay in the fight for a little while longer.

Common.name: Repulsion Armor Plate
Common.desc: Reduce all incoming damage by 5 (+5 per stack) . Cannot be reduced below 1 .
Common.notes:
The Repulsion Armor Plate is an item in Risk of Rain 2.  
The item reduces all damage taken by 5 (+5 per stack), but it cannot reduce damage taken below 1. 


== Tips ==
This item is most effective at counteracting damage over time effects inflicted by enemies, as each individual damage tick is affected by the flat damage reduction. This also includes multiple low damage hits from enemies like   Clay Templar,   Lesser Wisp or   Lunar Chimera (Wisp), though their level also plays a huge factor as the reduction of the armor plate is flat.
The damage reduction from this item is applied after the damage reduction from armor.
The Repulsion Armor Plate pairs well with the  Planula, since the Planula's healing triggers when damaged and the Armor Plate reduces that damage taken. It's possible to gain health rapidly when attacked with rapid and weak damage.
Both the Armor Plate and Planula fall off in effectiveness as the difficulty increases, however.
This item does not block damage from the Void Fog.

Common.name: Roll of Pennies
Common.desc: Gain 3 (+3 per stack) gold on taking damage from an enemy. Scales over time.
Common.notes:
The Roll of Pennies is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion. 
Whenever the holder takes damage, they gain gold equal to 12% the cost of a Small Chest. This value starts at 3 gold (+3 per stack) and is multiplied by the difficulty coefficient. 


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description mentioning that the damage must originate from an enemy is incorrect, the item's effect is triggered for sources of damage originating from a character other than the holder of the item.
This means self-damaging effects, such as the  Helfire Tincture,   REX's "plant" skills,   Captain's Diablo Strike, and   Void Fiend's Corrupted Suppress do not trigger it.
However, in Multiplayer,   Captain's Diablo Strike and  Helfire Tincture can be used by a different player on this item's holder to gain extra money, while the former is an extremely impractical method, the latter is very profitable to an almost gamebreaking degree earlygame: since the hellfire damage ticks 5 times per second and lasts up to 15 seconds, activating it will trigger roll of pennies a total of 75 times for a gold amount equal to the price of 9 small chests, the total burn damage caused is 30% of the hellfire holder's max HP to themselves and 15% of the hellfire holder's max HP to the roll of pennies holder's HP (this means that, depending on how much health the hellfire holder has, the roll of pennies holder will take varying amounts of damage), but both values can be reduced drastically with even a single  Repulsion Armor Plate or  Planula, or compensated with any healing items.
The {  Void Fog and fall damage also do not trigger it as they are sources of damage not linked to any character.
The explosive containers in   Abandoned Aqueduct and   Rallypoint Delta do trigger it as they are immovable characters.
A projectile or persistent attack, such as the   Mini Mushrum's Blazing Pool, that hits the player after the enemy has died will not trigger the effect. Dying here does not mean the enemy's health reaching zero, but the enemy's death animation completing. As such, the   Lunar Chimera's (Exploder) death effect will not trigger the item since the blazing pool in this case spawns after the death animation has finished.
An animation of a flying gold coin will play when this item's effect activates, and the animation will show more coins the more stacks the player has.


== Tips ==
This item activates on any instance of enemy damage, regardless of its proc coefficient. This includes damage over time effects, which will activate the item's effect for every individual tick of damage.
This means that intentionally letting enemies inflict {  Burn or {  Bleed can be an effective way to rapidly generate money, especially when combined with a  Repulsion Armor Plate to mitigate the damage. Note that  Ben's Raincoat renders this strategy somewhat less effective.
Taking damage from a   Solus Probe's beam, or standing in the damage zone of a   Mini Mushrum's spore bomb are also effective ways to generate money.


== Lore ==
The sounds of gunfire rang in Johnson's ears. Biting down and tugging on the bandage covering his wounded leg, he hastily reloaded his firearm.

For a moment, before he fired on the Lemurians who had pinned his team into a corner and already claimed two of his friends, Johnson reflected on what brought him here.

Johnson had grown up in poverty, the oldest of three children. He had started working at a young age to support his sick mother and younger siblings, and all his life he bounced from one odd job to the next. Anything that could rake in the cash. Anything that would pay the bills.

"'An expedition into unknown territories, seeking volunteers,'" his recruiter read in between puffs of his cigar. "Lot of classified info, don't know too much myself... But it pays a lot. And I know you need the money. You in, Johnny-boy?" At the time, Johnson had thought to himself, 'it couldn't be that bad.'

Johnson returned to the battlefield, gunning down Lemurians in an effort to save his remaining friends. The wound on his leg ached, dying the bandage red with blood. 'It couldn't be that bad,' he had thought. "Yeah, right." Johnson scoffed. "At least I'm getting paid after this."

Common.name: Rusted Key
Common.desc: A hidden cache containing an item ( 80% / 20% ) will appear in a random location on each stage . Opening the cache consumes this item.
Common.notes:
The Rusted Key is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Keyed Up Challenge.
Each stage, a Rusty Lockbox spawns for each player holding a Rusted Key. The lockbox's contents are the same as a Large Chest, with an 80% chance to contain an uncommon item and a 20% chance to contain a legendary item. One key is consumed upon opening a lockbox.


== Notes ==
Rusty Lockboxes will spawn even if the Artifact of Sacrifice is enabled.
Lockboxes will only start spawning the stage after the player picks up the key; it does not modify the current stage when obtained.
The quantity of lockboxes per stage is only related to the number of players that have keys; the number of keys held by each individual player does not matter.
For this reason, players who have more keys than the rest should try to unlock lockboxes for other players, so that each player can still hold onto at least 1 key to spawn as many lockboxes as possible.
Temporary Rusted Keys are prioritized over permanent Rusted Keys when opening Rusty Lockboxes.

Common.name: Soldier's Syringe
Common.desc: Increases attack speed by 15% (+15% per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Soldier's Syringe is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
The item increases attack speed by 15% (+15% per stack), decreasing the intervals between individual attacks and increasing the animation speed of all skills. This also means that any attack that needs to charge, such as Artificer's   Charged Nano-Bomb will charge faster as well.


== Notes ==
The Soldier's Syringe only increases the animation speed of skills; it does not affect their cooldowns. Most primary skills have no cooldown, the exceptions being   Artificer,   Bandit,   MUL-T, and  Heretic. This does not mean that Syringes are useless on these Survivors, though. Their primary skills will still be used faster (aside from Bandit who will reload faster instead), and there are other tangible benefits such as Artificer's Primary reloading faster.
Higher attack speed will shorten the charge time for Artificer's   Charged Nano-Bombs  and   Cast Nano-Spears  and increase the number of times   Flamethrower hits. Even a slight increase in attack speed can drastically enhance Flamethrower and allow faster bombs and spears.
  Captain's   Vulcan Shotgun, narrows its spread more rapidly with greater attack speed, in addition to having reduced ending lag between shots.
Notably, attack speed does not affect how long it takes for   Orbital Probe,   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike, or   Orbital Supply Beacon to land.
Bandit's primaries   Burst and   Blast can be used as fast as the player can press the button, which is not affected by attack speed boosts. However, more attack speed will allow them to reload faster.
Higher attack speed also speeds up the animations for   Lights Out and   Desperado, reducing the delay between activating the skill and dealing damage.
MUL-T's   Scrap Launcher  can be fired faster with greater attack speed, and the Syringe applies to both of MUL-T's selected primary attacks.
Both   Railgunner's   Supercharge and   Cryocharge will prepare to fire and fire faster with increased attack speed, and Supercharge's reboot time is shortened by attack speed improvements.
Railgunner's   Active Reload presents a larger perfect reload window with increased attack speed.
Heretic's   Slicing Maelstrom secondary will charge faster with Syringes, allowing her to dispose of groups of monsters more quickly.
This also applies for any Survivor equipped with the  Hooks of Heresy.
As a consequence of the game engine, the max attack speed is capped at 60 attacks per second, but it may vary depending on the survivor.

The Sticky Bomb is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
On hit, the holder has a 5% (+5% per stack) chance to attach a sticky bomb to an enemy. The sticky bomb explodes after 1.5 seconds, dealing 180% total damage in a 10m radius with a proc coefficient of 0.0. The explosion suffers from sweet spot falloff.

== Lore ==
In the blaring heat, a silhouette could be seen, hiding in the cool shade of a nearby cave. She was waiting for the sandstorm to pass.

She heard a noise and turned around, recognizing another silhouette. It bounded into the cave with excitement. As the figure got closer, she alarmingly noticed the cargo.

"Woah, what the hell?! Why are you holding like, fifty bombs? Get away from me! "

"What! We need these – this planet is trying to kill us! "

"You’re a walking bomb. Those are so unstable. Get away! Where did you even find those things? "

"I found an industrial 3D printer nearby, and it was assigned to the blueprints of these bombs. Awesome, right? Unlimited bombs!"

"…What materials?"

"Huh?"

"What materials did you put in? We barely had anything."

"I just put in everything."

Common.name: Stun Grenade
Common.desc: 5% (+5% on stack) chance on hit to stun enemies for 2 seconds .
Common.notes:
The Stun Grenade is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
On hit, it gives a 5% (+5% per stack) chance to stun most non-boss enemies, interrupting most attacks and locking them in place for 2 seconds. 


== Notes ==
The Stun Grenade is one of the few items in the game with hyperbolic stacking.
The chance to trigger is multiplied by the proc coefficient of the attack.


== Tips ==
  Commando can utilize the Stun Grenade well, since his primary   Double Tap deals rapid damage with a proc coefficient of 1.0. This also makes   Suppressive Fire irrelevant when it comes to stunning enemies, as Double Tap has no cooldown and should easily proc the Stun Grenade from time to time.
  MUL-T can use the Stun Grenade similarly with   Auto-Nailgun, although this has a lower proc coefficient and much wider spread.
Stunning an enemy is not considered a debuff, and thus does not contribute towards  Death Mark.
Stunning an already stunned enemy resets the time stunned back to 2 seconds rather than stacking in overall duration.


== Math ==
The chance to activate is determined by the formula: f(x)=(1−10.05x+1)=0.05x0.05x+1
Where x is the amount.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM CARGO BAY 2 OF UES [Redacted] --//

“Inventory duty. I swear, this must be the most boring position ever...” Two crewmates stood in the cargo bay, doing a routine check on the items gathered from the Contact Light’s wreckage. “Some of us are out there having adventures and fighting aliens, and I’M stuck in here counting dusty knick-knacks. What a bummer.” The other crewmate idly tapped at their device as their colleague rummaged through a container of recovered items.

“Can’t agree there. The Contact Light had millions of items in transit... It’s like a collage of people’s interests from all across the galaxy.” The other crew member scoffed. “Oh yeah? That’s really inspiring. Say, keep telling those stories, maybe it’ll make this go by quicker.”

“You just need to look at this from a different angle. There’s so much cool stuff in here! Like, for example...” The worker took something out of a container – glancing over at their colleague, the other worker stiffened.

“What the—is that a grenade!?” 

The worker laughed, tossing the dusty and dirty grenade from hand to hand. “Yeah. Don’t worry, thing was damaged in the crash. See? Completely harmless.” Holding the grenade up, a large dent was visible in its hull. “Man, I wonder what kind of model this is... I was always super interested in like, weaponry and stuff. Hm... looks to be a flashbang... old model, they don’t make these things anymore.” 

The other worker was not so thrilled. “I still don’t think you should play with that. That’s not a toy.” Squinting, the other worker realized in horror that the defunct grenade had no pin. “D-DUDE! Put that thing down, there’s no pin!”

“Huh? Oh, come on! Stop being such a buzzkill! This thing is busted beyond repair. It can’t even detonate, not even if I were to say... bang it against this table. Watch, I’ll show you.”

They were both admitted to the medical bay shortly after.

Common.name: Topaz Brooch
Common.desc: Gain a temporary barrier on kill for 15 health (+15 per stack) .
Common.notes:
The Topaz Brooch is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
Whenever the holder kills a monster, they gain 15 barrier (+15 barrier per stack). 


== Notes ==
Barriers do not grant one-shot protection, but also do not interact with HP-based one-shot protection.
The maximum amount of barrier obtainable is equal to the player's maximum health plus their maximum shields.
The  Forgive Me Please works somewhat well with this item, triggering the Topaz Brooch a total of 8 times per activation.
Barrier depletes at a rate of 3.33% of the player's max health per second, but the Topaz Brooch grants a fixed amount of barrier per stack. High stacks of Topaz Brooches are required to keep the barrier sustained late-game.
As a result, the Topaz Brooch becomes generally outclassed by  Aegis once the player has enough healing items to sustain it, especially since many healing items do scale with the player's health.

Common.name: Tougher Times
Common.desc: 15% (+15% per stack) chance to block incoming damage . Unaffected by luck .
Common.notes:
Tougher Times is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Learning Process Challenge.
The item grants a 15% (+15% per stack) chance of negating incoming damage.  If the roll is successful, the damage will be negated and a "Blocked!" message will appear instead of damage numbers.  


== Notes ==
Self-inflicted damage from the  Helfire Tincture, Shrines of Blood, and   REX's "plant" skills can be blocked.
When a hit is blocked successfully, on-hit effects will not trigger. These include but are not limited to the lightning bombs from Overloading Elites,   Bleed,   Burn,   Poison, and   Weak.
The item will not block a   Void Reaver death implosion, since the implosion does not actually deal damage. Similarly,   Mercenary's invincibility on either of his utilities and his default special, and   invulnerability in general, will not block the implosions either.
Tougher Times is one of the few items in the game with Hyperbolic Stacking.
The corrupted version of this item, released in the Survivors of the Void expansion, is  Safer Spaces.
Tougher Times cannot block damage inflicted by the   Void Fog debuff.

Where x is the amount.

== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM ROOM 4211B OF UES [Redacted] --//

"Why'd you sign up?"

Wyatt's voice was bored. The mission to the Contact Light's last known location was taking longer than he expected.

Malik was on the floor, cleaning her rifle. "To get paid, mostly."

"And that's it?"

She grunted in affirmation. She continued to wipe down the weapon.

"I'm here to find something." He continued. "I shipped it a few years back, but I don't think it made it before the train went down. I'm guessing it's still in the Contact Light. So I'm gonna get it back."

She began to tighten the last remaining bolts. Her routine near completion, she moved her gaze to Wyatt. "Seriously?"

"Yep!"

Malik raised her brow. "There were over 7 million security chests in the Contact Light. The chance of you finding a specific one is impossible." She began to unfold her legs as she propped her rifle in the corner. "And according to the distress beacon, the Contact Light was destroyed in orbit. Your shipment is probably floating around in space. It's all gone, Wyatt."

He grinned. "I think I'm gonna find it."

"You're terrible."

Common.name: Tri-Tip Dagger
Common.desc: 10% (+10% per stack) chance to bleed an enemy for 240% base damage .
Common.notes:
The Tri-Tip Dagger is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
On hit, it gives a 10% (+10% per stack) chance to inflict   Bleed on the target (which is multiplied by the hit's proc coefficient), dealing a total of 240% damage across (3 x proc coefficient) seconds (20% per tick, 4 ticks per second).


== Notes ==
Unlike most other damage-over-time debuffs, an existing stack of Bleed will have its duration extended when a new stack with a longer duration is inflicted (e.g. if a stack has 1 second remaining but a new 3-second stack is inflicted, the 1-second stack is refreshed to 3 seconds). This means Bleed can be stacked infinitely as long as it is continuously inflicted.
However, hits with a low proc coefficient will inflict shorter-duration stacks of Bleed, meaning that even with 100% Bleed chance, the window to inflict the next Bleed stack to refresh existing ones is much narrower.
The Tri-Tip Dagger's chance to activate stacks linearly 10%. With 10 daggers, attacks with 1.0 proc chance will have a 100% chance to bleed.
This item's Bleed effect is the same debuff as the Bleed inflicted by the  Shatterspleen; if both items are held, only one stack of Bleed can be inflicted per hit.
This item and  Noxious Thorn both contribute towards the same chance to apply bleed on-hit, and do not roll independently of each other.

== Trivia ==
The Tri-Tip Dagger is the successor to the Rusty Knife from Risk of Rain 1, which has a virtually identical effect.
This item is based on a real type of knife known as a tri-edge dagger or simply a tri-dagger, which features three spiraling blade edges that meet at the tip. This type of dagger causes more serious internal damage than a traditional blade and the triangular wound inflicted is more difficult to properly suture. This has resulted in some urban legends falsely claiming that due to the long suffering inflicted on a victim, the dagger's use is ruled a war crime.

Common.name: Warbanner
Common.desc: On level up or starting the Teleporter event , drop a banner that strengthens all allies within 16m (+8m per stack) . Raise attack and movement speed by 30% .
Common.notes:
The Warbanner is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
When the holder levels up, or when a Teleporter Boss spawns, a banner appears at the holder's location. All allies within a 16m (+8m per stack) radius of a banner get the {  Warbanner buff, giving them 30% increased attack speed and movement speed. 


== Notes ==
While the radius scales linearly, the area of the Warbanner's effect scales quadratically (Area = π ⋅ r²). This means that in multiplayer, it is stronger to stack this item on one player rather than across several players. 2 players with 1 Warbanner each would cover 1,608.5 square meters, while 1 player with 2 Warbanners would cover 1809.6 square meters.
The banner's area of effect is indicated by a large yellow sphere.
The Warbanner works well for   Engineer's   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turrets, since they cannot move out of the banner's area of effect and will always get the bonus attack speed.
The Warbanner is one of the few blacklisted items that Engineer's turrets will not inherit.


== Lore ==
Heavy losses were expected – after all, the invaders were as cunning as they were deadly. 

The dust had at last settled. The Golems had returned to the earth, and the Lemurians had returned to their tunnels. It was a long and grueling battle, but they had won. The invaders had been purged.

The only proof of their last stand was a single banner, fluttering in the wind, flying over a mountain of corpses.

Common.name: Warped Echo
Common.desc: The next source of damage is reduced by 10% and spread into 3 (+1 per stack) hits . All echoed damage is non-lethal except for the final hit. Recharges every 15s .
Common.notes:
The Warped Echo is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion. 
The next source of damage dealt to the holder will be reduced by 10% and split into 3 "echoed" hits (+1 per stack) dealt in 0.75 second intervals. All echoed hits are non-lethal except for the last one.
After splitting damage once, the item goes on cooldown for 15 seconds.


== Notes ==
The damage reduction happens after OSP, so you'd end up taking 81% damage instead of 90%.
Due to how One Shot Protection works, Warped Echo can prevent death at above 90% health regardless of how much curse you have.
Curse does not remove OSP, it simply limits damage taken to 100% of your combined health.
As such, at full health, lethal damage is limited, then reduced by 10%, then split into 3 parts, resulting in 90% damage taken.
Even at lower than 90% health, your health regeneration inbetween the echoes may heal you enough to still survive.
Damage increases (such as     ) will increase the damage twice, once when going in and then when echoed.
This allows Warped Echo to still bypass One Shot Protection, as while the initial damage is limited to 90% after the increase, the individual Echoed hits may total over 100% health.
Look out for this interaction when using   Captain's   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike on yourself.
While the Warped Echo is charged, it displays a unique status effect above the health bar and surrounds the holder in a yellow-green bubble.
After taking damage, a new status effect is added and revolving orbs appear around the holder to represent how many echoed hits are remaining.
Split damage that has not been dealt yet is displayed in dark red on players' health bar.
Unlike other items with cooldowns, such as  Safer Spaces and  Breaching Fin, there is not any status effect to indicate that the Warped Echo is on cooldown.
The status effects on the damage will not be applied a second time.
If the damage is blocked or cancelled (such as by  Tougher Times), Warped Echo will not activate.


== Tips ==
This item can trigger these items multiple times:
 Roll of Pennies
 Tougher Times
 Razorwire
The splitting of damage can give you time to heal and potentially save your life,  Delicate Watches, and/or  Power Elixirs.
The delay allows you to use invinciblity to try and dodge following echoed hits, allowing you to further reduce damage taken. This also allows you to avoid death by becoming invincible during the lethal hit.

Uncommon.name: AtG Missile Mk. 1
Uncommon.desc: 10% chance to fire a missile that deals 300% (+300% per stack) TOTAL damage .
Uncommon.notes:
The AtG Missile Mk. 1 is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
On hitting an enemy, the player has a 10% chance to launch a homing missile that deals 300% (+300% per stack) total damage with a proc coefficient of 1.0. This chance to trigger is multiplied by the proc coefficient of the attack.  


== Notes ==
This item is extremely powerful on any character when stacked, especially in combination with other total damage items such as the  Ukulele and  Molten Perforator.
Two AtGs is enough to activate  Kjaro's Band and  Runald's Band with almost any attack, making these items viable for Survivors who don't have a high-damage skill.
AtGs will critical strike if the hit that fired the missle is also a critical strike. Therefore AtGs will benefit from the effects of  Lens-Maker's Glasses  and  Harvester's Scythe.


== Lore ==
Fixing a spare bayonet onto his shotgun, he glanced at the horizon. The thundering of footsteps big and small was growing louder and louder – they were nearly upon him. He went over his kit one last time.

Five bayonets. Twenty three packs of incendiary explosives. Fifteen magazines of armor-piercing ammunition. Thirty three sticky bombs. Four tear-gas grenades, and so on.

And his favorite – two shoulder-mounted missile launchers, loaded with six AtG Viper Missiles. Heat seeking, detonation power of 15 pounds of TNT per missile. Light-weight, and the best part – automatic firing mechanism. He initially favored a more analog approach to his weapons, but the thing had grown on him.

Turning to face the oncoming mob, he loaded his shotgun. The adrenaline started pumping.

“Bring it on.”

Damage: 300% (+300% per stack) additive damage ⇒ 300% (+300% per stack) total damage
To compensate for the Crit fix, we’ve moved over on-hit effects to deal a percentage of TOTAL damage. That is, if you have a proc that deals 300% damage from an attack that hits for 100, it will hit for 300. Previously it was a complicated additive formula - this change is either neutral or a buff for every character, and GREATLY benefits slow, high-damage attacks like the Artificer’s.

Uncommon.name: Bandolier
Uncommon.desc: 18% (+10% per stack) chance on kill to drop an ammo pack that resets all skill cooldowns .
Uncommon.notes:
The Bandolier is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
When the holder kills an enemy, there is an 18% (+10% per stack) chance that the enemy will drop an ammo pack. When collected, the ammo pack resets all skill cooldowns.


== Notes ==
Any ally (including non-player allies) can collect the ammo pack, not just the player who has the Bandolier.
For skills that have multiple charges, such as   Engineer's turrets or secondary skills with  Backup Magazine, an ammo pack will refresh whatever one full recharge grants, usually only one charge, and the next charge will start from full cooldown.
The exceptions to this are   Hungering Gaze, granted by the  Visions of Heresy, and   Scrap Launcher since these skills recover all stacks at once when their cooldown finishes.
The drop chance is affected by Luck.
Picking up an ammo pack does not reset equipment cooldown.


== Tips ==
Activating the  Forgive Me Please with a Bandolier drops up to 8 ammo packs.


== Math ==
The chance to drop an ammo pack is determined by the formula 1−1/(1+x)0.33, with x being the amount of bandoliers.

Uncommon.name: Berzerker's Pauldron
Uncommon.desc: Killing 4 enemies within 1 second sends you into a frenzy for 6s (+4s per stack) . Increases movement speed by 50% and attack speed by 100% .
Uncommon.notes:
The Berzerker's Pauldron is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Glorious Battle Challenge.
When the holder kills 4 enemies in quick succession, they get the   War Cry buff for 6 seconds (+4 seconds per stack), which grants a 50% increase in movement speed and a 100% increase in attack speed. 


== Notes ==
Correction: All 4 enemies do not have to be killed within 1 second. The Pauldron activates when the player's multikill streak reaches 4 or more, and the streak only resets if 1 second passes without killing an enemy.


== Tips ==
Characters with powerful crowd control abilities such as   Artificer,   Loader, and   Captain can make much more reliable use of this item.
Items that deal powerful area damage, such as  Will-o'-the-wisp and  Ukulele, can make activating this item's effect easier.
Although the  Forgive Me Please activates on-kill effects, it alone cannot activate the Berzerker's Pauldron. The doll registers a "kill" once per second, which is too slow to maintain a multikill streak on its own. It will still make activating the Pauldron easier, however.
Having a  Fuel Cell makes it possible to have 2 dolls active at once, which is sufficient to activate the Berzerker's Pauldron.
The War Cry buff does not stack with the   Team War Cry buff from  Gorag's Opus. In fact, the two buffs cannot coexist, so whichever is activated later can overwrite the other. This is important if one has at least a few stacks for a long duration for Berzerker's Pauldron but activates the Gorag's Opus, which will bring down the duration to just 7 seconds.

Uncommon.notes:
Breaching Fin is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
When the holder hits a grounded enemy, it is knocked vertically into the air and gains 2 stacks of   Breaching Fin Debuff (+1 per stack). Enemies with the debuff take 10% increased damage from all sources for each stack of the debuff inflicted. When hit, debuffed enemies are launched upward again and lose one stack of the debuff. After losing all stacks of the debuff, the damage penalty is cleared and the enemy will no longer launch upward on hit. 
After triggering the item once, it is put on cooldown for 10 seconds.


== Notes ==
The   Breaching Fin Ready status effect above the health bar indicates whether it is charged or not. The effect changes to   Breaching Fin Cooldown while it is recharging, but unlike   Elemental Rings Cooldown and   Singularity Band Cooldown, the recharge period is not indicated with multiple stacks.
The   Breaching Fin Debuff will automatically clear itself after a short delay if the inflicted enemy falls to the ground and is not hit again.
This item does not work on mid-air enemies, enemies immune to fall damage, and any enemy that is not on the ground.
It does, however, work on champions, bosses, and final bosses.
This item can be used to inflict  Marked for Death.


== Lore ==
Order: Breaching Fin
Estimated Delivery: 01/01/2057
Shipping method: Biological
Shipping Address: Fort Joseph, UES B1053 Port Station, Boron System
Shipping details:

Impressed? I know you are.
We finally cleared our grid, but man did it put up a fight. We lost James and Kight. This fin knocked them off the U.E.S.S. [REDACTED] with so much force we heard them hit the water in pieces. At least it was quick.

There isn’t a speck of land on this blasted planet but now it’s safe enough to build our first dock. It’s not land, but it’s a step up from this flotsam. I won’t miss giant sea creatures bumping the ship in the night, or losing my lunch to this damn swaying.

Get us a good commission for it will ya? And send down some playing cards, the silence is killing us. 

- Private Bowen

Uncommon.name: Chronobauble
Uncommon.desc: Slow enemies on hit for -60% movement speed for 2s (+2s per stack) .
Uncommon.notes:
The Chronobauble is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
When the holder damages an enemy, that enemy is   slowed by 60% for 2 seconds (+2 seconds per stack). 


== Notes ==
Unlike many other on-hit debuff effects, the Chronobauble is completely unaffected by the hit's proc coefficient. The slowness debuff will always have the same duration when inflicted, regardless of the attack.
Since this item only affects movement speed and not attack speed, this item's benefits are negligible on enemies that use ranged attacks.
The slow effect can be used to keep close-range enemies such as   Imps at a distance, or to activate the  Death Mark.
Some other close range enemies include   Blind Vermin and   Mithrix.


== Lore ==
Order: Chronobauble

Tracking Number: 99******

Estimated Delivery: 03/03/2066

Shipping Method: Priority

Shipping Address: 9042 Pvt. Drive, Yustik Plaza, Mercury

Shipping Details:

Weren't you just a kid? Summer break feels like it was just so recent - but it's been 10 years, hasn't it? Life moves faster and faster as you get older - less moments to remember, to cement you in time. I don't even remember being 25. How did I forget an entire year?

Anyways - I found this in a trinket shop on Mercury. A chronobauble - the seller said something about special relativity, real heavy distortions or something - I didn't really get it. It's supposed to slow down time around it. Right.

Anyways, I'm shipping this to myself - to arrive in 10 years. A gift, from me to me. A reminder to make memories, to slow down a bit. 10 years will pass so quick - try to remember them! You've got to put effort in life!
