Uncommon.name: Collector's Compulsion
Uncommon.desc: Picking up an item or other collectible increases all stats by +3% for 20 seconds, up to 3 (+2 per stack) times . Barrels grant minor pickups.
Uncommon.notes:
The Collector's Compulsion is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
It grants the user a +3% increase to all stats for 20 seconds whenever the user picks up an item, up to 3 (+2 per stack) times.
All the stat increases are multiplicative, after all other item stats have been added, which may be worse for some stats and better for others.
The 'all stats' of this item does not include acceleration.


== Valid Pickups ==
The following are valid ways to gain the Collector's Compulsion buff:

Opening barrels
Picking up items, temporary items, equipment, Lunar Coins, etc.
Picking up  Elusive Antlers' energy orbs
Picking up  Bandolier's ammo packs
Picking up   Drifter's Junk
Picking up health orbs from:
 Monster Tooth
 Seed of Life (Consumed)
  REX's harvest fruits
  CHEF's Kiss kebab
  Cleanup Drone
Picking up gold nuggets from:
 Ghor's Tome
  Gilded Elites
  Cleanup Drone


== Tips ==
  Drifter benefits greatly from this item, as she regularly drops Junk with her   Blunt Force, allowing her to consistently get the buff stacks.
The buff stacks are also granted by temporary items, making it pair well with   Salvage.
  CHEF also benefits greatly from this item due to its   CHEF's Kiss passive, which drops health pickups upon killing an enemy that was hit by two or more of its skills.
  False Son gets Growth from the buff granted by this item.
Items like  Monster Tooth,  Bandolier and  Ghor's Tome combo well, as the pickups they spawn grant stacks of the buff. This also makes it work well with the   Cleanup Drone, which drops similar pickups.
 Elusive Antlers are an especially good pairing with this item, as picking up one of its energy orbs grants the user two buffs at once: The speed buff from the Antlers, and the stats increase from Collector's Compulsion.
Collector's Compulsion benefits from  Growth Nectar, as having a buff from Collector's Compulsion also grants one stack of a buff from Growth Nectar.


== Notes ==
Clarification: This item increases max health, movement speed, damage, attack speed, crit, regen, and armor.
Unlike other movement speed increases, acceleration is not increased here, potentially leading to feeling "slippery".
Multiplicative crit chance is far less beneficial than linear.
Multiplicative armor is not beneficial if you do not any armor granting items or are playing a survivor with base armor.
Unlike  Irradiant Pearl, it does affect all armor, not just base armor.
 Remote Caffeinator's cans of soda do not grant the buff.
 Infusion's max health orbs not grant the buff.
Having a  Substandard Duplicator and picking up an item does not grant two buffs.


== Lore ==
"In the year 2034, the renowned Black Friday sale was permanently banned in all world markets after a gruesome stampede erupted at the New Times Square Shopping Mall. Approximately 35 were killed in the stampede, and dozens more were critically injured. A notable participant in the stampede was 43-year-old Susan Monroe, a single mother who was responsible for taking the lives of 5 innocent shoppers. In an interview, Susan claimed: "I mean, can you blame me? My boy wanted the new gaming console, and it was on sale for 5 dollars. 5 dollars! I'd do it again for that price.""

 - History of Earth, Volume VII

Uncommon.name: Death Mark
Uncommon.desc: Enemies with 4 or more debuffs are marked for death , increasing damage taken by 50% from all sources for 7 (+7 per stack) seconds.
Uncommon.notes:
The Death Mark is an item in Risk of Rain 2.
When the holder damages an enemy that has 4 or more unique debuffs, it is  marked for death for 7 seconds (+7 seconds per stack), causing it to take 50% more damage from all sources.


== Notes ==
Players without the Death Mark will still deal bonus damage to marked enemies.
It is possible to inflict Marked for Death on the same hit that inflicts the 4th debuff. This is because a landing hit procs some debuffs before Marked for Death is checked, while others are checked after. See On-Hit Procs for more details and the order of checks.
The 4 debuffs do not need to be applied by the same player, but a player holding a Death Mark must damage the enemy to mark it.
The debuff cannot be caused by an attack with a proc coefficient of 0.0, so damage-over-time effects can never apply the mark, even if the victim has enough debuffs.
The duration of the mark cannot be extended or reset after it has been applied, but it can be reapplied as normal once it expires.
Once applied, the mark persists for its full duration even if the victim's debuffs expire such that it no longer has 4 debuffs.
  Lunar Ruin counts as 2 debuffs, as it has both a damage boost and a very minor damage over time effect.
All debuffs that can be applied to enemies count towards the activation requirement, including the   Clay Templar's self-inflicted   50% Slow.
Stunning an enemy, such as with   Commando's   Suppressive Fire or with a  Stun Grenade, does not contribute to the Death Mark.
Similarly, freezing an enemy with   Artificer's   Cast Nano-Spear or   Snapfreeze or   Railguneer's   Cryocharge will not contribute to the Death Mark.


== Tips ==


=== Survivor Debuffs ===
  Huntress inflicts   50% Slow with   Arrow Rain.
  Bandit inflicts   Hemorrhage with   Serrated Dagger and   Serrated Shiv.
  Engineer inflicts   50% Slow with   TR58 Carbonizer Turrets.
  Artificer inflicts   Ignite with   Flame Bolt and   Flamethrower.
  Mercenary inflicts   Expose with   Laser Sword,   Focused Assault and   Slicing Winds.
  REX inflicts   Weak with   DIRECTIVE: Inject and   DIRECTIVE: Disperse, and can also inflict either   Entangle with   Tangling Growth or   Fruiting with   DIRECTIVE: Harvest.
  Acrid inflicts either   Poison or   Blight.
  Heretic inflicts   Lunar Root with   Slicing Maelstrom and   Ruin while   Ruin is not on cooldown.
  Void Fiend inflicts   50% Slow with   Drown.
  Seeker inflicts   50% Slow with   Spirit Punch.
  False Son inflicts   Lunar Ruin with   Lunar Spikes and   Lunar Stakes.
  CHEF inflicts   Weak with   Glaze,   Burn with   Sear,   Stronger Burn on Glazed enemies or while holding an  Ignition Tank, and   Bleed with   Roll boosted by   Yes, CHEF!.
  Operator inflicts   Nano Bug with   Ejection Core and   Burn with critical hits from   CMD-SWARM. Depending on the drones he has purchased,   ADMIN-OVERRIDE can also inflict   Burn with an   Incinerator Drone,   50% Slow with a   Cleanup Drone,   Jailed with a   Jailer Drone, and   Frost with a   Freeze Drone.
  Drifter can inflict an extremely wide variety of debuffs using   Cleanup,   Discard (from   Repossess), and   Tinker.
  Cleanup can apply   Hemorrhage or   Burn depending on the random projectile she rolls.
Throwing an object with   Discard can apply   Nullify Stack if she throws a Void Cradle,   Cripple if she throws a Lunar Pod or Cleansing Pool, and   Burn if she throws a   Lesser Wisp,   Greater Wisp, or Lunar Chimera   Exploder or   Wisp.
  Tinker can inflict one of 22 different debuffs to any enemy it hits. 10 of these are unused or otherwise impossible to inflict with survivors or items, 6 can be inflicted by other survivors, and 6 can only be inflicted by items or equipments.


=== Item Debuffs ===
While the Death Mark is best used with Survivors who can inflict debuffs naturally, there are many items that inflict debuffs as well:

 Tri-Tip Dagger,  Noxious Thorn,  Shatterspleen and  Sawmerang inflict   Bleed.
The  Tri-Tip Dagger and  Shatterspleen require multiple stacks and high critical chance for reliability, respectively.
The  Needletick inflicts   Collapse, but corrupts Tri-Tip Daggers. Bleed can still be inflicted with the Noxious Thorn, Shatterspleen, Sawmerang or by other players, however.
 Gasoline, the  Molten Perforator, and the  Molotov (6-Pack) will   ignite enemies.
 Ifrit's Distinction allows the holder to ignite enemies with all their skills and items.
The  Ignition Tank changes Ignite into   Stronger Burn. While this does not add debuffs, it does mean that a player with the Ignition Tank can inflict Stronger Burn while their allies can still inflict regular Ignite, which count separately. This can be facilitated with an   Incinerator Drone.
 Chronobauble inflicts   60% Slow, which can be maintained easily with even a single stack.
The  Tentabauble inflicts   Nullified, but corrupts Chronobaubles. 60% Slow can still be inflicted by other players who have Chronobaubles, however.
 Runald's Band inflicts   80% Slow when activated, though this can make the Death Mark tied to the Elemental Bands cooldown.
 Breaching Fin inflicts   Breaching Fin Debuff, though this can make the Death Mark tied to the Breaching Fin cooldown.
 Shattering Justice inflicts   Pulverize Buildup and   Pulverized (though never at the same time), which both count towards Death Mark.
 Symbiotic Scorpion inflicts   Permanent Armor Reduction.
 Frost Relic inflicts   80% Slow.
 Networked Suffering inflicts computer virus.
 Hooks of Heresy allow the holder to inflict   Lunar Root using   Slicing Maelstrom.
 Essence of Heresy allows the holder to inflict   Ruin on hit, as long as the   Ruin skill is not on cooldown.
 Mired Urn inflicts   Tar on one nearby enemy per stack.
 Helfire Tincture inflicts the invisible   Helfire debuff, which does contribute towards the Death Mark.
 Her Biting Embrace and the  Spectral Circlet allow the holder to apply   80% Slow on hit.
 N'kuhana's Retort allows the holder to   disable healing on hit.
 Shared Design and  Effigy of Grief inflict   Cripple.


== Lore ==
Order: “Death Mark”

Tracking Number: 66******

Estimated Delivery: 02\22\2056\

Shipping Method:  High Priority

Shipping Address: 421 Lane, Lab [72], Mars

Shipping Details:

Everyone said that I was crazy to search for lost artifacts on Mars. Idiots. There hasn’t been any proof of a previous civilization - but I’ve always trusted my gut. This skull proves that I’m right - that something did exist here before.

That smug professor at the university... always disparaging my research. I loved seeing the look on his face as I shook his hand. Idiot. Karma must have been working overtime - I heard he fell ill shortly after. I suppose my success was just too much for him.

...In fact, everyone I’ve shown seems to not be returning my calls. Are they avoiding me? Are they scared this news would shake up their academic communities? Too proud to admit I’m right?

I’ll find someone who will give me the recognition I deserve. I’ve worked too hard and done too much. If I don’t keep going, I think I might just die.

== Trivia ==
Collapse used to erroneously count as 2 debuffs and not 1; this is due to how damaging debuffs are programmed. Each debuff actually has 2 components: an invisible debuff that deals the damage, and a visible positive buff that creates the icon and indicates that the debuff is inflicted. This is why the Helfire debuff counts towards the Death Mark, even though it is invisible: it has the debuff component, just not the visible buff. However, due to a programming error, both components of Collapse were treated as debuffs.
This has been fixed as of Patch 1.2.3.

Uncommon.name: Faraday Spur
Uncommon.desc: Moving around builds up charge , granting up to +160% movement speed and +200% jump height at 100%. At 25% charge or higher, jumping triggers an explosive discharge for 400% (+280% per stack) damage in a 5m to 32.3m (+7.5m per stack) area.
Uncommon.notes:
The Faraday Spur is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
When the user moves around, they build up a charge, increasing their movement speed and jump height as the charge increases. When the charge is at 25% or higher, and the user jumps, it triggers an explosive discharge for 400% damage (+280% per stack) in a 5m to 32.3m (+7.5m per stack) area.


== Notes ==
Bug: The visual radius shown is only half the radius of the attack.
Clarification: This item increases Jump-Power by 200%, which effectively increases Jump-Height by 800%.
Jump Power decreases the amount of fall damage you take, allowing you to run off cliffs with less worry.
However this is lost upon activation, with high enough %, the jump will result in you taking fall damage on flat ground.
Survivors with vertical maneuverability options not involving jumping can use this item for its movement speed in stage traversal.

Uncommon.name: Fuel Cell
Uncommon.desc: Hold an additional equipment charge (+1 per stack) . Reduce equipment cooldown by 15% (+15% per stack) .
Uncommon.notes:
The Fuel Cell is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Experimenting Challenge.
The item grants an 1 (+1 per stack) additional equipment charge per stack, and reduces equipment cooldown by 15% (+15% per stack).
This item stacks linearly with additional equipment charges, and exponentially with equipment cooldown.


== Notes ==
The maximum amount of possible equipment charges is 255, with 254 Fuel Cells.
If extra equipment charges are ready and then the player loses Fuel Cells (e.g. by using a Scrapper), the extra charges will remain until used up. However, those extra charges will not recharge once used, unless the player collects more Fuel Cells again.


== Math ==
The equipment cooldown is determined by the formula cooldown * (1 - 0.15) ^ amount

If the player has any  Gesture of the Drowned, refer to the math on that page for the cooldown formula and values, by adding the amount of Fuel Cells & Gestures, as additional Gestures share the same reduction as Fuel Cells.


== Lore ==
"As humanity began to venture out into the depths of space, high-energy but low-volume fuel sources became critical for interplanetary travel. Stability came later."
-Brief History of Interplanetary Advances, Vol.2

Uncommon.name: Ghor's Tome
Uncommon.desc: 4% (+4% on stack) chance on kill to drop a treasure worth $25 . Scales over time.
Uncommon.notes:
Ghor's Tome is an item introduced in the Hidden Realms Update.
When the holder kills an enemy, there is a 4% (+4% per stack) chance for that enemy to drop a gold nugget. Picking up the gold nugget awards the player with gold equal to the value of one Small Chest. 


== Notes ==
The gold from nuggets is awarded to all players.
Unlike the on-kill drops from the  Bandolier and  Monster Tooth, gold nuggets do not always gravitate towards the player as they approach.
Gold nuggets also never despawn, unlike the ammo boxes and healing orbs.
The infinitely respawning, destructible rocks in Sky Meadow can drop treasures.
The same is true for the clay pots in Abandoned Aqueduct and the exploding barrels on Rallypoint Delta, although these objects are significantly more dangerous.
The chance to drop a gold nugget is affected by Luck.
The effective stacking limit is 25, for a 100% chance to drop gold.
If a Monster activates its own Ghor's Tome and collects it, it will not increase the money obtained from killing it.


== Tips ==
This item is significantly less helpful if the Artifact of Sacrifice is active, as almost all uses for gold are no longer present.
Activating  Forgive Me Please with a Ghor's Tome can drop up to 8 gold nuggets.


== Lore ==
Order: “Ghor’s Tome”

Tracking Number: 19******

Estimated Delivery: 07/07/2056

Shipping Method: Priority

Shipping Address: 99th Floor, Crumbling Tower, Venus

Shipping Details:

Ancient secrets... transmutation... homunculi... alchemy. Nothing more than nonsense - pursuits of rightly intentioned but grossly misled minds. Or so I thought. This item's... unexpected physical properties are reason enough to stay my immediate dismissal.

Strange fortune led this book to me, and stranger knowledge still fills the pages. Chilling, even. It concludes, in chapter eight, that even iron can become gold - but only through a ritual of intense bloodletting, a thought disturbing enough without considering the bountiful riches that accompanied the estate.

The takeaway, above all else, seems to be that you cannot get something from nothing; even the very paper of the tome turned to ash as I tried to make photocopies. Whatever was on the first two pages is lost forever. I need transcriptions of the rest by hand, and I know you take pride in your precision. 

And more importantly, Kosta, I trust you. Don't do anything that would draw attention to yourself. I will try to find the other volumes. This is knowledge too dangerous to lose.

Uncommon.name: Harvester's Scythe
Uncommon.desc: Gain 5% critical chance . Critical strikes heal for 8 (+4 per stack) health .
Uncommon.notes:
The Harvester's Scythe is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Prismatically Aligned Challenge.
When landing a critical strike, the holder heals a flat 8 (+4 per stack) health, multiplied by the proc coefficient of the attack.  
Additionally, the first Scythe a player obtains grants +5% critical strike chance. Stacking more Scythes will not increase critical strike chance further. 


== Notes ==
The visuals for healing are always rounded up, but this does not reflect the actual healing gained.
With no other sources of critical strike chance, the Scythe provides an average of 0.48 healing per hit. With a single  Lens-Maker's Glasses, this is increased to 1.28 healing per hit.
This is on average better than the  Leeching Seed, although inconsistent. Gaining more critical strike chance makes the Scythe's healing more reliable and effective than the Leeching Seed.


== Tips ==
Any way to guarantee critical strikes makes this item considerably stronger, even at low stacks.   Bandit and   Railgunner can land guaranteed critical strikes with their   Backstab and Weak Point mechanics, respectively, and any Survivor can get guaranteed critical chance for a short period with the  Ocular HUD.
When not playing as the above Survivors and without the Ocular HUD, it might be worth avoiding the  Lost Seer's Lenses if relying on the Harvester's Scythe for healing, as losing all  Lens-Maker's Glasses dramatically lowers this item's effectiveness.


== Lore ==
“I’m not going nowhere. What I do is important, and no plague is going to stop me from getting that done. City folk are all up in a tizzy over this and that, scared that ya’ll will pass without doing some crazy goals you set for yourself. 

But me, I’m not afraid of death. Suffering is just another part of life, and like labor, I can do it myself. To death, I say: I don’t need your damn help.”

- Unnamed Farmer, Tragedy of Mercury: A History

Uncommon.name: Ignition Tank
Uncommon.desc: Ignite effects deal +300% (+300% per stack) more damage over time.
Uncommon.notes:
The Ignition Tank is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion. 
Any of the holder's attacks or items that would inflict   Ignite instead inflict   Stronger Burn. Stronger Burn deals 300% (+300% per stack) more damage over time than Ignite. 


== Activating ==
Damage from the following items ignite:

 Gasoline
 Molten Perforator
 Sautéed Worms
 Molotov (6-Pack)
 Helfire Tincture
 Ifrit's Distinction
 Wake of Vultures
Damage from the following skills ignite:

  Artificer's   Flame Bolt,   Flamethrower.
  CHEF's   Sear.
  Operator's   CMD-SWARM (on crit).
  Drifter's   Cleanup (Molotov Projectile).
Damage from the following drones ignite:

  Incinerator Drone
    ADMIN-OVERRIDE


== Notes ==
Enemies inflicted with   Stronger Burn spark with reddish-white energy.
Common misconceptions are that this item would affect fire-related items such as  Kjaro's Band or  Will-o'-the-wisp
But like the item specifies, it only affects ignite effect / the burn damage over time effect, and as such has no affect on these items.


== Tips ==
  Artificer can reap huge benefits from this item. Having just a single stack makes   Flame Bolt and   Flamethrower deal nearly twice as much total damage, with further stacks increasing their lethality even more.
  CHEF can also benefit greatly through the use of   Sear.
Although the  Helfire Tincture's debuff is invisible, it is affected by the Ignition Tank. This is a double-edged sword, since it will deal immense damage but also hurt the user much more.
Aside from skills, Ignite can be inflicted with  Gasoline, the  Molten Perforator, and the  Molotov (6-Pack).
Becoming   Blazing due to  Ifrit's Distinction or  Wake of Vultures will cause all the player's skills to inflict Ignite as well, making the Ignition Tank dramatically increase almost all damage.

Uncommon.name: Infusion
Uncommon.desc: Killing an enemy increases your health permanently by 1 (+1 per stack) , up to a maximum of 100 (+100 per stack) health .
Uncommon.notes:
The Infusion is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Slaughter Challenge.
When the holder kills an enemy, their maximum health increases by 1 (+1 per stack), up to a maximum of 100 (+100 per stack) bonus health.


== Notes ==
  Turrets spawned by an   Engineer will have the Infusions and their effects, but since they do not share kill counts with Engineer, they do not benefit from any bonus health until they make their own kills.
If all Infusions are removed via a 3D Printer or otherwise, the bonus health is lost.
If any Infusions are regained, all bonus health is instantly restored, even if the bonus health is more than 100 per held Infusion.
If the Artifact of Glass is active, an Infusion's health gain to kill ratio is changed from 1:1 to 1:10.
This item does not count as a healing item, and thus does not invalidate the requirements for the Naturopath challenge.
Destroying explosive pots on Abandoned Aqueduct, Fusion Cells on Rallypoint Delta, Alloy Vulture Nests on Siren's Call, flying rocks on Sky Meadow, or birds on Distant Roost will give a charge of infusion.
 Forgive Me Please will give a charge of Infusion for every time it triggers.
Having any number of Infusions will make the health bar red, instead of the normally green color.
It is possible for a single Infusion to give more than 100 health per stack if multiple enemies are killed at the same time and the kill count for the infusion is close to its cap.
The red particle effect that seeks out the player after having killed an enemy while having an Infusion is what gives the bonus health, and not the kill itself.


== Lore ==
Order: Infusion

Tracking Number: 768******

Estimated Delivery: 02/8/2056

Shipping Method: Priority/Biological

Shipping Address: Rage Valley, Fleet Hanger, Mars

Contains samples from bears, leeches, tigers, elephants, elephant sharks, sharks, bull sharks, ants, and anteaters. Simply hook up to a dialysis machine along with the necessary equipment and swap out your blood for genetically superior ones! 

You can add whatever blood sample you want, as far as I know. Just make sure you take the pills that allow the body to accept the new blood, or your body will reject the cross-species infusion. Remember that sampling from other animals is a great basis for experimentation!

Uncommon.name: Item Scrap, Green
Uncommon.desc: Does nothing. Prioritized when used with 3D Printers .
Uncommon.notes:
Item Scrap is a group of items in Risk of Rain 2 with no passive effects. However, when using a 3D Printer or Cauldron, any Item Scrap of the required rarity will be prioritized and consumed before any other item. 
These items cannot be found normally. Instead, using a Scrapper to get rid of an item or a Drone Scrapper to get rid of a Drone will produce an Item Scrap of the same rarity:

White (Common) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, White
Green (Uncommon) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Green
Red (Legendary) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Red
Yellow (Boss) items produce  Item Scrap, Yellow


== Notes ==
The  Recycler cannot be used on these items, and they do not appear in Scrappers.
If the player uses a Shrine of Order while holding Item Scrap, it is possible for all their items of the same rarity as that Item Scrap to be transformed into Item Scrap.
If upgraded using  Benthic Bloom, it may transform into any item of the target rarity, unrestricted by category.
Despite working similarly to 3D Printers, no Item Scrap equivalent exists for use in Cleansing Pools.
If Artifact of Devotion is enabled, when a Lemurian follower is killed, it will drop one Scrap in the same tier as the item that was offered to hatch it.
Item Scraps  White,  Green, and  Red can be obtained through the Drone Scrapper.
Item Scraps can be duplicated via Crafting.


== Lore ==
All scrap have the same lore entry.

“While officially licensed materials are always recommended, hobbyists are known to take matters into their own hands when in a pinch. Don’t have any materials up to par? Make your own! Recycling old parts can be a fun way to create materials for your projects.”

- The Ultimate Hobby Guide: Kitbashing and 3D Printing

Uncommon.name: Kinetic Dampener

Uncommon.notes:
The Kinetic Dampener is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.

Uncommon.name: Kjaro's Band
Uncommon.desc: Hits that deal more than 400% damage also blasts enemies with a runic flame tornado , dealing 300% (+300% per stack) TOTAL damage over time. Recharges every 10 seconds.
Uncommon.notes:
Kjaro's Band is an item in Risk of Rain 2. Its counterpart is  Runald's Band, and they are both unlocked and start appearing in runs after completing the Death Do Us Part Challenge.
When striking an enemy with an attack that deals 400% or more damage, the Band creates a flaming tornado that deals 300% (+300% per stack) total damage. This bonus attack has a cooldown of 10 seconds and a proc coefficient of 0.0.


== Notes ==
The runic flame tornado hits targets every 0.3s for 3s within ~5m.
In addition to dealing at least 400% damage, a hit must have a proc coefficient greater than 0.0 to activate the Bands. Damage bonuses such as critical strikes or  Armor-Piercing Rounds will not cause weaker hits to activate the Bands, even if the final damage dealt is above 400% base damage.
  Mercenary's signature {  Expose debuff is an exception. When Mercenary hits an Exposed enemy, the hit deals an extra 350% damage, which does count towards the Bands' activation.
This item always activates simultaneously with Runald's Band.
The cooldown for the Bands can be seen above the player's health bar as a {  status effect with up to 10 stacks. 1 stack is removed every second, and when the last stack is removed the Bands are {  ready and can be activated again.
Because this status effect is considered a debuff, activating the  Blast Shower will reset the cooldown immediately.
 Ben's Raincoat does not provide immunity to this debuff.

Should light be extinguished,

Will you bring me patience?

Will you die with me?"

Uncommon.name: Leeching Seed
Uncommon.desc: Dealing damage heals you for 1 (+1 per stack) health .
Uncommon.notes:
The Leeching Seed is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
Upon damaging an enemy, the holder recovers 1 (+1 per stack) health, multiplied by the proc coefficient of the hit. 


== Notes ==
Visuals for damage and healing numbers are rounded up, so the Leeching Seed's healing may appear as 1 per hit when in fact it may be lower.
Correction: Healing is only applied on hit, not on damage.


== Tips ==
Shotgun attacks such as   Bandit's   Burst and   Captain's   Vulcan Shotgun work well with Leeching Seeds, since each attack fires many individual hits.
On the other hand, Survivors with relatively low attack speed or hit count, such as   Loader, will struggle to make good use of this item.
This item becomes generally outclassed by the  Harvester's Scythe once the player has enough critical strike chance.
The hit requirement makes it unsuitable for Damage over Time effects such as poison or bleed.


== Lore ==
It was a crisp evening - and things were looking up. The botanist began walking towards the Plant Biology Complex to check on several alien plants that had been recovered from the week before.

Another worker was already in the complex, busy at work.

“Hey.” “Oh, hello!” The worker greeted her enthusiastically. He was carrying several bags of fertilizer, and she gave him a quizzical look. “You need any help with those?” She said, gathering her clipboard for her check.

“Oh no, I’m alright. It’s a good workout, actually,” he said. As they walked, the botanist couldn’t help but wonder what kind of job would require THAT much fertilizer.

As the door to the greenhouse whirred open, she got her answer – roots scaling the height of the greenhouse and snaking along the ceiling, even invading the containers of other specimens. “What the hell!?” She cried, her jaw slack. And then she noticed the other plants. 

Every other plant in the greenhouse had withered – with an incriminating root leading back to the overgrowth that the worker was now feeding fertilizer. The botanist was speechless. “What happened...? What... what is that...?” She stammered. The worker turned to her and grinned.

“One of the species we got in the last expedition. He demands a lot of nutrients - it took me so long to get him to even sprout. I was wracking my brain, trying every trick in the book. And every other specimen seemed to be growing fine, so I figured, hey, why not share some of that? And look!”

Spreading his arms, the worker marveled at the gallery of dead plants. Dropping her clipboard, the botanist’s stomach sank. Things were no longer looking up.

Uncommon.name: Lepton Daisy
Uncommon.desc: Release a healing nova during the Teleporter event, healing all nearby allies for 50% of their maximum health . Occurs 1 (+1 per stack) times.
Uncommon.notes:
The Lepton Daisy is an item introduced in the Skills 2.0 Update.
During the Teleporter Event, all allies inside the Teleporter's radius are periodically healed by 50% of their maximum health. This effect occurs 1 (+1 per stack) time(s) per Teleporter Event.
In multiplayer, this item stacks based on the total amount held by all players combined (items held by   Engineer's   Turrets do not count), similar to the  Halcyon Seed.


== Notes ==
The Lepton Daisy is one of the few blacklisted items that   Engineer's turrets will not inherit.
Lepton Daisies also activate in all 'holdout zones', including charging the cells in the   Void Fields, the pillars on   Commencement, the deep void signals on   Void Locus, and the Assessment Focus in the Simulacrum. The only exception is the rescue dropship zone on Commencement.
The item heals consistently at predetermined points in the Teleporter charge when stacked.
For example, with 2 Lepton Daisies, players will be healed once at 33% charge and again at 66%. With 3, they will be healed at 25%, 50%, and 75%. The intervals between these bursts of healing can be predicted with the equation 99/(amount + 1).
Because the Soul Pillars on Commencement discharge when no player is within their range, it is possible to trigger the Lepton Daisy at the same charge percentage by dipping in and out of the holdout zone.

Uncommon.name: Luminous Shot
Uncommon.desc: Activating Secondary skill stores up to 5 charges (+1 per stack) . Requires 3 charges for your Primary skill to fire lightning strikes, dealing 175% TOTAL damage (+50% per stack) each. Reduces Secondary skill cooldown by 20% .
Uncommon.notes:
Luminous Shot is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
Upon using a Secondary Skill, the item grants a stack of the Luminous Shot Charge status effect. At 3 or more stacks, the status effect becomes the   Increased Primary Damage buff. One stack of the buff is consumed upon hitting an enemy after using a primary skill, dealing 175% total damage (+50% per item stack). The buff can be stacked up to 5 times (+1 per stack).
Additionally, the first stack of Luminous Shot grants 20% secondary skill cooldown reduction.
Each lighting bolt has a proc coefficient of 1.0


== Notes ==
This point seems to be incorrect for   MUL-T as of the Alloyed Collective update, you can repeatedly trigger the item's effect while holding down   Auto-Nailgun as a primary skill while using   Power Mode, might be the case for other survivors as well. - It is worth to note that the   Increased Primary Damage buff will only trigger if the primary skill was used after gaining the first stack. If the first stack of the buff is acquired during the use of a primary skill, that instance of the the skill will never trigger the buff. This can occur, for example, if any variation of the   Loader grapple is used during a hit of   Knuckleboom but is especially present with skills that can be used indefinitely such as   MUL-T if using   Power Mode in combination with   Power-Saw or   Auto-Nailgun as those skills will not be able to use the buff until completely re-initiated. This effectively means no one instance of a skill will ever be able to use   Increased Primary Damage more than once.
  Railgunner doesn't actually gain the buff from using the secondary skills but from firing out the transformed primary skill, which also cannot use the buff through any means, forcing her to trigger it through   XQR Smart Round System.
  MUL-T cannot trigger the lightning strikes in   Power Mode when using two of the same weapon, but using the secondary weapon will still stack the buff.
This item is especially strong with  Backup Magazine.
The  Shuriken does not trigger the buff.


== Tips ==
As   MUL-T, repeatedly using his second primary skill while in   Power Mode can allow for quick accumulation of buff stacks.
This is especially apparent when using   Power-Saw as the second primary skill, giving a stack each time the button to trigger the skill is pressed. This effectively allows the player to stack buffs as quickly as they can press the Secondary button.
Survivors that have very low cooldown secondary abilities like   Acrid,   Mercenary and   REX, or multiple uses for secondary abilities like   False Son or   Operator can easily ramp up the stacks.
If   Mercenary activates the Luminous Shot hit on an attack that applies   Expose, it will subsequently trigger the effect on its own.
Even better, if Luminous Shot activates from a hit on an Exposed enemy, the damage of each lightning strike will be based on the Expose-boosted damage. For instance, with one item stack, instead of doing 227.5% damage (130% x 1.75 = 227.5%), each strike will do 840% damage ([130% + 350%] * 1.75 = 480% * 1.75 = 840%).


== Lore ==
"Results are in!
The 2057 NextTech winner is the Luminous Shot, crafted by Inventor M. Louis VI of Europa.

M. Louis comments on her victory, ’Thank you for the opportunity to contribute to progress. Looking forward to next year.’

Coming in 2nd, the Preon Accumulator, crafted by Technician Neil Hasting of Earth. Neil comments, ’I’m proud of what I submitted, but these fancy Europans put up a good fight, using [REDACTED] tech? How did she even find that? Her cross-weapon sync theory demands respect. See you next year for a rematch, Maggie.’
The coup still fresh on Europa’s mind, the new acting government confronts her controversial work on the Crowdfunder, a tool of suppression used by the old monarchy. M. Louis replies to critics, ’I take responsibility for the abuse of my invention, I ask that you evaluate my work going forward by how it can help us prevent this kind of tragedy.’"

 - The Saturn Reporter, Technology Section

Uncommon.name: Old Guillotine
Uncommon.desc: Instantly kill Elite monsters below 13% (+13% per stack) health .
Uncommon.notes:
The Old Guillotine is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Cut Down Challenge.
The holder will instantly kill any Elite enemy that falls below 13% (+13% per stack) of its maximum health.


== Notes ==
In a similar fashion to   Artificer's   Cast Nano-Spear and   Snapfreeze, an enemy is executed when its health is below the threshold and the Guillotine's holder deals damage to it.
Only the holder can execute an enemy; allies will not benefit from the holder's Guillotines.
Enemies cannot be executed (by freezing or the Guillotine) if they have any shields. Therefore,    Overloading Elites effectively have a maximum execution threshold of 50% health.
However,   Perfected Elites can be executed as normal at the appropriate threshold.
This item can be particularly useful for   Acrid if using   Poison, as it will allow the usually non-lethal passive to kill elite enemies the moment they fall below the threshold.
The Old Guillotine is one of the few items in the game with hyperbolic stacking.
24 Old Guillotines are required to overcome the bonus health for Tier 1 Elite enemies (  Blazing ,  Overloading,   Glacial, and   Perfected), and 131 are needed to overcome the health bonus of Tier 2 Elites (  Malachite and   Celestine).
  Voidtouched elites are affected by this item.
  Void Infestor can infest and make a high health, previously non-elite enemy easier to kill as a result.
Survivors, and by extension Umbra of Survivors, are unable to be executed.
  Engineer's   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turret and   TR58 Carbonizer Turret are able to be executed if they are elite.
The execution threshold visual will still increase.
it would take around 111*^317 old guillotines in order to have a 100% threshold


== Math ==
The threshold at which it will activate is determined by the formula: 
thresHold=(1−100100+13*items)*100;

The item effectively increase damage against elites by 13%, even if the thresholds differ.


== Lore ==

Everyone is still operating on adrenaline here. We finally overthrew our oppressors and have taken back Primas V! I know some of the overlords will attempt to buy their way onto a stealth transport, but that’s going to be quite difficult due to their epic economic blunder.

We don’t just want blood for all the injustices we’ve suffered at their hands. We want to send a message to would-be sympathizers. This old guillotine will serve both as an execution method and a symbol to strike fear into their hearts wherever they might be hiding.

== Trivia ==
The Old Guillotine may be a reference to The Ol' Lopper from Risk of Rain 1. Both items are "old," have a strong execution motif, and give the player an extreme benefit against low-health enemies: the Lopper causes the player to land guaranteed critical strikes against weakened enemies, while the Guillotine will instantly kill those enemies if they are Elite.
The Old Guillotine was the first item to have undergone a rarity change. It was originally added as a Common item before later being changed into an Uncommon item. This item was alone in being the only rarity change until V1.3.6, where  Breaching Fin had its rarity increased to fit its reworked functionality.

Uncommon.name: Old War Stealthkit
Uncommon.desc: Falling below 25% health causes you to gain 40% movement speed and invisibility for 5s . Recharges every 30 seconds (-50% per stack) .
Uncommon.notes:
The Old War Stealthkit is an item in Risk of Rain 2.
When the holder falls below 25% of their max HP, they become   invisible and   gain 40% movement speed for 5 seconds. This stealth mode has a cooldown of 30 seconds (-50% per stack).


== Notes ==
This item is useful when using the  Transcendence or  Shared Design, as the holder must avoid damage for 7 seconds to recover their shields. The Stealthkit's invisibility and bonus movement speed greatly aid in a retreat after sustaining heavy damage.
Note that damage over time, such as   Bleed or   Burn, will prevent shields from regenerating until the effect has expired. Be aware of this when retreating.
The  Genesis Loop pairs extremely well with the Stealthkit, as both items activate simultaneously and stack similarly. Use the Genesis Loop's explosion to clear out nearby enemies and use the Stealthkit to find a more advantageous position.

== Notes ==
The item will also activate from self-damage sources, such as fall damage or Shrines of Blood.
When incoming damage is blocked by  Tougher Times,  Safer Spaces, or   invincibility, the Razorwire will not trigger.
This item is especially useful on   REX since it will trigger upon use of any health-sacrificing ability, and as such is very effective with their   Seed Barrage skill.
Areas with Void Fog are made significantly easier with this item, as the player can simply take small ticks of damage to continually attack nearby enemies.
Take care of performing this, as the amount of damage received per tick by the Void Fog increases each hit. The damage increase can be reset by entering a safe zone.
The  Helfire Tincture will also activate the Razorwire in a similar fashion. With enough stacks of Razorwire, this can allow for map-wide attacks while the Tincture is active.
Take care when fighting near explosive pots on Abandoned Aqueduct, as the Razorwire may detonate the pots and kill the player.
The razor bursts have a proc coefficient of 0.0 when held by Umbrae spawned by the Artifact of Vengeance.

Uncommon.name: Red Whip
Uncommon.desc: Leaving combat boosts your movement speed by 30% (+30% per stack) .
Uncommon.notes:
The Red Whip is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
After 5 seconds of using no offensive skills, the holder gets the {  Whip Boost buff, increasing their movement speed by 30% (+30% per stack) until they use an offensive skill again. 


== Notes ==
Unlike the  Cautious Slug, getting the Whip Boost buff requires the player to not use any skills (except for mobility skills) for 5 seconds, and has nothing to do with avoiding damage.
As of the 1.0 Launch update, all mobility skills are considered "sprinting," meaning that the buff won't be removed if the player uses such skills.
As of the Hidden Realms update, taking damage no longer disables the buff.
Equipment, be it damaging or not, does not disable the buff.
Damaging items like  Little Disciple and  Unstable Tesla Coil do not disable the buff.
Skills that do not disable the buff include:
  Commando's   Tactical Dive and   Tactical Slide
  Bandit's   Smoke Bomb
  Huntress's   Blink and   Phase Blink
  MUL-T's   Transport Mode,   Retool, and   Power Mode
While initiating his    Power-Saw will cancel the buff, holding it does not affect it, meaning the speed boost can be utilized while attacking after 5 seconds.
  Engineer's   Thermal Harpoons,   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turret, and   TR58 Carbonizer Turret
His turret's attacks are combat skills, while placing them is not.
Oddly, despite firing damaging missiles, Thermal Harpoons does not count as a combat skill, but   Bubble Shield does.
  Void Fiend's   Trespass,   Suppress, and   Corrupted Suppress
Despite dealing no damage,   Corrupted Trespass counts as a combat skill.
  Heretic's   Nevermore and   Shadowfade ( Strides of Heresy)
  Railgunner's   Concussion Device and   Polar Field Device
Scoping in with   M99 Sniper or   HH44 Marksman counts as a combat skill, even without firing.
  Alloy Vulture Utility skill which switches between grounded and flight.
  Blind Pest Primary skill which fires an acid projectile.
  Hermit Crab's Mortar Volley
  Parent's Utility skill (Teleport)
  Mithrix's Special skill (Shock Wave) and Utility skill (Sprint forward)

Uncommon.name: Regenerating Scrap
Uncommon.desc: Does nothing. Prioritized when used with Uncommon 3D Printers . At the start of each stage, it regenerates.
Uncommon.notes:
Regenerating Scrap is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void update.
When interacting with an Uncommon 3D Printer or Legendary Cauldron, if the player has any stacks of this item, it will be consumed before any other items, including  Item Scrap, Green. Unlike all other items, when this item is consumed by either a 3D Printer or Cauldron, the player will receive a  Regenerating Scrap (Consumed). At the start of each stage, all Regenerating Scrap (Consumed) will transform back into Regenerating Scrap.


== Notes ==
Using this item in the Scrapper turns this item into  Item Scrap, Green, which does not regenerate at the start of each stage.
Uncommon 3D Printers will never offer Regenerative Scrap.


== Tips ==
Even though Regenerating Scrap cannot appear in 3D Printers, there is still a printer-related exploit with Regenerating Scrap in Simulacrum. If the Artifact of Command is not active for the run, but the Augment of Command becomes active for a wave, using an Uncommon 3D Printer will generate a Command Essence instead of the displayed item. The player can choose a Regenerating Scrap from the Command Essence and then immediately use it to print a new Command Essence. This can be repeated until the wave ends, or for as long as the player can survive in the void.
This item encourages active use of Uncommon printers. Even if the printed item is undesired, it can be later scrapped into  Item Scrap, Green for more available printing in later stages.
5 or more stacks of this item can be used to repeatedly gain legendary items in the   Bazaar. This functions the same as 3D Printers, consuming the item, rather than trading it.

Uncommon.name: Runald's Band
Uncommon.desc: Hits that deal more than 400% damage also blasts enemies with a runic ice blast , slowing them by 80% for 3s (+3s per stack) and dealing 250% (+250% per stack) TOTAL damage. Recharges every 10 seconds.
Uncommon.notes:
Runald's Band is an item in Risk of Rain 2. Its counterpart is  Kjaro's Band, and they are both unlocked and start appearing in runs after completing the Death Do Us Part Challenge.
When striking an enemy with an attack that deals 400% or more damage, the Band creates an icy explosion that deals 250% (+250% per stack) total damage to that enemy and   greatly slows it for 3 seconds (+3 seconds per stack). This bonus attack has a cooldown of 10 seconds and a proc coefficient of 0.0.


== Notes ==
In addition to dealing at least 400% damage, a hit must have a proc coefficient greater than 0.0 to activate the Bands. Damage bonuses such as critical strikes or  Armor-Piercing Rounds will not cause weaker hits to activate the Bands, even if the final damage dealt is above 400% base damage.
  Mercenary's signature   Expose debuff is an exception. When Mercenary hits an Exposed enemy, the hit deals an extra 350% damage, which does count towards the Bands' activation.
This item always activates simultaneously with Kjaro's Band.
The cooldown for the Bands can be seen above the player's health bar as a   status effect with up to 10 stacks. 1 stack is removed every second, and when the last stack is removed the Bands are   ready and can be activated again.
Because this status effect is considered a debuff, activating the  Blast Shower will reset the cooldown immediately.
Despite the triggering hit and Runald's Band proc occurring simultaneously, the bonus damage from  Crowbar will only apply to the proc if they remain over 90% health after the triggering hit.
Despite firing a "runic ice blast", it does not freeze enemies. Instead it applies an 80% slow to them.

Uncommon.name: Sale Star
Uncommon.desc: Gain an extra item on the first chest opened per stage. Each additional Sale Star increases the chance of getting more items by 5% .
Uncommon.notes:
The Sale Star is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion. 
Upon opening a chest, gain an extra item from the loot table of that chest. Each stack grants an additional 5% chance for an extra item to be obtained. All stacks are consumed upon opening the first chest per stage, and it regenerates at the beginning of each stage.


== Notes ==
In addition to chests, this item works on Equipment Barrels, Rusty Lockboxes, Legendary Chests (including the guaranteed ones on   Abyssal Depths and   Sundered Grove), and Adaptive Chests.
It does not work with Shrines of Chance, Multishop Terminals, Lunar Pods, Void Cradles, Void Potentials, Encrusted Caches, or Scavenger backpacks.
For Adaptive Chests, you will gain additional copies of the chosen item, rather than additional random items.


== Math ==
Sale Star can grant up to 4 additional items, for up to 5 items from a single chest.
The chance to obtain additional items after the first extra one depends on how many Sale Stars the player is holding.

At 2 Sale Stars: after the first extra item, 3 rolls occur:
A 30% chance to get a third item from a chest
A further 15% chance to get a fourth item
A further 1% chance to get a fifth item
At 3 Sale Stars and above: the above rolls occur, but each Sale Star adds an extra 5% chance for each roll to succeed.
These rolls are affected by luck.

Uncommon.name: Shipping Request Form
Uncommon.desc: A delivery containing 2 items (79%/ 20% / 1% ) will appear in a random location on each stage . (Increases rarity chances of the items per stack).
Uncommon.notes:
The Shipping Request Form is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion. 
When entering a new stage, if any player has this item, a Crashed Multishop "Delivery" will spawn somewhere in the stage (one per player who has a Shipping Request Form). The "delivery" is a burning Multishop Terminal which is different from a normal one in a few ways: it costs no gold to use, it has only 2 choices instead of the usual 3, and one of those 2 choices is a question mark icon (meaning the item of that rarity is unknown).


== Notes ==
The crashed Multishop will never display any equipment.
Terminals spawn even when the Artifact of Sacrifice is active.


== Math ==
The weight for each tier of item is calculated as follows:

.79 for common
.2 * n for uncommon
.01 * n^2 for legendary
Where n is the amount of Shipping Request Form.
To calculate the chance for a tier, add together all weights then divide that tier's weight by the total sum of all weights.
For example, if a player has 2 Shipping Request Form items, then the weights are 0.79 (common), 0.2 * 2 = 0.4 (uncommon), 0.01 * 2^2 = 0.04 (legendary). Then, the chance an item is legendary is 0.04 / (0.79 + 0.4 + 0.04) = 0.04 / 1.23, or approximately 0.0325, around 3%.
The table below shows the probabilities calculates for each value of n. Note however that each delivery includes 2 choices. See the section below for odds of at least one legendary.


== Graph ==


== At least 1 Legendary ==
Each item tier is independent of each other, but each delivery drop contains 2 items. You can calculate the probability of getting at least one item from a tier by using the complement: 1 - (1 - x) ^ 2, where x is the probability of getting at least one that tier (shown above).
For example, with a stack of 3, the chance of one item being chosen as legendary is 6% = 0.06. The chance that it is not legendary is 1 - 0.06, so the chance that both are not legendary is (1 - 0.06)^2. The complement of this is the chance that at least one is legendary:  1 - (1 - .06)^2, roughly 11.5%.
The table below shows the probability that at least one legendary item will appear a given stack of Shipping Request Form.


== Tips ==
Having the  Executive Card allows the player to obtain both items from the delivery, instead of choosing one over another.
This is even more effective in multiplayer when multiple players have Shipping Request Forms; the player with the Executive Card can open each of the other players' deliveries for them.
Using the  Radar Scanner allows the player to find the Crashed Multishop "Delivery" faster, as it will be represented as two adjacent chest icons () upon scan.
In multiplayer, all stacks of Shipping Request Form from every player will increase the item rarity of each Multishop spawned from this item. For example, if a player has 5 stacks of this item while another player has 1, both multishops that spawn from the two players holding it will have the item rarity of having 6 Shipping Request Form. So it is not advised for one person in multiplayer to hoard all the Shipping Request Forms, as you lose out on more loot.

Uncommon.name: Shuriken
Uncommon.desc: Activating your Primary skill also throws a shuriken that deals 400% (+100% per stack) base damage . You can hold up to 3 (+1 per stack) shurikens which all reload over 10 seconds.
Uncommon.notes:
The Shuriken is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion.
The item grants the   Shuriken buff, which stacks up to 3 (+1 per stack) times over 10 seconds. When the holder's primary skill is used, a shuriken projectile is launched forward at the same time, dealing 400% (+100% per stack) damage with a 1.0 Proc Coefficient and consuming one stack of the Shuriken buff.


== Notes ==
The projectiles weakly home in on enemies, but in practice this can actually be a liability, because it often prioritize closer enemies instead of what the player is aiming at. Due to how slowly the projectile curves, this usually results in missing both enemies.
Non-primary skills can also throw Shurikens if they use the primary attack input, since these work by temporarily replacing the primary skill. For instance, this means that   Railgunner will always activate the Shuriken when shooting, as her other skills simply change the effect of her primary. The same applies when aiming   Captain's   Orbital Probe and   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike, and when firing   Engineer's   Thermal Harpoons.
In addition to this. certain  survivors will activate the shuriken before actually firing. Such as   Captain's vulcan shotgun firing while aiming. Or   Engineer's bouncing grenades firing before the engineer releases them.


== Math ==
The charge cooldown is determined by the formula f(x)=10(amount+2).


== Tips ==
Shurikens on melee-based characters like   Acrid or   Loader can give them a ranged attack while activating their primary.
However,   Loader does not gain barrier from Shurikens, as her passive only affects her gauntlets.
Shurikens on   Captain are harder to utilize, as they activate as soon as he charges his primary, rather than when he releases the shot.
The lock-on attacks for   Huntress can activate Shurikens, but will only work with a target in sight.
A single stack of Shurikens deals enough damage to activate the  Kjaro's,  Runald's, and  Singularity Bands, allowing characters such as   Engineer and   Commando to more consistently activate them. Conversely, characters with strong single-hit skills can lose out on damage output if Shurikens activate bands instead.
Notably, Engineer's turrets can use Shurikens with their attack, allowing them to use the Bands as well.
Shuriken stacking has both diminishing and quadratic returns. One stack of Shurikens can deal 1200% base damage per ten seconds. A second stack only increases this by 800% base damage, however each additional stack adds 200% more than the last (D=(x+200%)(x+300%)), as both the number of shurikens and the damage they deal increases.
This means that while Shurikens might not stack well normally, if you find a printer, they can become extremely powerful. At six stacks, the quadratic damage growth will get a very considerable return. However it's still not enough to cancel out the diminishing returns of stacking unless you can find sufficient stacks of Shurikens. Going beyond six stacks can increase your DPS by leaps and bounds.
Shurikens are extremely dangerous if monsters gain them (such as in the   Void Fields, with the Artifact of Evolution enabled, or if the monster is a   Scavenger or the   final boss), as they deal large amounts of damage and are difficult to avoid due to their high velocity. If the monsters also have Kjaro's or Runald's Band, even a single shuriken can kill the player.

Uncommon.desc: Activating an interactable summons a Squid Turret that attacks nearby enemies at 100% (+100% per stack) attack speed . Lasts 30 seconds.
Uncommon.notes:
The Squid Polyp is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Automation Activation Challenge.
When interacting with something (with the exception of  Scrappers and Command Essences), the item summons a Squid Turret with 100% (+100% per stack) attack speed that attacks nearby enemies. Each turret normally lasts 30 seconds.


== Notes ==
The 30 second time limit is based on a constant health drain, and as such it can be either extended via healing (e.g.  Bustling Fungus, Shrine of the Woods), or cut short by being damaged.
Squid turrets have 4 (+0.8 per level) base damage. Their attack fires every 0.75s at base attack speed for 500% damage (effectively 666% damage per second per stack) with a 0.1 Proc Coefficient and applies a knockback effect, pushing away targets with a force of 2000.
The turrets' level is based on the ambient run level, so the turrets always spawn at the same level as enemies, not the player's level.
  Captain's   Beacon: Resupply can activate the Squid Polyp, as the beacon itself is an interactable. Keep in mind that each supply beacon only has 3 uses, so use them wisely.
Note that Squid Turrets do not get  Defensive Microbots from Captain's passive.
Use  Gorag's Opus to greatly boost all Squid Turrets' firepower for a short time.
This item cannot be obtained in the Simulacrum mode, and will appear locked if attempting to select it with the Artifact of Command.
The turret can be possessed by a   Void Infestor, potentially turning it into a considerable danger to a player. Care should be taken when activating a Void Cradle while carrying a Polyp, as it'll always spawn a turret along with possibly several Infestors.


== Lore ==
"It’s disgusting."

"It’s only mildly disturbing. You’re overreacting."

"Well, when it turns on us, don’t come crying to me."

"It seems like it wants to only help us, so I’d rather have it close in case that dangerous looking group comes back around."

"I swear there’s more than one. It’s everywhere I look: the storage locker, the food dispenser, the cargo containers, everywhere!"

"You’re exaggerating, it’s probably just following you. Snap out of it!"

"Ow! Did you just smack me!?"

"You were acting hysterical. I had to... Hey, why is that thing looking at me now?"

== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM RALLYPOINT [Redacted] --//

The planet was unforgiving, taking more and more with each passing day. Lives and limbs were lost, and the medical tent grew increasingly busy.

Jans was unfortunate enough to walk right into a group of Lemurians during a routine check around the rallypoint perimeter. He was lucky enough to escape with his life, but the Lemurians wounded his leg before backup arrived. 

Jans leaned back in his cot. He strummed the strings on his ukulele – which he had picked up from an earlier expedition – as he contemplated his thoughts. Nothing too complex, but just a simple tune that he had picked up back when he took lessons as a child. Unbeknownst to him, one by one, he had gathered himself an audience. The gentle melodies of Jans’ ukulele brought a rare comfort to the pained and labored patients, and for the first time since admittance, they felt like they could smile.

Life in the medical tent was never something anybody could look forward to. Death, irreversible injuries, and a choking atmosphere surrounded them. But for a brief moment… the lives of those patients became that much brighter. Jans stopped, surveying the crowd intently watching him. 

He laughed, readying himself for an encore. Maybe things wouldn’t be so bad after all.

Legendary.name: 57 Leaf Clover
Legendary.desc: All random effects are rolled +1 (+1 per stack) times for a favorable outcome .
Legendary.notes:
The 57 Leaf Clover is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the The Long Road Challenge.
The Clover makes random beneficial effects more likely to occur for the holder, and as such is the counterpart to the  Purity (which makes beneficial effects less likely to occur). It affects all random effects except  Tougher Times. 
If a successful proc is not achieved on a roll, it will be rolled one additional time per Clover. For example, assume the player has one item that has a 20% chance to proc a beneficial effect on-hit, and has one 57 Leaf Clover. If the player attacks, and the item does not activate, the roll will be done once more, as the player has one Clover. 
Successes are measured per effect, not as a whole. If one item roll is successful, other items that were triggered by the same proc will continue to roll if unsuccessful.
Since items from chests are created based on the world seed, the Clover does not affect them.


== Math ==
In order to calculate proc probability with a certain number of Clovers, the following equation can be used:
y = 1 - (1 - p)^(x + 1)
Where:

p = total item proc chance (between 0 and 1)
x = the number of Clovers in the player's inventory.
y = new item proc chance (between 0 and 1) with x amount of Clovers.

The inverse of the equation, to find the number of Clovers required to achieve a certain proc probability, is:
x = (log(1 - y) / log(1 - p)) - 1
Note that this is a logarithmic equation. As such, it is impossible to achieve 100% proc chance on an effect (regardless of the number of Clovers held), unless the base chance is already 100%.
In order to calculate proc probability with a certain number of Clovers and a certain number of times a proc chance is rolled, the following equation can be used:
y = 1 - ((1 - p)^(x + 1))^t
Where:

p = total proc chance (between 0 and 1)
x = the number of Clovers in the player's inventory.
t = the amount of times a proc chance is rolled.
y = new proc chance (between 0 and 1) with x amount of Clovers and t amount of times the proc chance is rolled.
This equation is useful for calculating logbook drop chances for multi-phase bosses, like   Voidling and   Mithrix, or more uncommon enemies, like   Overloading Worms.


== Interaction with Purity ==
In the game code, the number of Clovers is referred to as "Luck," with each Clover giving +1 Luck. There are no other means of acquiring positive Luck. Negative Luck is also supported, and can be obtained via the lunar item  Purity. Positive and negative Luck will cancel each other out, and thus an equal number of Clovers and Purity will equate to 0 Luck.
The game runs a proc chance Abs(Luck) times, where Luck is the total amount after Clovers (positive) & Purities (negative) are applied.
If the player has 7 Clovers and 5 Purity, the 5 Purity will cancel out 5 of the Clovers, resulting in a net +2 Luck. This means any given proc chance will be rolled two additional times for a positive outcome. If the amount of each item is switched, resulting in -2 Luck, the proc chance will be rolled two additional times for a negative outcome; this can also be seen as the proc chance needing to successfully roll three times for it to proc (once for the initial roll and two more for each negative Luck).


== Exhaustive List of Clover Effects ==
Luck does not affect chest spawns or contents, Shrine of Chance outcomes, the chance for an  Artifact Key to drop, or the chance for monsters to drop items with the Artifact of Sacrifice enabled.


=== Survivor Effects ===
Critical strike chance. Survivors have a base 1.0% critical strike chance.
  Artificer's chance to   Burn with   Flamethrower (50% base chance).
  Heretic's chance to inflict   Ruin on hit (base chance is equal to the proc coefficient of the damage).


=== Item Effects ===
 Lens-Maker's Glasses' chance to critical hit.
 Stun Grenade's chance to stun a target.
 Tri-Tip Dagger's chance to   Bleed a target.
 Sticky Bomb's chance to attach a sticky bomb.
 Ukulele's chance to fire chain lightning.
 AtG Missile Mk. 1's chance to fire a missile.
 Bandolier's chance to drop an ammo pack.
 Ghor's Tome's chance to drop a gold nugget.
 Sale Star's chance to grant additional items.
 Chance Doll's chance to replace the Shrine of Chance loot table.
 Sentient Meat Hook's chance to hook enemies.
 Happiest Mask's chance to spawn a ghost.
 Electric Boomerang's chance to fire a boomerang.
 Runic Lens' chance to summon a meteor.
 Sonorous Whispers' chance to drop an item on Elite kill.
 Molten Perforator's chance to fire magma balls.
 Charged Perforator's chance to summon a lightning bolt.
 Sautéed Worms' chance to summon a spectral worm.
 Brittle Crown's chance to gain gold.
 Spinel Tonic's chance to get a  Tonic Affliction. A single Clover reduces the chance from 20% to 4%.
 Lost Seer's Lenses' chance to instantly kill.
 Needletick's chance to inflict   Collapse.
 Polylute's chance to barrage an enemy with lightning.
 Tentabauble's chance to inflict   Nullified.


=== Gameplay Effects ===
Monster log drop chance.
Elite equipment drop chance.


=== Monster Effects ===
If a monster acquires critical strike chance, this chance is affected by any Clovers it has. Monsters have 0% base critical strike chance.


== Lore ==
It was a massacre. The orbital probes had incinerated both the battalion and the enemy– as well as the entire plateau. There was no life left to be found - except for one lone soldier.

The soldier trudged through the scorched plains, numbly looking for any survivors.

But he found none.

The soldier tried to find water – he had only just noticed how thirsty he was, and how much his head hurt. How much his heart hurt.

But he found none.

The soldier tried to remember, why he was out on this terrible mission, and why he had to say goodbye to so many.

But he found none.

The soldier tried to find anything – anything that could justify why he was alive. Some semblance of meaning – or hope.

And he found one.

A small leaf, peeking out from a pile of ash. He gently plucked the clover out of the ground – somehow, it survived hours of orbital bombardments. 

With clover in hand, the soldier began the long trek to report back to his superiors. Was this divine intervention? Was there some meaning – some reason as to why both him and this little clover survived? 

Or were they just lucky?


== Version History ==
Anniversary Update
Major Content

== Trivia ==
The 57 Leaf Clover is the successor to the 56 Leaf Clover from the first Risk of Rain. The 56 Leaf Clover did not interact with chance effects, but instead gave a chance for Elite monsters to drop random items upon defeat.
This behavior is partially carried over to Risk of Rain 2, as the 57 Leaf Clover affects the chance for Elite monsters to drop their Elite equipment.
Before the Artifacts update, the unreleased code for the Artifact of Sacrifice would check for the Luck of the killer. This is no longer the case.
Before the full release of Risk of Rain 2,  Runald's Band and  Kjaro's Band were affected by the Luck stat, and therefore were more likely to proc when the player had a Clover. This is no longer the case, as the 1.0 update revamped both Bands.
An interesting leftover of this design change is that Kjaro and Runald, the two   Elder Lemurians who spawn with the Bands in the   Abandoned Aqueduct, also both spawn with 20 stacks of 57 Leaf Clovers.
For every frame that the Clover's effect is triggered at least once, a chime sound can be heard. This is hard to notice when striking an enemy, but it can also be triggered when the player takes damage while holding a  Razorwire, since the item will roll for critical strike before searching for valid targets. As such, being under the effect of the   Void Fog makes this more noticeable.

Legendary.name: Aegis
Legendary.desc: Healing past full grants you a temporary barrier for 50% (+50% per stack) of the amount you healed .
Legendary.notes:
The Aegis is an item introduced in the Scorched Acres Update.
If the holder receives healing while their health is full, they gain barriers equal to 50% (+50% per stack) of the healed amount.


== Tips ==
This item can be used to remove the downside that comes with the  Transcendence and  Shared Design, which normally make all healing items entirely worthless by changing the player's health into shields.
This does not work with percentage-based healing like  Bustling Fungus, since the Transcendence and Shared Design reduce the Fungus's healing to almost nothing.
A critical-oriented healing build with  Harvester's Scythe can allow for easy barrier accumulation.
Once the player has accumulated enough proc items to cause a chain reaction, including on-hit healing items like Harvester's Scythe and Leeching Seed, one single hit can yield a massive burst of incoming healing, thereby making the barrier uptime trivial.
Because of how frequently  Bustling Fungus ticks, it is barely not enough to counteract the barrier decay with 2 stacks. But with 3+ stacks, there will be a positive accumulation of barrier. Similarly, 4 or more stacks of  Weeping Fungus also has the same positive effect.
For optimal barrier gain in conjunction with  Rejuvenation Rack, the amount of Aegis and Rejuvenation Racks should be equal, with Aegis taking priority. Optionally, the amount of Aegis can be two higher (but not three) than the amount of Rejuvenation Racks, instead of equal.

Legendary.notes:
The Alien Head is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
A player holding the Alien Head has all their skill cooldowns reduced by 25% (+25% per stack).


== Notes ==
The cooldown reduction from the Alien Head is calculated before the flat reduction from the  Purity. For instance, if a player holds 1 Alien Head and 1 Purity, a skill that would normally take 4 seconds to cool down would instead have a 1 second cooldown (-1 second from the Alien Head, then -2 seconds from the Purity).


== Math ==
The skill cooldown is determined by the formula cooldown ⋅ 0.75 ^ amount

The cooldown reduction cannot reduce skills' cooldowns below 0.5s.

Legendary.name: Ben's Raincoat
Legendary.desc: Prevents 1 (+1 per stack) debuff and instead grants a temporary barrier for 10% of maximum health . Recharges every 5 seconds.
Legendary.notes:
Ben's Raincoat is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void update.
If the holder has any stacks of this item, most debuffs they would receive are completely negated. When this happens, a visual effect of a raincoat will be briefly displayed over the Survivor and the item will go on a 5 second internal cooldown, represented by the   Debuff Immunity Cooldown debuff. Negating a debuff also gives the holder 10% barrier. After the cooldown is over, the buff will be replaced with the   Debuff Immunity buff, indicating debuffs can be negated again.
The holder can negate 1 (+1 per stack) debuff before Ben's Raincoat goes on cooldown.


== Notes ==
Ben's Raincoat only negates timed Debuffs.
  Permanent Curse and   Permanent Armor Reduction are not negated because they do not expire.
  Void Fog and   Void Fog Strong are also not negated because they are technically not debuffs. Even if they were to be blocked, it would not prevent the damage which is caused by a controller. (See Void Fog for more details on this mechanic)
The  Spinel Tonic's  Tonic Afflictions are also not prevented, since they are items and not a debuff.
Ben's Raincoat can prevent   Disable All Skills from Prime Devastator ONLY when   Debuff Immunity is active, if   False Son manages to apply   Disable All Skills while Ben's Raincoat is on cooldown, debuff won't be cleansed.
Unlike the  Blast Shower, Ben's Raincoat does not prevent cooldown debuffs, such as   Elemental Rings Cooldown and   Safer Spaces Cooldown.

The Bottled Chaos will still trigger when using these equipment, however.
Note that The Crowdfunder cannot trigger the Bottled Chaos, since it is not truly "activated" in the way other equipment are.
Bottled Chaos can activate  Seed of Life, often this will result in nothing happening. But can revive all players in multiplayer.
Your equipment will not be consumed in the process.
Equipment that have special activation conditions will still activate the Bottled Chaos when those conditions are met; for instance, if the player has an Executive Card, the Bottled Chaos will trigger whenever the player buys something with gold.
The Bottled Chaos can call the  Volcanic Egg, so exercise some caution when activating equipment, as the Volcanic Egg can greatly disrupt movement. Using the  Gesture of the Drowned makes this even more likely.
When the Bottled Chaos activates, a shadowy outline of it briefly appears above the holder's head.
When the Bottled Chaos activates, it gathers all acceptable equipment in a list, shuffles them and activates them in order. If an equipment fails to be activated, e.g.,  Forgive Me Please and  Goobo Jr. having reached the cap limit, or  Royal Capacitor,  Eccentric Vase, and  Remote Caffeinator not aiming at a valid target/surface, the activation will not be counted. Additionally, the user's current equipment is removed and added at the end of this list, so that its effect will not be among the first few ones.
This means in order to have a duplicate random equipment activated, the activator must have enough stacks of the item to cycle through the whole list.
Removing and adding the user's current equipment means that a blacklisted equipment can be activated if the user has enough stacks of this item. Most of these will either fail to activate or just refresh the current equipment's effect duration, for which no time has passed anyway.
Keep in mind the user cannot kill two lined up bosses with  Trophy Hunter's Tricorn because the equipment is instantly transformed into its consumed version before Bottled Chaos' effect is activated.


== Lore ==
The one planet they couldn't take.

They had everything locked away in their cells.

Beasts, artifacts of power, gods, memories.

And yet, no matter how many agents they sent, none returned victorious... if they returned at all.

The lucky ones who did survive fled, nervously whispering of a crystalline blade stained with chaos.

The "crystalline blade" mentioned in the item's lore is referring to the sword wielded by Providence.
This suggests that void monsters had previously tried to invade Petrichor V but were driven away by Providence, explaining why no void enemies appeared in Risk of Rain 1. However, once Providence was killed, because   Mithrix was trapped on the moon, the void monsters could begin their invasion of the planet.

Legendary.name: Brainstalks
Legendary.desc: Upon killing an elite monster, enter a frenzy for 4s (+4s per stack) where skills have 0.5s cooldowns .
Legendary.notes:
The Brainstalks are an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Deicide Challenge.
When the holder kills an Elite enemy, all their skill cooldowns are {  temporarily reduced to the minimum of 0.5 seconds, for a duration of 4 seconds (+4 seconds per stack).


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of no cooldowns is incorrect, since skills have a minimum of 0.5 second cooldown.
While the {  No Cooldowns buff is active, the screen is tinted pink.
This item gets a near-permanent effect with the Artifact of Honor enabled.
The  Forgive Me Please will never trigger the Brainstalks' effect, even if theArtifact of Honor is enabled.
Some skills can have their inputs held down for constant use of their skill during the buff, but others will require the input to be pressed again when they're off cooldown.


== Tips ==
The Brainstalks become progessively more powerful late-game as more monsters spawn as Elites, essentially completely replacing the needs for  Alien Head,  Hardlight Afterburner, or  Purity.
While near-instant cooldowns are appealing on paper, remember that the time it takes to use a skill is also limited by how that skill may prevent others from being used. For instance, other skills cannot be used while charging   Loader's   Charged Gauntlet or   Artificer's   Charged Nano-Bomb. Other skills may lock the player into a scripted animation during which skills cannot be used, such as when   Bandit spins his gun while firing   Lights Out and   Desperado, or when Artificer uses   Flamethrower.


== Lore ==
Order:  Biopsy Samples of Cairne Jefferson

Tracking Number: 051*****

Estimated Delivery: 11/11/2056

Shipping Method: High Priority/Biological

Shipping Address: Saura Cosmo, Beacon Post, ???

Shipping Details:

Contained in this shipment should be a variety of biopsy samples from our late Mr. Jefferson. As you know, he was an extraordinary man in almost any manner. He was athletic, brilliant, kind, funny, and an all-around great human specimen. 

He donated his body to science, and as we began the operation we found a most terrifying discovery.

A quick visual examination of the subject’s brain shows a very… particular oddity. It seems to be housing a variety of… glowing brain “stalks”, similar to tubeworms. Trying to biopsy the stalks is impossible - they seem to disintegrate into dust the moment we remove it from the brain. We cannot explain this oddity at all. As such, we have included the entire brain in this shipment.

Please let us know if you find any explanation.
