Legendary.name: Brilliant Behemoth
Legendary.desc: All your attacks explode in a 4m (+2.5m per stack) radius for a bonus 60% TOTAL damage to nearby enemies.
Legendary.notes:
The Brilliant Behemoth is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
All the holder's attacks (including bonus attacks from items) create 4m (+2.5m per stack) explosions that deal 60% total damage. The radius of each explosion is multiplied by the attack's proc coefficient, so damage that has a proc coefficient of 0.0 (e.g.   Bleed from the  Tri-Tip Dagger) will not explode. 
The explosion itself has a proc coefficient of 0.0.


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of (+1.5m per stack) is incorrect.
Unlike all other total damage items, the Brilliant Behemoth strangely inherits the attack type of the triggering hit. This means that the explosion can:
Grant stacks of   Bandit Skull when killing enemies, if the triggering hit is   Bandit's   Desperado.
Add an extra stack of   Expose when triggered by a hit that inflicts it.
Deal additional damage from the Slayer keyword if the triggering attack has that keyword.
Instantly kill enemies using the  Lost Seer's Lenses, if the triggering attack succeeded the instant-kill roll.
Because the Behemoth will not check if the enemy is a boss when inheriting the instant-kill type, this means that bosses are not immune to being instantly killed by the Behemoth if the player instantly kills a non-boss enemy that is close by (as bosses are only "immune" because the Lost Seer's Lenses will not roll the chance to kill them). This does not work on either of the       final bosses, however, as they are immune to this damage type altogether.
Attacks create explosions when damaging an enemy or impacting a surface, even if the projectile is not destroyed on contact with terrain. This means that   Frag Grenades create explosions when bouncing off terrain, and the projectiles from the  Ceremonial Dagger and  Egocentrism will constantly explode when piercing through terrain.
This also means that an attack that normally explodes, such as   Charged Nano-Bomb, will create an additional explosion in the attack's center thanks to the Behemoth. However, any enemy damaged by the original explosion will also explode due to the Behemoth. If the enemy is close enough to the original explosion's center, it can take damage from the Behemoth twice: once from the explosion created by the attack's impact, and once from the explosion created when the attack damages it.
The same exploding effect occurs with the   Overloading exploding orbs.
The explosion will usually damage the enemy that the attack was triggered on, making Brilliant Behemoth at worst a flat +60% multiplicative damage upgrade in addition to potentially hitting other enemies with the explosions.


== Lore ==
“Lasers have their speed. Swords have their edge. Gases have their reach. 

But let me tell you... Nothing, and I mean NOTHING, is as timeless as gunpowder. Just a pinch - jammed into a tight enough socket - and KABOOM! You got yourself not just a powerful weapon, but something that’ll leave a lasting sense of fear in your enemies. I mean, nobody wants to be blown up, right?”

- Autobiography of Jans Czar, Modern King of Weaponry

Legendary.name: Ceremonial Dagger
Legendary.desc: Killing an enemy fires out 3 homing daggers that deal 150% (+150% per stack) base damage .
Legendary.notes:
The Ceremonial Dagger is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
When the holder kills an enemy, whether from a direct attack or one of their items, 3 spectral daggers appear where that enemy died. Each dagger deals 150% base damage (+150% per stack). They aggressively home in on other enemies within 130m, traveling at high speeds toward the nearest target. If the daggers have no targets, they slowly float downwards in midair and disappear after 10 seconds if no target comes within range.
Each dagger has a proc coefficient of 1.0.


== Notes ==
The summoned daggers cannot travel through terrain but also make no attempt to avoid it. If there is any geometry between a dagger and its target (especially flat geometry such as walls), the dagger will likely get stuck as it tries relentlessly to get through.
Each dagger critically strikes independently of the others, and their critical strike chance is whatever the player's chance was when the daggers were summoned.


== Tips ==
The  Forgive Me Please creates daggers when activated, giving an easy way for players to create daggers on demand even when there are no enemies nearby.
Like other on-kill items, the Ceremonial Dagger pairs excellently with the  Crowbar. The Ceremonial Dagger in particular excels with Crowbars, however, due to its long-range homing nature. Even just a few Crowbars can power up a single dagger to kill an enemy in one shot, thereby creating even more daggers. This can escalate to the point that killing just one enemy can create an avalanche of daggers that wipes out many enemies across the entire map.


== Lore ==
The smell of sulfur fills the air.

"Oh god, they're so close. They have Hitchcock. Oh god."

"Grab the - the dagger. From my backpack. Quick."

"I-I don't... I got it. What the hell? This isn't gonna work, Marion. What the hell am I supposed to do with this against those...? They blew him into pieces - oh god."

"You have to... you have to kill me - ah! Kill me. Kill me with it."

"What? What the hell?"

"Yeah - it's the only way. Please."

"What are you saying? Stop!"

"It's a magic dagger. It'll save us. She will save us. But you have to kill me with it."

"Please don't... please don't make me. Oh god."

"Y-you have to. I've seen how this works. It's the only way - they're coming so close. You have to use it on me. Kill me."

"I'm so sorry Marion. I'm so so sorry. I don't think-"

"Do it. Do it now. DO IT NOW! DO IT NOW! DO IT-"

Legendary.name: Defensive Microbots
Legendary.desc: Shoot down 1 (+1 per stack) projectiles within 20m every 0.5 seconds . Recharge rate scales with attack speed .
Legendary.notes:
Defensive Microbots are an item in Risk of Rain 2.
The Microbots intercept and destroy enemy projectiles, such as  Lemurian fireballs, within 20m of the holder. This ability recharges every 0.5 seconds, although it recharges faster with greater attack speed. The maximum number of projectiles that can be shot down at once is equal to the number of held Microbots.
Although the Defensive Microbots have a defined rarity, they cannot be found in Chests, traded for using Cauldrons or 3D Printers, or obtained through any other typical method. They are near-exclusive to the   Captain, who is granted one due to his   passive skill of the same name.


== Notes ==
Many attacks that aren't conventional projectiles can be destroyed, such as   Mini Mushrum spore clouds and fire pools,   Alloy Worship Unit's Alloy Supercharged Detonation, {  Malachite Elite urchin pits, {  Gilded Elite spikes, {  Overloading Elite bombs, the   Wandering Vagrant's Homing Orb Bomb,   Lunar Chimera Exploder's fiery blaze,   Beetle Queen's acid pools,   Imp Overlord's lingering shatter spikes, as well as   Mithrix's blue flame pillars and the shockwaves generated by his shockwave attack and phase 3 hammer slam. The Microbots can even destroy flying rocks on Sky Meadow, though rocks destroyed this way will not grant a charge of  Infusion.
Hitscan attacks, like   Lesser Wisp shots or   Stone Golem lasers, cannot be blocked by Defensive Microbots, regardless of the distance between the holder and the attacker.
The Microbots can also shoot down player projectiles. This is only relevant if the Artifact of Vengeance is active (if an Umbra has Microbots), the Artifact of Chaos is active, or if the   final boss steals Microbots during his final phase.
There are only two legitimate methods of obtaining Defensive Microbots, other than starting a run as Captain:
Risking a Shrine of Order can convert all other held legendary items into Microbots.
Enabling the Artifact of Metamorphosis and randomly becoming the Captain during a stage. His passive skill will grant the player the item, which will remain in the player's inventory even after metamorphosing into a different Survivor.
When starting a run as the Captain and beginning the Trial of Metamorphosis in Bulwark's Ambry, the randomly chosen Survivor will keep the Defensive Microbots for the rest of the run.
In past versions of the game, enabling the Artifact of Vengeance and defeating an Umbra of Captain could drop Microbots. However, since the Survivors of the Void Update, this is not possible (even with the expansion disabled). Instead, playing as the Captain automatically unlocks the logbook entry for the item.
Holding Defensive Microbots as a Survivor other than Captain will not grant allied Drones and Turrets their own Defensive Microbots. That ability is the result of the Captain's passive skill, not the item itself.


== Math ==
The Defensive Microbots' recharge rate scales inversely proportional to attack speed, with the formula

The recharge rate does not get slower with less than 1 attack speed, and cannot be slower than 0.5s


== Lore ==
“Captain, look out!” 

A voice cried from the old man’s periphery. But he knew he was in no danger – with a chirp, his companion microbots activated and fired, disintegrating the fireball. Just as it did every time. 

Quickly spinning on his heel, the old man fired his shotgun, decapitating the Lemurian with a swift and pronounced BOOM.

“I’d worry more about your own safety than mine, private.”

Legendary.name: Dio's Best Friend
Legendary.desc: Upon death , this item will be consumed and you will return to life with 3 seconds of invulnerability .
Legendary.notes:
Dio's Best Friend is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the The Lone Survivor Challenge.
Upon dying, the holder will be revived after a few seconds. This will trigger any on-death effects, such as the ice explosions from Glacial Elites. Upon reviving, the holder gets 3 seconds of   invincibility, and the item is consumed.


== Tips ==
  Engineer's turrets can be revived by this item. Redeploying gives them a new, unused Dio's Best Friend (as long as Engineer's is unused).
While activating the final cell event in the Void Fields, it is possible for enemies to receive Dio's Best Friend as a Legendary item. Players should be careful if this happens, since each enemy will be revived after death once with invulnerability. They can even be revived from death when the completion of the cell event kills all enemies.
Revived enemies can drop items if the Artifact of Sacrifice is enabled, making it a good way to farm items in the Void Fields.
If the Artifact of Metamorphosis is enabled, the player will revive as a new survivor.
The item's invulnerability does not protect the player from being instantly killed by the Nullifier Implosion from a   Void Reaver,   Void Jailer,   Void Devastator, and the   Voidling.
Voidling's Nullifier kills on contact, rather than through a single implosion attack. Invulnerability from this item will be bypassed, effectively killing the player repeatedly through multiple revives.
The   final boss steals and can use this item, although it is unlikely to see this happen as items are typically given back to their original owners before his health can be reduced to zero, to activate the item.


== Lore ==
Hey Dio,

Wow, you have gotten older since the last time I wrote! How old are you now – 10? And so much grumpier, too. I’ve never seen a cat so grumpy. What do you have to be grumpy about?

Despite the fact that you are the pickiest eater I know – and love to meow all throughout the night, every night – it still makes me happy to hear you bounding down the stairs every time I come home. I like when I wake up and I see you sleeping across from me. I like when you sit at the dining table, like you’re going to eat with us too. I like how you hit the power button every time you walk across my laptop. I like how shamelessly needy you are.

Please live a long life – I’m needy too, and I’d like that a lot.

Love,

Duncan

PS would it kill you to purr for mama every now and then?

Legendary.name: Electric Boomerang
Legendary.desc: 15% chance on hit to fire an electric boomerang that travels a short distance before returning, dealing 120% (+120% per stack) damage and stunning all enemies hit. Also deals an additional 42% (+42% per stack) per second. Can strike enemies on the way back.
Legendary.notes:
Electric Boomerang is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
When the holder hits an enemy, there is a 15% chance (which is multiplied by the hit's proc coefficient) to fire an electric boomerang that travels a set distance before returning to the player, dealing 120% (+120% per stack) damage with a proc coefficient of 1.0 and stunning enemies hit. The initial shot and the return trip count as separate attacks, allowing each boomerang to hit twice. Additionally, after the initial strike, each boomerang deals 42% (+42% per stack) damage rapidly with a proc coefficient of 0.2.


== Notes ==
Boomerangs can get stuck in terrain, resulting in a large amount of hits on any enemy standing near one.


== Lore ==
The camp is not well. Blood, thorns and worse litter the area. Days old. He almost made it. He wanders numbly through the wreckage to salvage what he can, eyes empty.
Inside the science vessel Private Gupta finds the roster exceeds the graves he dug. Maybe some escaped. Checking crew quarters, Gupta gasps and rushes up to a mounted metallic boomerang like an old friend.
Hesitating, he pulls it from the wall. He recognizes the signature, his mom’s favorite retired ShockRunner player, ’Joseph Tharson’, of The Volts. His grip tightens as he eases shakily to a knee. Maybe he was meant to survive after all.
-Signal echoes, UES Contact Light

Legendary.name: Frost Relic
Legendary.desc: Killing an enemy surrounds you with an ice storm that deals 1200% damage per second and slows enemies by 80% for 1.5s . The storm grows with every kill , increasing its radius by 2m . Stacks up to 18m (+12m per stack) .
Legendary.notes:
The Frost Relic is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
As the holder kills enemies, an ice storm builds up in a sphere around them. The ice storm deals 300% damage every 0.25 seconds with a proc coefficient of 0.2, as well as   slowing all enemies hit. The radius of the storm starts at 8m and increases by 2m per kill, up to a maximum of 18m (+12m per stack). 


== Tips ==
The Frost Relic cannot critically strike.
This item can usually be overlooked by most ranged classes, but it can be very useful to pick up as   Mercenary or   Loader. The radius is fairly small and is essentially a direct upgrade to melee DPS.
Pair the Frost Relic with  Focus Crystals to further increase its already high damage.
Destroying clay pots and explosive barrels will build up the ice storm.
This can be a double-edged sword, as the ice storm will also destroy these objects. If players are not careful, they may end up taking heavy damage or dying.
Many Frost Relic stacks might not be beneficial, as it is often impossible to kill enemies fast enough to benefit from them.
The  Forgive Me Please will charge the ice storm when active.
The Frost Relic is especially effective when the Artifact of Swarms is active, as there will be twice as many enemies to kill with only half the health.
If theArtifact of Chaos is enabled, the Frost Relic's ice storm will not hurt the holder.
Frost Relic's zoom out can be misleading as   Railgunner while scoped in with   M99 Sniper or   HH44 Marksman, as the bullet fired will be fired from its original position. See the gallery for details.
This item can stay active while intangible using    Shadowfade ( Strides of Heresy).


== Lore ==
“Sven Volz discovered the specimen that holds the record of Galaxy’s Largest Snowflake: a whopping 0.5 meters in diameter, with an average temperature of -52 degrees. However – much to the despair of novelty snowflake enthusiasts everywhere – this gargantuan snowflake was lost in transit aboard the UES Contact Light, which disappeared in uncharted territory. One can only hope that it is preserved and frosty as ever, where ever it may be.”

- Academy Galactic Records 2056

Legendary.name: Growth Nectar
Legendary.desc: Grants 4% increase to ALL stats for each buff, up to a maximum of 4 (+4 per stack) .
Legendary.notes:
Growth Nectar is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
The holder of this item gains a 4% increase to all stats for every unique buff that is currently active, up to 4 buffs (+4 per stack). 
All the stat increases are multiplicative, after all other item stats have been added, which may be worse for some stats and better for others.
The 'all stats' of this item does not include acceleration.


== Valid Buffs ==


=== Survivor Buffs ===
Some survivors have innate buffs that count toward this item:

  Bandit:
  Smoke Bomb counts as 2 (invisibility and speed).
  Desperado stacks count as 1.
  MUL-T:
  Transport Mode is 1.
  Power Mode is 1.
Transport Mode and Power Mode cannot be used together, but one is often active.
  Mercenary:
  Eviscerate immunity grants 1.
  Void Fiend:
Corrupted state permanently grants 1.
During transformations, 1 is briefly activated for immunity. This means that when corrupting, 2 are briefly active.
  Seeker:
Tranquility stacks (grey petal) grant 1.
Saving Grace (gold petal) grants 1. Saving Grace can also be sent to other players, and is lost on death.
  CHEF:
  Roll briefly grants 1.
  Yes, CHEF! grants 1 when queued up.
  False Son:
  Step of the Brothers briefly applies 1.
  Meridian's Will applies 1 while   Energized Core is active.


=== Item Buffs ===
The following items can apply buffs passively or on use which count toward this item:

 Medkit (for two seconds after taking damage)
 Warbanner (when in radius)
 Oddly-shaped Opal (when effect is ready)
 Bolstering Lantern (enemies/allies in radius)
 Chronic Expansion (on kill)
 Elusive Antlers (when picking up orbs)
 Warped Echo (when effect is ready)
 Hiker's Boots (while effect is active)
 Berzerker's Pauldron (on activation)
 Kjaro's Band or  Runald's Band (when effect is ready) (both items count as the same buff)
 Old War Stealthkit (on low health) (counts as 2 for stealth and speed)
 Predatory Instincts (active on critical hits)
 Red Whip (not used combat skills recently)
 War Horn (on equipment use)
 Hunter's Harpoon (on kill)
 Shuriken (1 or more available)
 Breaching Fin (when effect is ready)
 Luminous Shot (1 or more shots charged)
 Prayer Beads (1 or more stacks)
 Unstable Transmitter (when effect is ready)
 Collector's Compulsion (while effect is active)
 Faraday Spur (while charged at least 1%)
 Brainstalks (on killing elite)
 Resonance Disc (after kill, active while charges count down)
 Unstable Tesla Coil (when tesla active)
 Wake of Vultures (on killing elite) (10 different possible buffs)
 Ben's Raincoat (when effect is ready)
 War Bonds (when sufficient money is collected or at the start of the stage)
 Sentry Key (permanent while held)
 Prison Matrix (permanent while held)
 Safer Spaces (when effect is ready)
 Weeping Fungus (active while sprinting)
 Singularity Band (when effect is ready)
 Ultimate Meal (while effect is active)

The following equipment:

 Gorag's Opus
 Jade Elephant
 Ocular HUD
 Super Massive Leech
 Spinel Tonic
 Deus Ex Machina (while blessed after a successful parry)
Every elite aspect
Additionally, the Shrine of Shaping, which grants an   extra life, is considered a buff.


== Notes ==
Clarification: This item increases max health, movement speed, damage, attack speed, crit, regen, and armor.
Unlike other movement speed increases, acceleration is not increased here, potentially leading to feeling "slippery".
Multiplicative crit chance is far less beneficial than linear.
Multiplicative armor is not beneficial if you do not any armor granting items or are playing a survivor with base armor.
Unlike  Irradiant Pearl, it does affect all armor, not just base armor.
The   Growth Nectar Buff does not count towards the 4 (+4 per stack) buffs.
This does not mean it counts as a debuff; whether or not a buff counts is manually set by the developers.
The stat boosts given by this item are multiplicative, similiar to  Spinel Tonic.
Individual stacks of   Growth Nectar Buff are immediately added/removed as other unique buffs are added/removed.
The following items do not count as a buff:
 Cautious Slug
 Rose Buckler
 Frost Relic
 Genesis Loop

Legendary.name: H3AD-5T v2
Legendary.desc: Increase jump height . Creates a 5m-100m radius kinetic explosion on hitting the ground, dealing 1000%-10000% base damage that scales up with fall distance . Recharges in 10 (-50% per stack) seconds.
Legendary.notes:
The H3AD-5T v2 is an item in Risk of Rain 2.
While mid-air, you can begin charging a ground slam by holding [Interact] key (default "E" on keyboard). This will cause you to fall much faster than normal, and upon hitting the ground, they create an explosion whose damage and size scale with the distance they fell. The damage and radius ranges from 1000%-10000% & 5m-100m. Afterwards the explosion takes 10 seconds (-50% per stack) to recharge. 
It will try to automatically lock onto a enemy if one is underneath you while you do this.
While the explosive ability is ready, the H3AD-5T v2 also increases the player's jump height by roughly 400%. 
This is not done by changing your stats, instead doubling your upward velocity when leaving the ground, which makes it much more influenced by the angle of the floor, and other items.
Additionally, the H3AD-5T v2 negates all fall damage taken, regardless of whether the explosive ability is ready or not.


== Mechanics ==
Idle
While idle, the [interact] button must be held down for at least 0.25 seconds before transitioning to the charge state.
Charge:
While in the charge state, the input must be held for another 0.6 seconds to enter the fall state. Letting go will return back to the idle state. Entering the charge state will decelerate towards 1 m/s vertically at an acceleration of 30.
Letting go of the input before entering the fall state can be used to extend the distance of some horizontal jumps slightly.
Fall:
While in the fall state, the user will initially fall downwards at 30 m/s, with an acceleration at a rate of 100m/s2 with a max fall speed of 500 m/s.
The minimum distance must be greater than the starting position, so the user won't cause the impact while grounded or very close to grounded.
If there is an enemy below within 300m, then the user will be slowly moved towards its position while falling.
Impact
The impact has a minimum damage coefficient of 10 (1000%) and a maximum of 100 (10,000%), with a radius scaling from 5m to 100m. To reach maximum damage, the user must fall for 150m.
This impact can crit, and knocks enemies back with an outward force of 200 * scalingDamageCoefficient and a vertical force of 2000. This explosion suffers from Sweet Spot falloff.
This blast has a proc coefficient of 1.0.
If the user somehow loses all stacks of H3AD-5T v2 mid-fall, the impact will not occur.
The user's velocity is set to zero on impact.
After impact, it transitions to the cooldown state.


== Tips ==
This item is highly effective with   Artificer's   Ion Surge, as she can gain as much height as desired before slamming down, maximizing damage.
  Loader can also make good use of it, by using her grapple and punch to move vertically.
  Captain can use his   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike to launch himself high into the air, allowing him to slam back down with the H3AD-5T v2. However, he will have very low health afterwards.
Equipping a  Milky Chrysalis,  Volcanic Egg, or  Eccentric Vase gives the player  vertical mobility.
Due to the way collisions work in the game, mobility and movement speed items (particularly the  Wax Quail) coincide well with H3AD-5T v2. With sufficient horizontal speed, running and jumping into the bottom of a slope will send the player flying into the air, enabling survivors to gain elevation over enemies.
With some finesse,   Mercenary and   Acrid can achieve a similar effect by ricocheting off slopes (Mercenary with   Whirlwind, and Acrid with either   Caustic Leap or   Frenzied Leap).
This item combines well with  Runald's Band,  Kjaro's Band and  Singularity Band, as they are activated when the player deals base damage higher than 400%. H3AD-5T v2 always meets this requirement. Moreover, this has the potential to be the second most powerful damage source of the entire game, making it an ideal match for items based on total damage.
Because a target is acquired and locked into whenever possible,  Focus Crystal is almost always activated. The stacking of crystals alongside  Delicate Watch,  Armor-Piercing Rounds, and  Crowbar will allow most enemies to be quickly killed.
The  Faraday Spur pairs very well with this item as fully charging  Faraday Spur will launch you very high up and get a powerful slam.


== Math ==
The cooldown is determined by the formula f(x)=10/x, with x being the amount of H3AD-5T v2.


== Lore ==
"Denizens of lower-gravity planets like Mercury historically have had trouble adjusting to life on other planets. Mercurians, with their lower bone density (left) would typically shatter their femur within a week on heavier planets. Members of asteroid-rigged flotillas and colony ships have similar issues when arriving home from space.

The invention of Kinetic Dispersion Rings (above) help alleviate the stress of heavier-than-normal gravity by converting kinetic energy into heat, sound, and light. Settlers from Mercury could finally leave their home planet in safety."

-Mercurian History Museum

Legendary.name: Happiest Mask
Legendary.desc: Killing enemies has a 7% chance to spawn a ghost of the killed enemy with 1500% damage . Lasts 30s (+30s per stack) .
Legendary.notes:
The Happiest Mask is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2. 
When the holder kills an enemy, there is a 7% chance that a ghost of that enemy will spawn as an ally, with greatly increased attack strength. The chance for this to happen is affected by Luck.
The ghost inherits all behaviors of the original monster. The level of the ghost equals the "ambient" level of the run, not the player's level.
Ghosts do not take damage through any normal means; instead, their health drops by a fixed percentage every second. Each ghost normally lasts 30 seconds (+30s per stack), though this can be prolonged if they are healed.


== Notes ==
When an entity is killed and resurrected as a ghost, it notably keeps all items it previously had. This means that Elites can be resurrected and keep their Elite status, while with the Artifact of Evolution or on Simulacrum they will also keep any enemy items.
Despite being on the players' team, the ghosts of   Clay Dunestriders,   Grandparent, and             Void enemies may still harm or kill the player with their life-draining tendrils, solar flare, and void implosions, respectively.
The player can damage a ghost via friendly-fire items such as  Helfire Tincture, which may cause them to attempt to attack the player. However, the ghost will not do any damage.
Unlike drones, ghosts won't travel between stages.
If a   Beetle Queen,   Solus Control Unit or the   Alloy Worship Unit becomes a ghost, any   Beetle Guards or   Solus Probes they spawn will not be ghosts, but they will still be allied with the player. This means they can spawn as Elites and will not lose any health over time.
  Void Infestor ghosts will attempt to infest enemies. If successful, their targets will become {  Voidtouched but remain hostile to the player.
When the Artifact of Vengeance is enabled, the holder can kill and resurrect an Umbra as a friendly ghost.
Likewise, it is possible for an Umbra that holds the Happiest Mask to kill and resurrect a player as a ghost, which will be hostile towards other players.
Since the ghost inherits all items, it will also inherit the item that causes Umbras to have special visuals and turn the screen purple. However, on death it will not drop any items, since the death is caused by health degeneration which does not trigger any on kill effects.
If the Artifact of Chaos is enabled, it is possible for the holder to kill and resurrect an ally, or even themself, as a ghost.
If a ghost falls off the stage, it respawns in bounds instead of dying.


== Tips ==
Use  Gorag's Opus to boost the attack speed and move speed of allied ghosts, making them even stronger.
Keep an eye on the health of allied Clay Dunestriders, Grandparents, and void monsters. These monsters have powerful attacks that deal friendly-fire damage, which will hurt even more than normal since ghosts' stats are much higher than a normal monster's; however, they can only use these attacks after losing enough health. Clay Dunestriders only use their life-draining tendrils below 25% health, Grandparents only use their solar flare below 50%, and void monsters only use their implosion after dying.
This is especially pertinent in   Eclipse mode, since all allies spawn at 50% of their maximum health. This means that Grandparent ghosts will be able to use their solar flare immediately, and Dunestrider and void ghosts will use their dangerous attacks much sooner than normal.
Since a ghost's lifespan is only limited by time, healing it can give the player a near-permanent and powerful ally. Ghosts can be healed by:
Collecting  Monster Tooth orbs or   DIRECTIVE: Harvest fruits.
Being in the range of  Bustling Fungus,  Interstellar Desk Plant, a Shrine of the Woods,   Captain's   healing beacon, or an allied   Mini Mushrum (likely a ghost itself).
Being in the Teleporter radius when a  Lepton Daisy activates.
If the ghost had self-healing items before it was resurrected, such as  Medkits or  Leeching Seeds. This can occur in the   Void Fields, while the Artifact of Evolution is enabled, or if the ghost is a   Scavenger.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM RALLYPOINT DELTA --//

“Sir, the ghosts are back.”

The man sighed. After a routine expedition, one of the crew members – a simple soldier - had recovered an artifact thought to have been aboard the Contact Light – a simple mask, adorned with a painfully happy grin. 

“I’ll take care of it.” The man trudged down the hall towards the barracks. The Lemurians he had killed earlier that day walked down the hall by him, barely earning a second glance from the man. This had become so commonplace that most of the crew members in this block had grown accustomed to having a ghostly room-mate.

But enough was enough. Stepping through the ghost of an Imp, the man slammed the door open. The lights were off, and in the corner sat the soldier.

“Alright, we’ve had enough fun playing with the dead. Fork it over.”

No response. The man grunted and hoisted the soldier to his feet, giving him a few rough shakes. “Hey, can you hear me!? I said hand over the mask! I’m tired of waking up next to Beetles, so give it a rest already--”

The soldier’s limp body moved. Slowly, the soldier raised his finger – pointing directly at the man.

“What are you...?” With a sense of dread, the man turned and saw the Lemurians he had killed earlier step into the room. Their mouths began to glow with an otherworldly glow.

The man cursed under his breath as he loaded his shotgun. “This planet, I tell you...”

== Trivia ==
A ghost is actually the original monster with three special hidden items equipped. One makes its health deplete over time; ghosts are awarded 30 of these per Happiest Mask the user has. The second makes it appear and behave like a ghost, so that it is invulnerable to normal damage and becomes transparent. The third boosts its damage; the ghost is supplied 150 of these.
Because the time a ghost lasts is tied only to a damage-over-time item it receives, it is possible that   Mini Mushrum ghosts can survive indefinitely because of their healing ability.
Because   Captain's   Defensive Microbots passive grants  Defensive Microbots to allies with the "mechanical" body tag, if Captain kills and resurrects either   MUL-T,   REX, or   CHEF as a ghost (via either the Artifact of Chaos or Artifact of Vengeance), he will give Defensive Microbots to the ghost.

Legendary.name: Hardlight Afterburner
Legendary.desc: Add +2 (+2 per stack) charges of your Utility skill . Reduces Utility skill cooldown by 33% .
Legendary.notes:
The Hardlight Afterburner is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
The holder gains an extra 2 (+2 per stack) charges of their utility skill, and the cooldown of their utility skill is reduced by 33%.


== Tips ==
  Engineer's   Bubble Shield can be maintained 100% of the time with the Afterburner's cooldown reduction.
  Mercenary and   REX can stay in the air indefinitely using their utility skills when holding an Afterburner.
  Huntress can do the same with   Blink.
When paired with the  Strides of Heresy, the Hardlight Afterburner makes using   Shadowfade much easier. With 3 charges, the player can gain up to 9 seconds of invulnerability at a time, depending on how much invulnerable time the situation calls for.
  Captain thrives with this item, as both of his utility abilities are very powerful damage abilities. With a Hardlight Afterburner, Captain can use up to 9   Orbital Probes or 3   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strikes in quick succession, allowing him to concentrate damage on a single target or spread damage across a much wider area.

Legendary.name: Interstellar Desk Plant
Legendary.desc: On kill, plant a healing fruit seed that grows into a plant after 5 seconds. The plant heals for 5% of maximum health every 0.5 second to all allies within 10m (+5.0m per stack) . Lasts 10 seconds.
Legendary.notes:
The Interstellar Desk Plant is a returning item in Risk of Rain 2.
5 seconds after the holder kills an enemy, a small potted plant appears on the ground where that enemy died. After another 0.5 seconds, the plant creates a healing zone with a 10 meter radius (+5m per stack) that heals all allies within for 5% of their maximum health per 0.5 second, similarly to  Bustling Fungus. It takes 0.5 seconds for the healing radius to reach its maximum size.
Each plant lasts for 10 seconds before disappearing.


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of the base healing radius being 5m is incorrect. It is actually 10m.


== Tips ==
The  Forgive Me Please pairs very well with this item, as it will spawn multiple plants on top of each other and create a powerful healing radius.
  Engineer can make some great use with this item, especially if running the ability  TR58 Carbonizer Turret. Since the turrets move with Engineer, the nearby enemies that they kill will activate this item, and the turrets can possibly walk into the healing area.

Legendary.name: Item Scrap, Red
Legendary.desc: Does nothing. Prioritized when used with 3D Printers .
Legendary.notes:
Item Scrap is a group of items in Risk of Rain 2 with no passive effects. However, when using a 3D Printer or Cauldron, any Item Scrap of the required rarity will be prioritized and consumed before any other item. 
These items cannot be found normally. Instead, using a Scrapper to get rid of an item or a Drone Scrapper to get rid of a Drone will produce an Item Scrap of the same rarity:

White (Common) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, White
Green (Uncommon) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Green
Red (Legendary) items and drones produce  Item Scrap, Red
Yellow (Boss) items produce  Item Scrap, Yellow


== Notes ==
The  Recycler cannot be used on these items, and they do not appear in Scrappers.
If the player uses a Shrine of Order while holding Item Scrap, it is possible for all their items of the same rarity as that Item Scrap to be transformed into Item Scrap.
If upgraded using  Benthic Bloom, it may transform into any item of the target rarity, unrestricted by category.
Despite working similarly to 3D Printers, no Item Scrap equivalent exists for use in Cleansing Pools.
If Artifact of Devotion is enabled, when a Lemurian follower is killed, it will drop one Scrap in the same tier as the item that was offered to hatch it.
Item Scraps  White,  Green, and  Red can be obtained through the Drone Scrapper.
Item Scraps can be duplicated via Crafting.


== Lore ==
All scrap have the same lore entry.

“While officially licensed materials are always recommended, hobbyists are known to take matters into their own hands when in a pinch. Don’t have any materials up to par? Make your own! Recycling old parts can be a fun way to create materials for your projects.”

- The Ultimate Hobby Guide: Kitbashing and 3D Printing

Legendary.name: N'kuhana's Opinion
Legendary.desc: Store 100% (+100% per stack) of healing as Soul Energy . After your Soul Energy reaches 10% of your maximum health , fire a skull that deals 250% of your Soul Energy as damage .
Legendary.notes:
N'kuhana's Opinion is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Her Concepts Challenge.
As the holder heals, the item stores 100% (+100% per stack) of the healing as a hidden value, dubbed "Soul Energy." When this value reaches 10% of the holder's maximum health, the player launches a homing skull that deals fixed damage equal to 25% of their maximum health with a proc coefficient of 0.2 within a 40m radius. 


== Notes ==
The skulls trigger even when healing at full health.
Skulls are fired one at a time, so a large burst of healing (e.g.  Foreign Fruit) will fire multiple skulls back to back.
There is a minimum 0.1 second cooldown between skulls, for a maximum fire rate of 10 skulls per second. This results in a potential maximum DPS of 250% of the holder's max HP per second, assuming consistent healing.
"Healing" implies actively regaining health from a source, where green numbers appear around the player signifying the healed amount; players' passive health regeneration, even when amplified by a  Cautious Slug,  Spinel Tonic, or  Titanic Knurl, will not trigger any skulls to fire.
Although the skulls can trigger on-hit healing effects, such as the  Leeching Seed or  Super Massive Leech, the healing from these items is not added to the Soul Energy value if the triggering hit is a skull.
Shields count as maximum health for the purpose of this item, even if the shields are currently damaged.
The Soul Energy value cannot exceed the holder's full combined health (max health plus max shields). Given the item's high rate of fire, this is usually not a problem, however.
Additionally, once the player's Soul Energy accumulates enough to activate N'kuhana's Opinion, it will deplete Soul Energy and attempt to fire, even if no enemies are in range. This makes it impossible to stockpile more than one second's worth of attacks, no matter how much healing the player has.


== Tips ==
N'kuhana's Opinion is uniquely one of the only items that does not use the Survivor's damage stat or Total Damage; its damage is directly tied to your combined Max Health and Shields. As the holder's health increases per-level and though items like  Infusion and  Personal Shield Generator , the skulls' damage increases, but so does the healing required to fire each skull.
Flat healing, such as from  Harvester's Scythe, isn't penalized for this increased health, as the increased damage typically offsets the higher threshold. However, fewer skulls may mean fewer item procs, so it's important to keep any flat healing up to scratch to keep N'kuhana's up to speed (and for the holder to avoid dying, as is typical of any run).
Percentage-based healing, such as from  Bustling Fungus, grows stronger as the holder's max health increases, as the skulls fire at the same speed and simply deal more damage. However, it's important to remember that N'Kuhana's takes shield into account while these sources do not;  Transcendence would increase the skulls' damage by 50%, but drop the holder's max HP to 1, effectively erasing any percentage-based healing.

N'kuhana's does not benefit from the damage doubling from  Shaped Glass, and the halved HP cuts each skull's damage and required healing in half. As a side effect, flat healing can hit the 10% max HP threshold twice as quickly, while percentage-based healing does not benefit.
 Corpsebloom has some unusual interactions with N'kuhana's. Because it stores all healing and releases it at 10% of the holder's maximum health per second, large bursts of healing will fire one skull per second for an extended period of time. However, this means that the fire rate of those skulls is capped at 1 skull per second (compared to the limit of 10 per second) unless this is bypassed using  Rejuvenation Rack. Generally, Corposebloom is a downgrade if the user can reliably and continuously heal above 10% max health per second.
Uniquely, because Corpsebloom steals and then releases all healing itself, it ignores the restrictions of on-hit healing triggered by skulls. This means a skull can activate on-hit healing, and since Corpsebloom is the item providing the final healing, it will count towards the Soul Energy value where it would normally be filtered out. This means one could theoretically have an infinite loop of consistent, if slow, N'Kahuna's skulls and healing, though this is difficult in practice.
Although the skulls do not use the Damage stat, they can still critically strike and are powered up by the  Focus Crystal,  Crowbar, and  Armor-Piercing Rounds, when applicable.
This item can be extremely useful on   Engineer's   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turrets when combined with Bustling Fungus. The turrets can consistently keep the Bustling Fungus active, since they do not move and are immune to knockback. Additionally, since both of the turrets and Engineer himself receive healing from the fungus and independently fire skulls, placing the turrets such that the healing zones overlap will activate N'kuhana's Opinion very rapidly, dealing high damage at very long range.
  REX excels with N'kuhana's Opinion, as their entire kit revolves around healing and life-steal. They will be able to activate this item very often.
  Heretic performs extremely well with this item, since her   Shadowfade skill heals a large portion of her maximum health and her health is much higher than any other Survivor's.
The  Rejuvenation Rack pairs exceptionally well with this item, effectively doubling the number of skulls fired.


== Lore ==
"Let us begin.

What is your oath?

Not very long ago, health and time were in perfect synergy. Pain and love. Death and memories. The great equalizer. She would always come for us. 

But! Disparity now plagues our generations - and our children's. Not many pass, but so many are born. So many doomed souls, saved. Our hubris as a race continues to grow - unchecked. Unrestrained. 

Now there is no volume in our world for death, and she cannot visit us. But is being alive only an offset from death? Without contrast, won't we all be dead in life? The standard has shifted, and now we are all so very close to never living again.

We must make volume for her name - to restore the balance. Let us consume the Concepts, so we may begin to drain the bloated cistern that is our world. As disciples, we will spread her words and opinions. As pupils, we will sow death. And should we be lucky... be granted an audience by Her.

Weshan!"

-The N'tormat, Chapter I, Stanza I, Verse II

Legendary.name: Networked Suffering
Legendary.desc: Infect up to 4 (+2 per stack) enemies with a computer virus that duplicates 45% of all damage taken and sends it to a global damage pool. Every 3 seconds, ALL infected enemies suffer 100% pooled damage .
Legendary.notes:
Networked Suffering is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
When the user damages the first 4 (+2 per stack) enemies, it infects them with a computer virus. 45% of all damage done to infected enemies are added to a global damage pool, and every 3 seconds, all infected enemies take 100% of the damage in the global damage pool. The damage pool is then reset to 0.
The computer virus counts as a debuff.


== Notes ==
ALL get added multiplied and sent to the pool including: Teammates, Minions & damage with 0 proc coeff like damage over time effects.
Infected enemies glow a green colour, and a green line will be drawn from the player to the infected enemies.
 Noxious Thorn can spread the debuff, however it will not remember who owns the debuff.
As such monsters will not drop gold or activate on kills, but also not count towards the debuff application limit.
This was confirmed to not be a bug.
Looking at an infected enemy will show a green number next to their health, representing the current damage in the global damage pool.
When this number starts flashing red, it means that the current number in the damage pool is about to damage all infected enemies.
The debuff lasts indefinitely on enemies, meaning that once the user has reached the maximum number of enemies infected, they cannot infect other enemies unless they gain another stack of the item, or one of the infected enemies dies.
The damage from the pooled damage does not have a proc coefficient, meaning it will not trigger items such as  Tri-Tip Dagger or  AtG Missile Mk. 1.
The damage does not trigger critical strikes.
The computer virus requires a damage source with a proc coefficient higher than 0 in order to infect enemies.
This means that damage sources like  Brilliant Behemoth's explosion,  Kjaro's Band's fire tornado and   Captain's   Orbital Supply Beacon's impact do not infect uninfected enemies.
There is no distance limit for the debuff.
The debuff is applied permanently, meaning you will have to kill infected enemies to regain stock.
This can be a huge problem if monsters obtain this item, such as when   the Final Boss steals your items, as you will remain infected until your death or next stage.
As it is a permament debuff, it cannot be cleansed with a  Blast Shower or  Orphaned Core.


== Tips ==
Since the computer virus is a debuff, it counts towards  Death Mark, making the debuff easier to get.
The item synergizes very well with Area of Effect (AOE) items, helping both to kill the infected enemies faster and to spread the virus.
Any item or skill that deals damage and has a proc coefficient greater than 0 will spread the virus, with respect to the item's current infected enemies limit. The following are examples of items that can spread the virus:
 Bundle of Fireworks
 Will-o'-the-wisp's explosion
 Ukulele's chain lightning
 AtG Missile Mk. 1's missiles, and by extension  Plasma Shrimp
 Noxious Thorn
 Faraday Spur's explosion
 Sentient Meat Hook's hooks
 Runic Lens' meteor
 Remote Caffeinator's impact
Although the item synergizes well with AOE items, it still proves helpful with single-target damage, as it effectively does a burst of 45% of the damage you've done over the 3 second duration.

Legendary.notes:
The Orphaned Core is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
Grants the user a friendly Solus Invalidator, named Best Buddy.
Instead of shooting Inventory-Disabling projectiles, it launches itself at enemies for 400% (+400% per stack) damage. This attack deals more damage the faster it moves. 
Best Buddy will sprint during this attack, activating various items in the process.
You can interact with the unit to pet it and cleans both of you of negative effects and  cooldown effects.
Best Buddy inherits the user's movement related items. 
The following items are inherited by Best Buddy.

 Paul's Goat Hoof
 Energy Drink
 Mocha
 Elusive Antlers
 Warbanner
 Old War Stealthkit
 Berzerker's Pauldron
 Hunter's Harpoon
 Rose Buckler
 Collector's Compulsion

 Wax Quail
 Growth Nectar
 H3AD-5T v2 (Cannot use explosion)
 Irradiant Pearl
 Little Disciple
 Weeping Fungus


== Skills & Behavior ==
Rams itself through lighter foes dealing 400% damage and impacting on heavy foes for an additional 1000% damage.
Both damage values are multiplied by movespeed %.
As it's always sprinting when attacking, it multiplies the values by 1.45x at minimum
As such for easier calculations 580% and 1450% can be used instead.


== Notes ==
Best Buddy respawns 30s after being defeated.
The 69.6 base damage on lighter targets is not enough to one shot most basic monsters.
With 15% movement speed it will be able to at least one shot   Lemurians.
The cleansing effect removes cooldown debuffs, such as those from Elemental Rings. This can be used during combat.
When the   final boss steals the player's items, he will NOT steal the Orphaned Core, meaning the user retains Best Buddy for that phase of the fight.
The Solus is "sprinting" when it has a purple aura around it.
Compatible items will appear on the Solus.


== Tips ==
As petting removes cooldown buffs, petting can allow you to use items such as  Singularity Band more frequently.
As petting is an interaction,  Bundle of Fireworks and  Squid Polyp will activate, allowing for use in scenarios where you otherwise couldn't use them.
Despite  Faulty Conductor being a movement speed item, it is not inherited, although it will become stronger while effected by the buff from the item.
Movement speed reducing items such as  Stone Flux Pauldron,  Tonic Affliction,  Neutronium Weight are not inherited.
 Gorag's Opus &  Faulty Conductor can even further increase his speed.
Similarly to   Charged Gauntlet,   Thunder Gauntlet, and   Transport Mode, the Solus unit does more damage the faster it moves.
Since the Solus unit inherits the user's movement speed items, it's advisable to get more movement speed items in order to increase its damage output.

The Pocket I.C.B.M. is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion.
This item causes all missile-related items, equipment, and skills to fire two more missiles per missile, tripling the number of missiles fired. Additional stacks do not increase the number of missiles fired further, but instead increase missile damage by 50% (+50% per stack) total damage.

Legendary.name: Rejuvenation Rack
Legendary.desc: Heal +100% (+100% per stack) more.
Legendary.notes:
The Rejuvenation Rack is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Naturopath Challenge.
The item increases all healing and passive health regeneration by 100% (+100% per stack), including the player's base health regeneration.


== Tips ==
This item synergizes very well with all healing items,  N'kuhana's Opinion, and  Aegis.
Due to how  Corpsebloom works, this item will cause it to double dip and be an effective 8x increase in healing with a single of each item
Assuming the player has at least 1 Corpsebloom, the full formula for how much healing the player receives is DirectHealing ⋅ (Corpseblooms + 1) ⋅ (RejuvenationRacks +1)^2
Unless the player also has an Aegis or N'kuhana's Opinion, they should avoid the  Transcendence and  Shared Design. Both of these items effectively negate all healing by turning all health into shields, so the bonus healing would go unused.
The Aegis gives use to healing by transforming overheals into barriers, and N'kuhana's Opinion can still weaponize healing to attack enemies from afar.


== Lore ==

-Unknown Venetian monk

The disc launches itself toward a target for 300% base damage (+300% per stack) , piercing all enemies it doesn't kill, and then explodes for 1000% base damage (+1000% per stack) . The Resonance Disc is an item introduced in the Hidden Realms Update.
When the holder kills an enemy, they get a stack of {  charge for 7 seconds. When they have 4 stacks of charge, the Disc removes all charge and launches itself at an enemy. == Trivia ==
The Resonance Disc is the successor to the Laser Turbine from the first Risk of Rain, and is actually referred to as laserTurbine internally.
The Logbook entry also mentions a turbine, presumably the Laser Turbine, and indicates that the Resonance Disc was to be sent to the same mailing address as the Laser Turbine.
Before the Anniversary Update, the math for Resonance Disc was more complex.
While holding the Resonance Disc, kills generates 2.5 spin, visible by the dot in the model flying around. Spin decays over time. Every 1/60th of a second, Spin = previous spin - (1.25 * time since last kill in seconds). In short, spin decays faster the more time passes between kills.
Spin, in turn, generates charge. Charge does not decay. At 100% charge, the Resonance Disc checks all enemies within the blast radius of its nearest target to see if it can hit more enemies by targeting one of them instead. After selecting a target, it will fire according to the earlier description.
How much charge is generated from spin is dependent on time since the last kill, and the current spin used as a vertical velocity with -0.0125  gravity (so upwards).

Legendary.name: Runic Lens
Legendary.desc: 3% chance on hit to call down a meteor, dealing 2000% base damage . Every 100% attack damage dealt increases the activation chance by 3% (+3% per stack) and damage by 150% (+50% per stack) .
Legendary.notes:
Runic Lens is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
When the holder hits an enemy, there is a 3% chance to summon a meteor on the target which deals 2000% base damage. For every 100% damage dealt by the initial hit, the meteor has a 3% (+3% per stack) higher chance to summon and will deal an extra 150% damage (+50% per stack) if summoned.
The meteor has a proc coefficient of 0.5


== Notes ==
This item's damage is capped at 7500%.
At 1 stack, this cap gets hit by attacks that deal 3700% damage or more.
At 2 stack, 2800% damage or more.
This item's proc chance is capped at 75%
At 1 stack, this cap gets hit by attacks that deal 2400% damage or more.
At 2 stack, 1200% damage or more.
Only one meteor per player/NPC can exist at the same time.
Although proc chains that proc the meteor cannot trigger it again, the meteor itself does not carry over previous proc chain information. This makes it possible to re-trigger earlier procs in the chain. For example, the meteor and  AtG Missile Mk. 1 can end up in an infinite feedback loop. This is most likely a bug.
Relatedly, the   SureProc buff bestowed by  Deus Ex Machina is not transferred to a proc chain after a Runic Lens meteor, meaning the meteor isn't guranteed to proc anything. This can cause wildy inconsistent damage output because of the limit of 1 meteor being active at a time.
The data about the meteor's target, damage, and impending impact are tied to the attacker's body. If this character's body is destroyed before the meteor lands, there will be no blast. The visual ring surrounding the target and implying the meteor is coming is an independent visual effect which does not trigger the explosion.
Body destruction in this case is quite literal. When a character is killed, the body object persists for a little longer to perform its death animation, during which time the meteor can still land successfully. However, respawning destroys the old body and creates a new one.
Despite the meteor visual, only the explosion on impact with the ground deals damage. Therefore, Runic Lens won't be able to damage airborne enemies that are too far from the ground.
 Breaching Fin is an anti-synergy as it will often knock enemies out of the blast area.


== Tips ==
Heavy hitting abilities like   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike, items like  H3AD-5T v2 and equipment like  Royal Capacitor and  Preon Accumulator all have very high damage coefficient, allowing the player to get more value out of Runic Lens by increasing the chances of it proccing and the damage it does.
  OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike is the only base damage source of damage that can hit the cap on both proc chance and damage,  H3AD-5T v2 being extremely close but falling a little short.
Crowd control items and skills such as  Sentient Meat Hook,  Primordial Cube, and   Beacon: Shocking all increase the value of Runic Lens by allowing it to hit tons of enemies at once.


== Math ==
Note: After update 1.3.6, Overspill is no longer mentioned in the Runic Lens' in-game description. This section may be outdated.
The definition of Overspill is
overspill=⌊totalDamage/baseDamage⌋
This is used to calculate the chance of proccing the item
chance=min(5+overspill×stacks,50)
When the roll is successful, the meteor summoned deals damage equal to
damage=min(20+0.5×overspill×stacks,75)
This value is calculated in terms of base damage multiples, i.e., at most it will do 7500% of base damage.
The average damage done by this attack is simply chance×damage.
The following table shows how much damage the meteor will deal on average for various Overspill and item stack values. This assumes no luck. To see instead how much an instance of damage a meteor will deal whenever procced, one has to only take into account the damage formula from above.

Legendary.name: Sentient Meat Hook
Legendary.desc: 20% (+20% per stack) chance on hit to fire homing hooks at up to 10 (+5 per stack) enemies for 100% TOTAL damage .
Legendary.notes:
The Sentient Meat Hook is an item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Deja Vu? Challenge.
When the holder damages an enemy, there is a 20% chance (+20% per stack) that a burst of hooks will shoot out from that enemy, pulling in up to 10 other enemies (+5 per stack) within 30m and dealing 100% total damage to each.
Each hook has a proc coefficient of 0.33.
This item stacks hyperbolically in the chance to fire hooks, and linearly in the number of hooked enemies.


== Math ==
The chance to activate is determined by the formula 1−1/(1+0.2∙x), with x being the amount of Sentient Meat Hooks.


== Tips ==
Similarly to the  Primordial Cube, this item is useful for gathering up many enemies into one spot to strike them all with area-of-effect items or abilities.
Because a large number of enemies are hooked at once, it is possible for just a single activation of the Sentient Meat Hook to activate other total damage items easily, even though its own proc coefficient is low.
Due to the hyperbolic stacking, a single Sentient Meat Hook will activate more frequently when stacked with  57 Leaf Clovers than additional stacks of Sentient Meat Hook. The only drawback to this is the number of enemies it can hook, but this is rarely an issue.
To get an even higher chance, you can get more meat hooks along with clovers.

After a series of gruesome lawsuits stemming from hacked smart appliances, most products soon went back to their more traditional, analog lines."

Legendary.name: Shattering Justice
Legendary.desc: After hitting an enemy 5 times, reduce their armor by 60 for 8 (+8 per stack) seconds.
Legendary.notes:
Shattering Justice is a returning item introduced in the Skills 2.0 Update.
Upon hitting an enemy 5 times, that enemy receives the   Pulverized debuff for 8 seconds (+8 seconds per stack), which reduces their armor by 60 points. Since most enemies don't have any or have very little armor, this item usually sets their armor to a negative value.
The build-up effect, a stacking debuff known as   Pulverize Buildup, lasts for 2 seconds, multiplied by the proc coefficient of the hit. Once Pulverize Buildup has stacked 5 times, all buildup stacks are removed, Pulverized is applied, and that enemy cannot receive more buildup debuffs. Because the duration of the build-up is affected by the proc coefficient, damage-over-time effects like the  Tri-Tip Dagger do not put any build-up on enemies.


== Notes ==
This item can be seen as a mostly consistent damage buff for almost all characters, as the way the game calculates damage through armor also accounts for negative armor and greatly increases damage accordingly. The value is approximately 38% more damage for normal monsters and about 55% more for average bosses (depending on their armor).


== Tips ==
The Shattering Justice pairs well with the  Death Mark, since Pulverized and Pulverize Buildup both count towards getting even more bonus damage from the Death Mark.
Note that Pulverized and Pulverize Buildup are mutually exclusive, so an enemy cannot be afflicted with both at once.
In multiplayer, it is wise to give this item to the player with the highest attack speed whenever it appears, as the debuff is applied after 5 hits from any ability regardless of its damage. This means Shattering Justice is best on   Commando with   Phase Blast or   Captain, as the 8 shots fired by both will instantly cause an enemy to be affected by the debuff, allowing the rest of the team to focus on the afflicted monster for serious damage.
Conversely, this item is weaker on   Loader, since her slow base attack speed combined with her focus on her utility skill makes it difficult to apply the debuff without going out of her way to apply extra hits.
A critical hit from   Huntress with   Flurry can also apply the debuff, since it fires 6 projectiles.
Any attack from   Captain's   Vulcan Shotgun that lands at least five bullets will also instantly apply the debuff.
  Bandit using   Burst can instantly activate the debuff if all five bullets hit.
  MUL-T with   Auto-Nailgun can rapidly reach 5 stacks of buildup, especially when using   Power Mode. However, this is somewhat less effective against long-range targets due to damage falloff.
  Power-Saw can also build up 5 stacks easily, but only against nearby targets.


== Lore ==
Shattering Justice Owner’s Manual

... and if the target material doesn’t cave under the immense weight just keep hitting it until it does. The patented technology inside the face of this tool doesn’t just use brute force to break down its mark, it also utilizes a formulated nano toxin, released through internal mechanisms, that builds up through subsequent contact. In other words, each hit makes it easier to break.

Please refer back to section 1.8 for information on proper handling and the included anti-toxin gloves...

The probes summoned by the  Empathy Cores. Although no visible gun is added to the probes, they will still utilize its attack.
Gummy clones of   MUL-T,   REX and   CHEF spawned with  Goobo Jr., since they are considered mechanical. Gummy Engineer turrets also benefit.
  Solus Probe,   Solus Control Unit and   Alloy Worship Unit ghosts spawned by the  Happiest Mask.
This item is meant to work on Devoted Lemurians but does not due to a bug.
Instead it works on wild Lemurians, which can be recruited by Happiest Mask.
Although they may seem like they should benefit, the   Squid Turret summoned by the  Squid Polyp and the allied   Alpha Construct from the  Defense Nucleus are not affected by the Spare Drone Parts.
Since the   Equipment Drone is affected by the Spare Drone Parts, it can attack enemies without using its equipment. This also means equipment that were previously useless for Equipment Drones, like the  Ocular HUD, may have newfound purpose.
If the Equipment Drone has a Goobo Jr., the Gummy Equipment Drones spawned will also be affected by the Spare Drone Parts. The same goes for Strike Drones summoned if the Equipment Drone has The Back-up.
If the Artifact of Swarms is active, one Spare Drone Parts will result in two Col. Dronemen spawning with half health.
The chain gun gained from the Spare Drone Parts is attached to the existing spinning guns on   Gunner Drones and   TC-280 Prototypes, meaning the extra gun will flail wildly when the main one is firing.
When this item is lost, e.g., with a Scrapper, Shrine of Order, or 3D Printer, Col. Droneman will not be removed as an ally. Whenever getting this item, the player will always gain a copy of Col. Droneman, even if they already have one. This can be observed when the   final boss steals the item in his final phase and it is later returned to the player.


== Tips ==
Be advised that when Mithrix steals this item during his fourth phase, he will not gain a Col. Droneman himself but will leave the player's droneman defenseless by removing all bonuses to any drones the player has. (Col. Droneman does not actually have any attacks and its only source of damage is the generic chaingun that every drone gets when holding this item)
When the item is returned, the player will obtain a second Col. Droneman and both drones will obtain the chaingun as well (assuming the first one survives until then).
This item augments damage drones, while providing healing and utility drones an attack to contribute in offensive ways.
This item synergizes well with a   Captain drone build. While   his passive provides defensive measures against most monsters, the Spare Drone Parts allows drone minions to deal considerably more damage.
Although it is tempting to gather as many drones as possible, keep in mind the ally limit of 15; past this point, allies cannot be spawned by items or equipment (e.g. the Empathy Cores or The Back-up). If too many small drones or non-drone allies are on the team, these more powerful drone allies cannot be summoned once destroyed, lowering the team's damage output. This may not be much of an issue, however, since the weaponry provided by the Spare Drone Parts is so powerful to begin with.


== Lore - Item ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM UES [Redacted] --//

"Y'see those new drone models they approved for us? Never thought I'd see 'em in person, if I'm being honest."

"Yeah, for sure. Only the big wigs had access to tech like that... Makes you wonder what we're up against. I mean, everyone's heard the stories, but..."

"Ah, I wouldn't worry. After all, y'know my buddy Jim?"

"From hardware?"

"Yeah, him. Dude's a savant, let me tell you. He got fired from every other branch he worked at for "unlawful modification of company property," and "weapons systems beyond what's legal for citizens to own"."

"Huh. Crazy."

"Mhm. I recommended him for this mission, since I figured we'd need everything we could get our hands on... Luckily, the Captain saw his potential. I just, uh..."

[Fire alarms begin to sound as a fire breaks out in Workshop 23-B. Drones, equipped with buzzsaws, chase technicians down the hall]

"...Hope he doesn't mind the noise."


== Lore - Drone ==
"This statue is dedicated to the TCX line of drone units. Commonly known as 'the bloodiest conflict in human history', the tides of the War of 2019 were completely changed by escalating drone technologies, entirely replacing allied boots-on-the-ground deployments with machines-in-the-air by the end of the war. 

The TCX-55, known by those with whom he served as "Colonel Droneman", as well as other similar less-noteworthy prototypes, were significant for their ability to interface with and parallel compute for other drones in use by UES-affiliated militaries, allowing for a significant increase in firepower per drone, with a TCX unit handling their targeting and routing routines.

Colonel Droneman is highly regarded for its extraordinary character and integrity as well as its unique vision on leadership and combat tactics. Having conducted over 90 operations against Aeonian frontlines and strongholds, Drones under operation of Colonel Droneman were highly feared by enemy forces, deploying previously unseen tactics whilst evading fire and dispatching enemies - many modern principles of drone combat, such as sticking near walls to avoid detection, or keeping distance from vulnerable targets for an opportune time to strike, have been derived from the ingenious strategies first deployed by the Colonel.

Colonel Droneman is still proudly in UES service as of [2056], and was currently last in-use by [Deimos military] in [the Boron System]."

-Exhibit at The National WW19 Museum

Legendary.name: Symbiotic Scorpion
Legendary.desc: 100% chance on hit to reduce armor by 2 (+2 per stack) permanently .
Legendary.notes:
The Symbiotic Scorpion is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion.
On hit, it has a 100% chance (multiplied by the hit's proc coefficient) to inflict   Permanent Armor Reduction on the target, permanently decreasing the victim's armor by 2 (+2 per stack).


== Notes ==
Although the wording of "permanent" makes the item's effect sound rather unforgiving, any stacks of   Permanent Armor Reduction that a player or ally might have accumulated over the course of a stage will be removed when they move on to the next stage, or are revived, similar to the   Permanent Curse debuff from Eclipse 8.


== Tips ==
Keep in mind that negative armor has an asymptotic cap of +100% damage taken, meaning that inflicting more stacks of   Permanent Armor Reduction generally has diminishing returns.
However, an exception to this is monsters which can gain a large amount of extra armor under certain circumstances, such as   Clay Dunestriders,   Scavengers, and   Mithrix. With enough stacks of this item's debuff, these monsters' additional armor can be negated, allowing them to take significantly more damage than normal in these circumstances.
Although the effects of Symbiotic Scorpion and  Shattering Justice are similar, which one is more effective for a given player will depend on their survivor and build. Those focused on stacking up proc effects in order to steadily whittle enemies down would be better off with the Scorpion, whereas those with a focus on heavy hits and burst damage might prefer  Shattering Justice.
This item can be incredibly dangerous if discovered by a   Scavenger, stolen by   Mithrix, or given to the monsters on the final stage of the   Void Fields, as practically every hit the Survivors take from the holder(s) will increase the damage they'll take from all attacks for the full remainder of the stage.
Similar precautions should be taken when playing with Artifact of Chaos, Artifact of Vengeance, and/or Artifact of Evolution. Chaos and Vengeance can make it dangerous for the players to pick up Symbiotic Scorpion, and Evolution could give one or more to all enemies the player(s) might encounter.
Despite being a debuff, Symbiotic Scorpion's armor reduction is not removed by the effects of  Blast Shower.
 Ben's Raincoat prevents the accumulation of   Permanent Armor Reduction stacks, but will not remove stacks that were in place prior to its collection.


== Lore ==
"There's countless ways to defeat your enemy. You can shoot them. You can punch them. Beat them, mash them, stick them in a stew, list goes on. But man, one thing that really makes me laugh...? That's right:

Burying them under a mound of scorpions."

"You're messed up in the head, Bill."

- Signal echoes, UES Contact Light

Legendary.name: Wake of Vultures
Legendary.desc: Gain the power of any killed elite monster for 8s (+5s per stack) .
Legendary.notes:
The Wake of Vultures is an item in Risk of Rain 2. 
Upon killing an Elite enemy, the holder gains that same Elite power for 8 seconds (+5 seconds per stack).
For more information on what powers each Elite type gives, see Elite Status Effects. 


== Notes ==
Since it is possible to gain any Elite power with this item, it synergizes with any items that its respective equipment may synergize with.
 Ignition Tank drastically increases the damage over time from the {  Blazing power.
 Chronobauble's slow effect stacks with the damage over time from the {  Glacial power.
 Plasma Shrimp benefits from the extra shield provided by the {  Overloading and {  Perfected elite powers, as the item is only reliant on having some shield.
This benefit is redundant with the presence of  Transcendence, as those effects provide no extra shield with it active.
It is possible to gain every single Elite power at once.
The Artifact of Honor makes this item more effective, with every kill granting the player an Elite power.
Activating the  Forgive Me Please while holding the Wake of Vultures will not give any Elite effect, even if the Artifact of Honor  is active.
Be wary that this item may interfere with healing-based strategies, as killing an {  Overloading or {  Perfected Elite will temporarily replace half or all of the player's health with shields, respectively. Since shields cannot heal through normal means, this can be an unwanted nuisance for players who are in the fray often and require that healing to stay alive.
However, getting the Overloading buff will also instantly grant 50% shield, even if the holder's current health is below 50% of its max. Similarly, getting the Perfected buff will turn the holder's health into shield and immediately grant 100% shield. In either case, when the effect ends, the holder is also healed for the amount of health originally turned into shields: 50% for Overloading and 100% for Perfected (regardless of how much or little shield the player had right before the effect expired). The  Rejuvenation Rack increases this post-buff restoration, but items like  Corpsebloom and  N'kuhana's Opinion are not affected.
There is a bug involving this item and  Safer Spaces, which allows the shield to recharge instantly. This happens when a character kills a {  Voidtouched enemy and the elite buff expires while Safer Spaces is still on {  on cooldown. This is because when the elite buff expires it removes a stack of the cooldown debuff and when the timed debuff expires, it removes another stack, bringing the total number of stacks to -1. When that character is then hit and loses the {  shield, it will add one stack for the cooldown debuff, but since it will only be at 0 stacks and therefore "not present", the shields will be enabled on the next frame. When the cooldown debuff later expires, it will bring the debuff stacks to -1, conserving the corrupted state.
There is a secondary bug involved here, where the shields behavior is not granted/removed when the character gains/loses the Voidtouched elite buff, but when there is a change in the character's inventory and it makes a check for the elite buff's existence. Therefore, the Safer Spaces shields must be on cooldown while the elite buff shields behavior is removed and not when the elite buff technically expires. Other than adding/removing/transforming an item in the character's inventory, an inventory change check can also be triggered when the character picks up an  Infusion orb. As such, the easiest way to trigger the bug is to hold Wake of Vultures, Safer Spaces, and Infusion. Note that holding an Infusion is an insufficient condition when the character has reached the max bonus health for the currently held stacks and the inventory change needs to be triggered by another method.
This bug fixes itself when the character is revived, or advances to the next stage as all buffs are reset.
Even though the character is impervious to most sources of damage, the shield technically goes on cooldown until the next frame, so if the character is hit by multiple sources of damage in the same frame, only the first one will be protected from the shields, while the rest will go through.
A different way to trigger this same bug is to have the   final boss steal  Safer Spaces while it is on cooldown. When the player retrieves the item, they will gain the same instant recharge behaviour for the rest of the stage.

The order description is "Unique Leather Belt", which is the item type of the Headhunter.
The tracking number "40***********" is likely a reference to the required level to wear the Headhunter.

Boss.name: Artifact Key
Boss.desc: A stone shard with immense power.
Boss.notes:
The Artifact Key is a boss item in Risk of Rain 2. It is randomly dropped by enemies in Bulwark's Ambry during an Artifact Trial. They are used to interact with and damage the   Artifact Reliquary, which is otherwise completely impervious to normal damage. When used, all Artifact Keys in the player's inventory, as well as those still on the field, are consumed, preventing the player from stockpiling them.
The Artifact Key's drop chance is not affected by the  57 Leaf Clover or  Purity, and it will drop even if the Artifact of Sacrifice is not enabled.
It is one of few items that the Artifact of Command has no effect on. Though a Yellow Command Essence will drop, it cannot be transformed into any item except the Artifact Key.


== Lore ==
The key is incredibly simple. A stone crescent, with little discernable detail to the naked eye. But if one looks closer, with a sight beyond sight, they may notice the patterns inscribed on the key’s being. The patterns tell many things:

The key’s function: to unlock a lost trove of abandoned treasure.

The key’s creators: two brothers, one composed of ambition and the other compassion.

The key’s hopes: infused into the key, deep within its core, is a memory of better times, and the hope that one day, perhaps things could be better again.

The key’s reality: the bitter realization that such a reality exists only in the past.

Boss.name: Charged Perforator
Boss.desc: 10% chance on hit to down a lightning strike, dealing 500% (+500% per stack) damage .
Boss.notes:
The Charged Perforator is a boss item in Risk of Rain 2, dropped by the   Overloading Worm. 
When the holder damages an enemy, there is a 10% chance that lightning will strike that enemy, dealing 500% (+500% per stack) total damage.
The lightning strike has a proc coefficient of 1.0.


== Notes ==
Correction: This item does total damage, meaning it deals 500% of the damage of the hit that triggered it, not 500% base damage.
The lightning strike is almost identical to that of the  Royal Capacitor, in which they both have a delayed strike that can be avoided by the target if said target is fast enough.
Unlike all other total damage items, the Charged Perforator rolls its critical strike chance independently of the triggering hit; the rest of the total damage items will land critical strikes if and only if the activating hit is a critical strike.


== Tips ==
The Charged Perforator is especially effective for dealing with flying monsters, since the lightning strike deals severe downward knockback. An airborne enemy struck by lightning will be pushed down at high speeds, suffering heavy damage when it collides with the ground.
This is even more effective for monsters flying above bottomless pits, as they will be instantly killed when shoved downwards.
