Lunar.name: Purity
Lunar.desc: All skill cooldowns are reduced by 2 (+1 per stack) seconds. All random effects are rolled +1 (+1 per stack) times for an unfavorable outcome .
Lunar.notes:
The Purity is a lunar item in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the The Calm Challenge.
It is the counterpart to  57 Leaf Clover. It reduces all the holder's skill cooldowns by a flat 2 seconds (+1 second per stack), but will make their chance effects less likely to occur by rolling them 1 extra time (+1 per stack) to be unsuccessful.
The following chance-based items can reach 100% chance, and therefore are useful even with the Purity:  Lens-Maker's Glasses (and other critical strike items),  Sticky Bomb,  Tri-Tip Dagger, and Ghor's Tome.
The following chance-based items cannot reach 100% chance, and are therefore less useful the more negative luck the player has:  Stun Grenade,  AtG Missile Mk. 1,  Bandolier,  Ukulele,  Happiest Mask,  Sentient Meat Hook,  Molten Perforator,  Charged Perforator,  Brittle Crown, and   Tentabauble.
Items that have guaranteed effects, such as the  Chronobauble or  Kjaro's Band and  Runald's Band, are unaffected by Purity.


== Math ==
If p is the probability of a favorable event occurring without any luck modifiers, the probability of the favorable event is p ^ (x + 1), where x is the number of Purities held. 

For example, if the player has 1 Purity and 2  Sticky Bombs, the probability of a bomb without any Luck modifiers is 10%. Therefore, the probability of a bomb with 1 Purity is 0.1 ^ 2 = 1%


== Notes ==
The luck stat affected by Purity is the same as the one affected by the  57 Leaf Clover, and as such, equal stacks of Purity and the Clover cancel each other out.
The flat cooldown reduction of Purity is applied after the reductions of  Alien Head,  Light Flux Pauldron,  Lysate Cell and  Hardlight Afterburner, making it stack extremely well with them.
 Tougher Times is unaffected by Purity, due to it being unaffected by the luck stat in general.
The cooldown reduction can only reduce skills' cooldowns to a minimum 0.5s.


== Lore ==
It looks like starseed, tanning in dirt.

It smells like hot stone, and tall grass.

It tastes like spiced fruit, sweet and hot.

It feels like solar winds, and solar chimes.

It sounds like two brothers, chasing glass frogs in the sun.


== Trivia ==
The shape of the Purity is a great stellated dodecahedron, being an icosahedron with triangular pyramids on every face.
                      

The logbook for   Helminth Hatchery likely refers to the making of  Purity, indicating that it was originally a Morning Star given as a gift to   Mithrix by Providence. However,   Mithrix snapped off the head and sent it back down, likely corrupting it.

Lunar.name: Shaped Glass
Lunar.desc: Increase base damage by 100% (+100% per stack) . Reduce maximum health by 50% (+50% per stack) .
Lunar.notes:
The Shaped Glass is a lunar item in Risk of Rain 2. 
The holder's base damage is doubled (x2 per stack), but in exchange, their total maximum health is halved (x0.5 per stack). Both these effects stack exponentially, meaning that stacking Shaped Glass will dramatically increase damage but reduce the holder's health to nearly nothing.


== Notes ==
The main drawback of Shaped Glass is the removal of one-shot protection, meaning the player is always in danger of dying from a single attack. Strong-hitting enemies like the   Stone Golem become more threatening when holding this item.
Barrier items like the  Topaz Brooch pair well with Shaped Glass, as barrier decays slower with lower maximum health and provides much-needed survivability.
 Tougher Times and  Repulsion Armor Plate are invaluable items to use with Shaped Glass. The Armor Plate mitigates damage-over-time effects such as{  Burn, and attacks from light-hitting enemies like the  Lesser Wisp.
Tougher Times's void counterpart,  Safer Spaces, may prove more reliable than its uncorrupted version, as it is guaranteed to block a hit. The  Oddly-shaped Opal provides a similar benefit, drastically reducing the damage from a single hit. However, players must be aware of these items' cooldowns.
Fixed damage, such as  N'kuhana's Opinion and  Helfire Tincture, is not increased by the Shaped Glass, since these items do not use the Survivor's base damage stat.
This also means that any total damage items activated by these sources, such as  AtG Missile Mk. 1 and  Ukulele, are not increased by the Shaped Glass.
Due to the limits of the floating-point number system, Shaped Glass has a stacking limit of 127. When holding 128 or more, the holder's health rounds to 0 and they immediately die.


== Math ==
The damage is determined by the formula damage ⋅ 2 ^ amount
The maximum health is determined by the formula health ⋅ 0.5 ^ amount

== Trivia ==
Prior to the 1.0 Update, one-shot protection was unaffected by Shaped Glass, but now Shaped Glass removes the player's one-shot protection entirely.
Obtaining Shaped Glass does not cause the player to take damage, despite the health bar's red animation.
Shaped Glass may be based upon Rupert's Glass, a strange phenomena where a droplet shaped piece of glass is borderline invulnerable from one side, but absolutely vulnerable on the other.
Dying while holding Shaped Glass results in a unique death animation, where the player's Survivor shatters into shards of glass. Additionally, the death message while holding Shaped Glass is unique, displaying "You have shattered into innumerable pieces."

Lunar.name: Stone Flux Pauldron
Lunar.desc: Increase max health by 100% (+100% per stack) . Reduce movement speed by 50% (+50% per stack) .
Lunar.notes:
The Stone Flux Pauldron is a lunar item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion.
This item increases the holder's maximum health by 100% (+100% per stack). However, it also decreases the holder's movement speed by 50% (+50% per stack).

Bug: The speed reduction is applied twice, reducing speed by 33% on first stack as a result.


== Notes ==
Correction: The description that it halves movement speed is inaccurate. The effect is reciprocal as it multiplies the movement speed by 1/(1+stacks). One stack will indeed halve movement speed, but additional stacks will have a diminishing effect. However, even this is not the complete picture, as movement speed is actually calculated as baseValue×sumOfIncreases/sumOfDecreases. As such, if the player has already accrued a lot of other sources of negative contributions, one stack of this item will not halve the overall stat value but have a diminishing effect.


== Tips ==
For most characters and builds, keep in mind that the movement speed penalty of Stone Flux Pauldron will generally be far more troublesome than the accompanying health bonus is worth. The vast majority of enemy attacks come in the form of close-range melee, projectiles with a travel time, and telegraphed area-of-effect attacks. All these attacks also generally will not track a moving player and instead lag behind. As such, the loss of one's ability to effectively dodge these attacks and/or flee from unfavorable fights will more than likely end up meaning they'll take a lot of damage that they could have otherwise avoided. Often, the player may end up taking far more damage than the extra health of the Pauldron can defend them from.
This speed penalty also complicates one's ability to get around each stage in order to search for interactables, and as such, might make it difficult to keep up with the time-based scaling of the game's difficulty. This may be exacerbated in multiplayer games, where a player with one or more Stone Flux Pauldron(s) could have trouble getting to chests and other sources of items before the faster player(s) can pick the stage clean.
The "suffocation" effects presented by the   Void Fields,   Void Locus,   The Planetarium, and Void Seeds are also made far more dangerous, as their damage scales with the player's maximum health anyways. The Pauldron will not make the player survive any longer inside the void, and the movement penalty will leave them slowly trudging through ever-damaging fog.
Similarly, the implosion attacks of dying   Void Reavers,   Void Jailers, and other such Void enemies will kill in one hit regardless of health, making a swift escape more or less the only option to survive them.
Due to the mathematics of how a player's movement speed is calculated, it is generally a losing battle to try to overcome the Pauldron's speed penalty by taking items which give movement speed bonuses, especially when taking more than one Pauldron. Each one taken will more than double the number of  Mocha,  Paul's Goat Hooves, and  Energy Drinks necessary to break even and return to normal movement speed.
A notable quirk revealed by the exceptionally low movement speeds possible by stacking Stone Flux Pauldrons is the fact that a player's friction with the ground is directly tied to their movement speed. As such, stacking many Pauldrons will make the player incredibly slippery, making it rather difficult to manage the knockback caused by enemy attacks (especially explosions like the   Jellyfish's self-detonation) or the recoil from their own skills (such as   Railgunner's   XQR Smart Round System).
With all these factors in mind, it may be better to cut losses with respect to movement speed and instead focus on alternative means of movement that are unaffected by the movement speed stat.
A skilled   Loader can make great use of this item, as she can rely on the momentum from her   Charged Gauntlet or   Thunder Gauntlet to get moving, and use her   Grapple Fist or   Spiked Fist to redirect her momentum and close gaps between herself and nearby enemies.
  MUL-T's high base health and innate ability to grant itself considerable amounts of armor with its assorted skills makes it an excellent candidate for leveraging the benefits of the Stone Flux Pauldron. The push it receives from the ending burst of   Auto-Nailgun also offers a means to compensate for the loss in movement speed, especially when used in conjunction with   Power Mode. Timing the release of two Auto-Nailgun bursts along with a simultaneous jump allows for a directed leap that can carry the player a considerable distance, and the nailguns will usually be ready to fire again just a moment or two after hitting the ground, even without any boosts to firing speed.
  False Son makes great use of Stone Flux Pauldron's health benefit courtesy of his Growth, as it is a very easy method of obtaining more health at a negligible speed deficit, given his already slow movement speed.
Picking up a  Wax Quail or two will grant the player an alternate means of movement regardless of their chosen Survivor, as the boost it gives when a sprinting player jumps is calculated to send them a certain distance forwards, regardless of the player's movement speed. Do keep in mind that having too many Quails may make it difficult to make precise movements, especially with the implicit reduction in friction.
With the  H3AD-5T v2, the item's ability to crash down to the ground after holding the interact key will allow for the player to halt their momentum in mid-air, should they need to. The item's extra effect of negating all fall damage is also especially helpful in this scenario: The player's low traction and reliance on less-controllable means of movement will make falling off of ledges much more common, and fall damage is calculated as a percentage of the player's health, making it hit harder for high-health players.
On all survivors, jumping without providing any directional input (WASD/movement stick) will completely halt any non-vertical momentum. This gives a player with several Stone Flux Pauldrons a consistent means to slow down without having to rely on their immensely reduced friction, so long as they are on the ground to start with.
The Stone Flux Pauldron's health boost synergizes best with items and abilities that benefit from the player taking damage, help the extra health last longer, aid with healing, and/or scale positively with the player's maximum health.
The  Roll of Pennies and especially  Razorwire are quintessential for their ability to benefit from the player being damaged, supplying a tanky player with exceptional sources of gold and damage output, respectively.
Although helpful at first, items that grant flat healing, such as  Harvester's Scythe and  Leeching Seed, will quickly be outstripped by the comparatively massive pool of maximum health that stacking several Stone Flux Pauldrons can offer. Instead, it's generally better to focus on items and equipment that heal for a percentage of maximum health, such as  Medkit,  Interstellar Desk Plant,  Strides of Heresy, and  Foreign Fruit.
Similarly, the flat damage reduction of  Repulsion Armor Plate and  Planula will be dwarfed by the damage of heftier blows that are normally much easier to dodge; for this, consider pursuing items that instead boost armor, such as the  Jade Elephant.
 Helfire Tincture and  N'kuhana's Opinion are uniquely powerful in combination with Stone Flux Pauldron, as they are the only means of offense with a damage output that scales with the user's maximum health instead of their base damage stat. A massive health pool from the Pauldron will give a correspondingly massive damage boost for both of these items.
Since this is the only item that reduces movement speed (excluding  Tonic Affliction), the Stone Flux Pauldron can be used in long runs where a player is overwhelmed by extreme levels of speed, making movement much easier to manage.


== Lore ==
"Much like the earth, you must be sturdy and inflexible. Completely and utterly immovable, in both body and mind. Fear not the sword of your enemy, visualize it shattering against your skin. Focus, and make it true. Fear not the tumbling avalanche, visualize it yielding to your will. But heed, and do not fight without reason. Those who remain rooted will quickly find themselves alone."

-Will of Combat, First Excerpt

Lunar.name: Strides of Heresy
Lunar.desc: Replace your Utility Skill with Shadowfade . Fade away, becoming intangible and gaining +30% movement speed . Heal for 18.2% (+18.2% per stack) of your maximum health . Lasts 3 (+3 per stack) seconds.
Lunar.notes:
The Strides of Heresy are a lunar item introduced in the Skills 2.0 Update and an original part of the Heresy Set. They are unlocked and start appearing in runs after completing the Blockade Breaker Challenge.
Obtaining the Strides of Heresy will replace the Survivor's utility skill (Shift by default on keyboard) with the Shadowfade skill.


== Notes ==
Shadowfade's duration is increased when stacking Strides of Heresy. High stacks can result in more time out of reality than in, which can be excessive without something like  N'kuhana's Opinion.
Shadowfade will not prevent damage from Shrines of Blood, nor environmental damage such as fall damage or suffocation damage in the   Void Fields.
Shadowfade does not remove damage over time effects when activated.
Entering a wormhole from the  Eccentric Vase immediately ends the duration of Shadowfade.
Obtaining this item along with the other three Heresy items will turn the holder into the   Heretic.


== Tips ==
This item is especially useful for   Commando and   REX (without their alternate utility skill unlocked), since Shadowfade is debatably an upgrade over their default utility skills.
  Mercenary,   Loader,   Captain, and   Seeker have their damage outputs substantially lowered with their utility skills replaced.
Loader in particular relies on her utility for the majority of her damage output, and as such Strides of Heresy should NEVER be taken on her unless the player is aiming to become the   Heretic.
Seeker's utility skill   Sojourn does much of the same as Shadowfade, though you lose invincibility from Shrines of Blood and fall damage, as well as the explosion from exiting Sojourn.
  Artificer gives up   Snapfreeze for Shadowfade, but can take unique advantage of the flight effect with her   ENV Suit. Hovering throughout the cooldown effectively grants her slow but unlimited flight, even without   Ion Surge.
It also gives Artificer a powerful defensive option for quickly falling back from danger. While Ion Surge is definitely a strong option for retreating, it still pales in comparison to complete invulnerability. Extra healing also ensures she can get back into the fight faster after sustaining damage.
For all other characters, such as   Huntress,   Bandit,   Railgunner,   False Son,   Chef and   MUL-T, this item is more of a toss-up, and up to user preference.

Lunar.name: Transcendence
Lunar.desc: Convert all but 1 health into regenerating shields . Gain 50% (+25% per stack) maximum health .
Lunar.notes:
The Transcendence is a lunar item in Risk of Rain 2.
It increases the holder's maximum health by 50% (+25% per stack), but replaces all but 1 of their health with shields, which regenerate over a period of 2 seconds after avoiding damage for 7 seconds. Any health gained afterwards, such as by leveling up or picking up health-increasing items, will also be increased and converted into shields.


== Notes ==
The holder needs to avoid damage for 7 seconds before they can begin regaining shields. Mobility and dodging are crucial to using this item.
Because shields cannot be healed outside of recharging naturally, healing items become redundant.
 N'kuhana's Opinion continues to store healing by using the new shield-based maximum health for all calculations.
Obtaining an  Aegis transforms all excess healing into barriers.
Percentage-based healing, such as  Bustling Fungus and  Foreign Fruit, will calculate their healing based on the holder's new maximum health of 1, making them effectively useless even with an Aegis.
Conversely, in the event that the player has little to no healing, the Transcendence can be a great help, providing a way to regain health more quickly.
Taking damage over time can delay the timer for the health regeneration until the effect wears off. Be especially sure to avoid damage from these sources.
 Infusion and  Bison Steak benefit from the Transcendence's health increase, but the  Personal Shield Generator does not. Keep this in mind when choosing how to further augment health.
 Tougher Times will allow the player to have a chance to recharge shields in combat, and  Old War Stealthkits can help the user regain their shields out of danger by temporarily cloaking them.
Obtaining 3 or more stacks of  Strides of Heresy, or a single stack of Strides of Heresy and a  Hardlight Afterburner, makes   Shadowfade last long enough for the player to fully recharge their shields while invulnerable.
Since fall damage calculation uses the player's health without accounting for shields or barriers, the Transcendence effectively reduces all fall damage to 1 point.
This makes the Transcendence useful for Survivors who lack skills to avoid fall damage, namely   Engineer,   Captain, and   MUL-T.
This item should be avoided at all costs when using   REX's "plant" skills that cost health (  Seed Barrage,   Bramble Volley, and   Tangling Growth). The Transcendence completely dismantles these skills' internal synergy of damaging REX to attack and healing to recoup the costs, and as a result it is colloquially known as a run-killer for this Survivor.
The  Silence Between Two Strikes equipment does not apply the 50% shield effect if the survivor has Transcendence, since all of the survivor's health is already converted into shield.
A player holding Transcendence becomes functionally immune to the   healing disabled debuff of   Malachite Elites, as shield regeneration is not considered healing.
However, they must still contend with Malachite monsters' greatly increased attack strength.
Since the Transcendence sets the holder's health regeneration to 0, the negative health regeneration on the   Heretic is removed, preventing her from inevitably dying over time.
Holding Transcendence and  Kinetic Dampener essentailly grants permanent armor, although you won't be able to activate the stunning pulse unless you survive a hit with 1 health.


== Lore ==
You are trying your best to survive. You consider yourself a fast learner. You have been feeling lucky. You have been experiencing feelings of deja vu. If you understand, do not read the next paragraph.

You are taking control of your own beliefs. You feel familiar in unfamiliar environments. You have been gaining an intuition for experiences you've never had. You ponder a past life. If you understand, do not read the next paragraph.

You find yourself searching for things that never have been. You miss things you have never had. You play characters that have never lived. You have been experiencing feelings of deja vu. If you understand, do not read the next paragraph.

You have revealed my hand. Because you have consumed this information, the [observers] will now consume it in time. If you are reading this paragraph, I will be long dead, but in turn you have freed me. I will no longer exist in my universe. There will be no proof that I ever was - but I exist now in yours. I have escaped my suffering. Keep me safe. I hope you do not understand.

Lunar.name: Visions of Heresy
Lunar.desc: Replace your Primary Skill with Hungering Gaze . Fire a flurry of tracking shards that detonate after a delay, dealing 120% base damage . Hold up to 12 charges (+12 per stack) that reload after 2 seconds (+2 per stack) .
Lunar.notes:
The Visions of Heresy are a lunar item introduced in the Hidden Realms Update and a part of the Heresy Set. They are unlocked and start appearing in runs after completing the Blockade Breaker Challenge.
Obtaining the Visions of Heresy will replace the Survivor's primary attack (M1 by default) with the Hungering Gaze skill.


== Synergies ==
On very long runs, this item can be useful for   Acrid,   Loader, and   Mercenary, since enemies will be so powerful that being in melee range is dangerous. However, on a normal-length run, the Visions of Heresy are a downgrade for these Survivors.
Hungering Gaze also removes Loader's main way to activate her   Scrap Barrier passive. Gather other items to make up for the lost survivability.
On Survivors with primary attacks that have high fire rates and/or many projectiles, such as   Commando,   Captain and   MUL-T, Hungering Gaze is a direct downgrade due to its recharge cooldown.
On   Artificer, replacing her primary with Hungering Gaze is generally better when holding a lot of on-hit items, such as AtG Missile Mk. 1, and more of a toss-up when holding none.
The only case when replacing Artificer's primary could be detrimental is when the {  Burn from   Flame Bolt is contributing to a  Death Mark, or is being boosted by  Ignition Tank.
As with most items, Visions of Heresy will affect   Engineer's turrets as well as himself. This means that Engineer can use Hungering Gaze instead of the clunky   Bouncing Grenades, and his turrets will also gain Hungering Gaze. This increases Engineer's damage output as well as his turrets', making it an all-around excellent choice.
Because Hungering Gaze has a cooldown, attack speed items are reduced in effectiveness. Bonus attack speed does increase the rate at which the 12 bullets are fired, but will not modify the cooldown at all, resulting in a lower expected increase in damage output.
Cooldown reduction items such as the  Bandolier and  Brainstalks can help mitigate this downside.


== Notes ==
The delayed explosions can trigger on-hit items independently of the initial hits.
This item has a special interaction with the   final boss.
Obtaining this item along with the other three Heresy items will turn the holder into the   Heretic.


== Lore ==
"…and for her betrayal, and her lies, and her scheming ways, the Heretic was violently separated into four distinctive pieces, each to be scattered across the farthest depths of the Moon. 

First, her many eyes were plucked from her skull and sealed in boiling glass, forced to gaze upon her failure...”

-The Evisceration of Kur-skan the Heretic, III

Void.name: Benthic Bloom
Void.desc: Upgrades 3 (+3 per stack) random items to items of the next higher rarity at the start of each stage . Corrupts all 57 Leaf Clovers .
Void.notes:
The Benthic Bloom is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and corrupts all  57 Leaf Clover's . 
At the start of each stage, the item selects 3 (+3 per stack) random Common or Uncommon items in the holder's inventory. Each stack of a selected item randomly transforms into an equal-sized stack of a random item of the next higher rarity (for example, a stack of 4  Mocha would transform into 4 of a random green item). 


== Notes ==
Legendary, boss, Meal, void, lunar, and untiered items (such as  Tonic Affliction,  Empty Bottle, etc) cannot be transformed.
The items are chosen at random regardless of rarity, stacks, or pick-up history. The items in the transformation rarity are shuffled and if the selected item belongs in any of the Damage, Healing, or Utility categories, the items in the transformation rarity are ordered to include those first. For example,  Mocha will prioritise any Uncommon Damage/Utility items to transform into.
This means if the selected item is either White Scrap or Green Scrap, no items will be prioritised for the transformation.
 57 Leaf Clover is not excluded from being upgraded into, meaning the Benthic Bloom will inevitably start to duplicate itself at an exponential rate.
If a player has less items than the total that Benthic Bloom would upgrade at once, it's possible for it to select the same item twice. This means that an item can go straight from Common to Legendary in a single stage.
Additionally, identical items are consolidated into a single stack even in the middle of the Bloom's transformation sequence. This means a stack of a Common item can be upgraded twice if it combines with a stack of an Uncommon item the player already has. For example, if the player has 1  Mocha, 1  Soldier's Syringe, and 1  Shuriken, it is possible for the Benthic Bloom to first upgrade the Mocha and Soldier's Syringe into 2 Shurikens (for a total stack of 3 Shurikens). After this, it is possible that the third and final upgrade will be to upgrade the Shurikens into 3  Brilliant Behemoth. While this is an improbable scenario, it is not impossible.


== Tips ==
Obtaining a Benthic Bloom in the first few stages of a run can lead to a massive boost in power by giving the player more Uncommon and Legendary items than normal by the end of the first loop, with the tradeoff of not having as many stacks of Common items.
On the other hand, since the Benthic Bloom transforms full stacks of the chosen items, obtaining it very late in a looping run may cause more trouble than it is worth. Suddenly losing all stacks of offensive items such as  Lens-Maker's Glasses or  AtG Missile Mk. 1 can drastically reduce damage output, losing healing & utility items such as  Leeching Seed or  Tougher Times can make it much harder to survive, and because very few legendary items grant movement speed or mobility, this can be a big issue if  Paul's Goat Hoof,  Energy Drink, or  Wax Quail are lost.
One of the largest downsides of this item is that it will eventually consolidate the players items into stacks of Legendary items, most of which have very weak benefits when being stacked.
 Growth Nectar is one of the only reliable sources of speed and other stats as well as stacking very well, however the lack of lower tier items can make it harder to retain buffs for its effects
 Wake of Vultures is the most reliable method to retain multiple buffs especially when gaining multiple stacks. Getting stacks of both of these items can highly offset the downsides of Benthic Bloom.
Making good use of the items that cannot be converted is the most reliable way to keep on top of Benthic Bloom's random variance.
Because Void items cannot be transformed, corrupting items can keep them "safe" from being lost, albeit with a different effect.
Meal items are also unable to be transformed, allowing the player to always be able to rely on their powerful effects.
Lunar items can also help cover for any weaknesses the player may suffer from. A full uptime  Spinel Tonic can help with speed,  Shaped Glass can help with damage and  Corpsebloom is extremely powerful healing due to the very high chance of gaining multiple stacks of  Rejuvenation Rack.
Picking up this item will entirely prevent the player from obtaining  Ultimate Meal for the run since it specifically requires using clovers to be crafted.
However if the player were to craft Ultimate Meal first they can make use of Benthic Bloom's effects while still retaining a large luck increase.


== Lore ==
"Luck? Who needs luck, in a place like this.

To survive here, you'd need more than just luck. You need intuition. Instinct. The right tools. Power.

I know you're scared. And I am too. But if there's anything this hell hole has taught me...

We make our own luck."

- Signal Echoes, UES Contact Light


== Version History ==

== Trivia ==
In keeping with the deep-sea theming of the Void, the term "benthic" refers to the very bottom of a body of water; in the context of this item, it can be surmised that the Benthic Bloom originates from the deepest recesses of the Void.
This may also be why the Benthic Bloom is the corruption of a legendary item, to reflect its scarcity and difficulty to obtain due to the depth of the Void it originates from.

Void.name: Encrusted Key
Void.desc: A hidden cache containing an item (60%/ 30% / 10% ) will appear in a random location on each stage . Opening the cache consumes this item. Corrupts all Rusted Keys .
Void.notes:
The Encrusted Key is a void item added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corrupted version of the  Rusted Key.
With this item in the player's possession, an Encrusted Cache resembling a small purple sphere will spawn somewhere on the map when teleporting in. Interacting with this cache will consume an Encrusted Key and drops a Void Potential orb, allowing the player to choose between three void items (41.66%/41.66%/16.66%).
This chance is affected by the drop chance bias and as a result uncommon options are more likely and legendary options are much less likely than expected. The effective chance is (42.37%/50.84%/6.79%).


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of (60%/30%/10%) is incorrect.
As void items do not have a discernible rarity and all fall under the same umbrella of void, their "rarity" as considered for the cache's drop chances is the rarity of the uncorrupted counterparts (e.g. the  Needletick is the corruption of the  Tri-Tip Dagger, a white item, and so the Needletick is considered a "white" void item).
Void caches will spawn even if the Artifact of Sacrifice is enabled.
If the Artifact of Command is active, the void cache rarity will always be common.
The Encrusted Key will only corrupt other Rusted Keys while at least 1 Encrusted Key is in the player's inventory. Consuming an Encrusted Key will remove it from the player’s inventory, thereby preventing future Rusted Keys from becoming corrupted. This is the only void item that can be removed from a player’s inventory.
In multiplayer, a cache is spawned for each player holding an Encrusted Key.


== Tips ==
Since the void cache itself can contain an Encrusted Key, the player can choose to take it and get a new void item on the next stage if neither of the other 2 options were desirable.


== Lore ==
//--AUTO-TRANSCRIPTION FROM UES [Redacted] --//

"I have this key. I found it one day when I was taking a walk along the beach... It was washed up on the shore, all covered in crust and sand. I dunno why, but I took it with me... I figured it would be neat to try and figure out what this key went to. It'd be like a treasure hunt, y'know? Thing is, no matter who I went to, I never found anything. Any lock that seemed to match, the key wouldn't go in all the way. I was starting to get frustrated. I... I'm not too religious, but for some reason, I felt it was my destiny to use this old, beat-up key and find its match. M-Maybe it would change my life. I dunno. And, when I heard about this mission, for some reason, my heart began to race. I've heard all about the Contact Light's disappearance, everyone has. But... I don't know why, but I felt, in my heart of hearts... Whatever this key went to was where the Contact Light was. And it was my destiny to come along."

Void.name: Lost Seer's Lenses
Void.desc: Your attacks have a 0.5% (+0.5% per stack) chance to instantly kill a non-Boss enemy . Corrupts all Lens-Maker's Glasses .
Void.notes:
The Lost Seer's Lenses are a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of the  Lens-Maker's Glasses.
Upon hitting a non-boss enemy, there is a 0.5% (+0.5% per stack) chance to instantly kill it, multiplied by the attack's proc coefficient. This chance is affected by luck.


== Notes ==
Obtaining 200 Lost Seer's Lenses causes every hit to a non-boss to result in an instant kill.
A non-boss enemy counts as anything without a red health bar. A "boss" should not be confused with Boss Monsters or monsters holding  Infusion, which has the same red health bar, but are not designated as bosses.
Red health bars can appear for Teleporter Event bosses and Simulacrum boss waves; Lost Seer's Lenses will be ineffective against these enemies.
Since the Lost Seer's Lenses are ineffective against boss enemies and the  Armor-Piercing Rounds only work on boss enemies, Armor-Piercing Rounds can help make up the lost damage against bosses.
When the player hits an enemy and the instant-kill roll succeeds, it adds a Void Death damage type to the attack, similar to the   Void Reaver's implosion, which causes instant death with a unique visual of inflicting massive damage. Because the  Brilliant Behemoth inherits the damage type of the triggering hit, if the attack that activates the Behemoth succeeds the instant-kill roll, then the Behemoth's explosion will also instantly kill anything it hits.
This also allows the player to instantly kill bosses because they are also vulnerable to the instant-kill damage type. For example, by instantly killing an enemy that is sufficiently close to a boss, the Behemoth's explosion can transfer this instant-kill roll. However,   Mithrix and   Voidling are immune to Void Death effects, so this scenario does not work on them.


== Tips ==
Having  57 Leaf Clovers can greatly improve the rate of instant killing.
Instantly killing a   Gup will prevent it from splitting into   Geep. Other enemy on-death effects are unaffected however.
When carrying a large quantity of Lens-Maker's Glasses alongside critical-related items (e.g.  Harvester's Scythe), picking up the Lost Seer's Lenses may end up being detrimental.
The player can make up for lost critical chance by using the  Ocular HUD, though only while the buff is active.
  Bandit's   Backstab and   Railgunner's   Magnetic Accelerator can still consistently allow for the effects of critical-related items without needing  Lens-Maker's Glasses, making this item more viable for them.
For Bandit, instant kills triggered by   Desperado will grant a   Desperado Stack and instant kills triggered by   Lights Out will reset cooldowns
With the exception of Railgunner, having more than 10 Lens-Maker's Glasses (100% crit chance) is often pointless, so corrupting them can be useful if the player has passed that threshold, allowing the player to get the most out of 11+ Lens-Maker's Glasses.


== Lore ==
"What does it mean to see?

To a beast, it means to identify potential food and mates. To propagate, to survive. Sight is nothing more than a means to an end, is it not?

To someone like me... To those who know true purpose... To see is to LIVE. To see is to spot that one little crack in the enemy's armor, to spot that smallest moment of hesitation when they rear back to strike.

To see the way flesh folds once the skull gives in to your weapon.

Yes, it's the little things, but seeing those things... REALLY seeing them. Ah, it fulfills you. I do hope you understand... And if not, you will eventually, if you've read this note."

- Lost Journal, recovered from Petrichor V

Void.name: Lysate Cell
Void.desc: Add +1 (+1 per stack) charge of your Special skill . Reduces Special skill cooldown by 33% . Corrupts all Fuel Cells .
Void.notes:
The Lysate Cell is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of the  Fuel Cell.
The holder gets 1 extra charge (+1 per stack) of their special skill, and the cooldown of their special skill is reduced by 33%.


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description does not mention the special skill cooldown reduction.


== Tips ==
This item allows   Engineer to have three turrets placed simultaneously. Additional stacks of this item further increases the number of charges, but will not allow more than three turrets to be placed at once.
This item gives   Captain an additional charge of his (primary) left beacon which can be used as many times as the player holds Lysate cells, however, the amount of beacons that can be present on stage is still limited to 2, meaning the oldest beacon will be despawned.
While Lysate Cell will allow   Void Fiend to use   Corrupted Suppress more than usual, it has no effect while Void Fiend is uncorrupted, since   Suppress can already be used an infinite number of times with no cooldown (as long as Void Fiend has enough corruption to spend).
Extra charges of   Drifter's   Salvage and   Tinker skills can't be used without collecting more Junk first.
Since the Fuel Cell has poor synergy with any equipment that does not benefit from extra charges or cooldowns (such as Elite equipment and the  Executive Card), the player can take a Lysate Cell without any negative effect on their equipment.


== Lore ==
"Recycling is an important thing. And I don't mean recycling a glass bottle to help the environment - though that's important too! No, by 'recycling,' I mean taking one thing, and using it for another. For example, my Ukelele. I love this thing. It has electric properties, and passes them on to my attacks - free chain lightning! But what if I were to 'recycle' it? I think the Uke would make a pretty good melee weapon. Imagine, bludgeoning a Lemurian and pumping it full of volts, in one easy step.

Do you get what I'm saying? There's opportunities for recycling all over the place. You just need to open your mind to the possibilities, and see... And do a little recycling. It's good for the environment."

- Lost Journal, recovered from Petrichor V

== Trivia ==
A lysate is a substance that induces lysis in cells, i.e. cell death through the disintegration of the cell wall/membrane. It may be intentionally ironic that the Lysate Cell contains a cell-destroying substance yet is a "cell" itself.

Void.name: Needletick
Void.desc: 10% (+10% per stack) chance to collapse an enemy for 400% base damage . Corrupts all Tri-Tip Daggers .
Void.notes:
The Needletick is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corrupted version of the  Tri-Tip Dagger. 
On hit, it gives a 10% (+10% per stack) chance to inflict   Collapse on the target (which is multiplied by the hit's proc coefficient). 3 seconds after Collapse is first applied to a target, the effect will trigger, removing all stacks of Collapse on the target and dealing 400% damage per stack removed.


== Notes ==
  Bleed effects from  Noxious Thorn and  Shatterspleen will not be replaced by Collapse.
Enemies inflicted with Collapse have a pulsing red circle displayed on top of them, which grows in size and flashes more vigorously when Collapse is about to deal damage.
If an enemy dies before Collapse deals damage, the circle will remain at the position where it died.
Because Collapse is of type Damage over Time, the damage dealt has a proc coefficient of 0.0.


== Tips ==
Noxious Thorn and Shatterspleen can still be used to apply bleed if Tri-Tip Daggers are corrupted, effectively allowing for both debuffs from Tri-Tip Daggers and Needleticks to apply simultaneously.
Tri-Tip and Shatterspleen do not apply two separate stacks of bleed making Tri-Tip daggers obsolete if players have enough crit chance for Shatterspleen. If players have Shatterspleen, it would be prudent to get Needleticks to get both Collapse and Bleed on hit.
One stack of Bleed deals a total of 240% base damage over 3 seconds, while one stack of Collapse deals 400% base damage after 3 seconds. All stacks of Bleed have their durations refreshed when an additional new stack is inflicted, while all Collapse stacks expire at once after the 3-second countdown begins.
As a result, if the player has enough Tri-Tip Daggers and hit rate to repeatedly reset Bleed stacks, Bleed will outperform Collapse, especially in long fights. However, the Needletick is still useful at low stacks when resetting Bleed would be unlikely, or for Survivors with very low hit rate.

Void.name: Newly Hatched Zoea
Void.desc: Every 60 (-50% per stack) seconds, gain a random Void ally. Can have up to 1 (+1 per stack) allies at a time. Corrupts all yellow items .
Void.notes:
The Newly Hatched Zoea is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void update. It is the corruption of all boss items (excluding  Artifact Keys,  Encrypted Cerebellums,  Exposed Cerebellums,  Prison Matrices, and  Sentry Keys) and is dropped by the   Void Devastator.
Every 60 seconds (-50% per stack), the holder gets a friendly void ally, which is either a   Void Reaver,   Void Jailer, or (rarely)   Void Devastator. The holder may only have up to 1 (+1 per stack) void ally summoned this way at a time.


== Notes ==
Correction: The rate of cooldown is not -50% exponentially per stack, as the actual formula is 60/stacks. So while going from 1 to 2 stacks the cooldown increases by 50%, this does not follow the same pattern for any other stack number.
Since the   Void Devastator cannot normally spawn as a teleporter boss, the only way to obtain this item from the teleporter event is during a void Family Event, which makes it possible for it to spawn as a teleporter boss.
Alternatively, one may acquire this item from a resurrection via  Pluripotent Larva, as long as a boss item was taken beforehand.
Obtaining this item by corrupting a boss item with the  Pluripotent Larva will not unlock the Newly Hatched Zoea's logbook entry. To unlock its logbook entry, it has to be picked up as an item dropped by a   Void Devastator.
Another option is using a  Trophy Hunter's Tricorn on a Void Devastator that can spawn within a Void Seed. However, this will probably not happen in the first few stages as the difficulty coefficient will not be high enough to afford the spawn (see Camp Director for more information).
This item will also corrupt the  Pearl and  Irradiant Pearl, since they have the Boss rarity.
This item also corrupts  Halcyon Seeds due to its Boss rarity.
Umbrae from the Artifact of Vengeance will inherit the item and spawn Void allies, but will never drop the Newly Hatched Zoea, even if it was the Umbra's only item.
The void ally types to spawn are added to a pool, with 15 copies of   Void Reaver, 15 copies of   Void Jailer, and 1 copy of   Void Devastator. This gives probabilities of roughly 3.2% for a Devastator, and 48.3% for either a Reaver or Jailer.
If the Artifact of Chaos is enabled, any   Void Reaver spawned from the item cannot target allies, even when aggravated. However, allies can still be damaged by their basic attack if it hits them when it's hitting an enemy.
The void implosion created by allied void enemies can kill the player and their allies.
The   Void Devastator is the only enemy that can drop Newly Hatched Zoea, even with Artifact of Command.


== Tips ==
  Engineer's turrets do inherit the Newly Hatched Zoea, allowing for 2 additional void allies per item stack.
On top of that, respawning the turrets will allow for even more void allies. This is because the reference to the deployable count of the replaced turret disappears, even though the void allies it spawned are not affected.
If   Engineer has  Pluripotent Larva and any boss item, turrets will gain Newly Hatched Zoea upon dying and being resurrected even though the Engineer will not. This is the only indirect way of spawning void allies without the player holding the item.
Void implosions from void allies are still lethal to the player and their other void allies. Be mindful that one ally's death may lead to avalanching instant-kill explosions.
Notably, these void implosions cannot kill any of the final bosses;   Mithrix,   Voidling,   Solus Wing   False Son, and   Solus Heart.
There is a global ally limit of 20 at a time. This includes void allies, drones,   Squid Turrets, or any other ally that appears on the left side of the screen. This means the ally spawn scaling of Newly Hatched Zoea hard caps at 20 stacks without any other allies. The cooldown however will be 3s, and will continue to decrease with further stacks.
Unlike the normal void enemies, the allied void monsters spawned by this item take damage from   Void Fog/  Void Fog Strong, making them less effective in places like the   Void Fields and   Void Locus. Several stacks of Zoea can be increasingly dangerous in these areas since it increases the number of void allies and the rate they spawn, coupled with the generally slow movement speed of these allies means that when they die from Void Fog damage they'll cause void implosions nearby the small radius of 'safe' zones that players will be within to charge objectives.


== Trivia ==
In biology, the term "zoea" refers to a larval stage in development experienced by many ten-legged crustaceans, especially crabs.
This is in keeping with the crab-like appearance of the boss tied to the item, the   Void Devastator, which seems to imply that the item itself is some form of the boss's offspring.
Furthermore, the item's ability to summon a   Void Reaver or   Void Jailer, as opposed to just the   Void Devastator which dropped it in the first place, might suggest that all three monsters are directly related to one another in some way.


== Lore ==
Lab Dissection Analysis File

Subject: Newly Hatched Zoea

Technician: X. Shun

Table Spec: BioSaf, spectroscopic hood enabled

Notes:

- Taking a moment to contain myself.

- It's been quite a while since we've received a sample--INTACT sample--so I am being abundantly cautious.

- Sample is in excellent condition.  I am pleased with the care Jiminez took compared to her predecessor.

Void.name: Plasma Shrimp
Void.desc: Gain a shield equal to 10% of your maximum health . While you have a shield , hitting an enemy fires a missile that deals 40% (+40% per stack) TOTAL damage . Corrupts all AtG Missile Mk. 1s .
Void.notes:
The Plasma Shrimp is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of the  AtG Missile Mk. 1. 
On hitting an enemy, if the player has any shield, they will launch a homing missile that deals 40% (+40% per stack) total damage with a proc coefficient of 0.2. In addition, the first Plasma Shrimp the player acquires gives shield equal to 10% of their maximum health.


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of +50% total damage per stack is incorrect.
Having any number of Plasma Shrimps will make the shield bar pink, instead of the normal blue color. This includes other shield sources such as  Personal Shield Generator and  Transcendence.
Shields cannot be healed by conventional means, and will only replenish after avoiding damage for 7 seconds.
The shield gained from the Plasma Shrimp is affected by anything that modifies the holder's maximum health, such as the  Shaped Glass and  Stone Flux Pauldron: when the player's maximum health is modified, the amount of shields they gain is increased or reduced by the same amount.
The missiles fired by Plasma Shrimp act differently than every other missile in the game, rapidly homing on the target while ignoring other enemies and terrain. If the original target dies, missiles will not search for a new target.


== Tips ==
Any damage with a proc coefficient greater than 0.0 triggers the Plasma Shrimp. This makes attacks with lower coefficients very effective, since it effectively increases the proc coefficient of them by 0.2.
The Plasma Shrimp can be especially useful on skills that can quickly fire multiple projectiles, such as   Bandit's   Burst, as well as skills with relatively high attack speed, such as   MUL-T's   Auto-Nailgun.
This is notably effective with many items that have low proc coefficients.  Visions of Heresy always triggers Plasma Shrimp twice per shot- once for the initial 0.1 hit, and once for the delayed 1.0 hit,  Ukulele & it's void counterpart  Polylute are both notable because they hit multiple times and each individual hit always procs a Plasma Shrimp with their 0.2 proc coefficient.
It's worth noting that Plasma Shrimp activates on-hit items more frequently and quickly than  AtG Missile Mk. 1, but comes at the cost of dealing less damage from TOTAL damage items such as  Ukulele.
Having the  Transcendence (or, more rarely, the  Shared Design) will turn the player's entire health bar into shields. This makes the Plasma Shrimp always active, granting a consistent increase in damage output.
The  Pocket I.C.B.M. triples the projectiles fired by the Plasma Shrimp, drastically increasing its damage and number of on-hit procs.
Removing the luck-based element of the  AtG Missile Mk. 1 allows a player to use the Plasma Shrimp without being affected by the downside of  Purity. However, if they have increased luck, the Plasma Shrimp can potentially become a damage loss.
At one  57 Leaf Clover,  AtG Missile Mk. 1 deals more damage on average if the triggering Proc Coefficient is 0.7 or better. With two stacks of  57 Leaf Clover, AtG Missile wins out if triggering Proc Coefficient is as low as 0.5; any lower than this, and Shrimp Missile is still productive. These numbers don't necessarily apply to activating on-hit effects. This theory does not account for increased stacks of AtG Missile Mk. 1s which has more single damage potential than Plasma Shrimp.
It's important to note that should you have a  Polylute, Plasma Shrimp is going to be resulting in more damage in nearly every scenario, regardless of how many  57 Leaf Clover you have. Polylute hitting an enemy multiple times pairs extremely well with Plasma Shrimp as mentioned before, and with more clovers, Polylute will trigger more often, resulting in more extra damage from Plasma Shrimp.
Although the Plasma Shrimp is more effective at stacking status effects on enemies than the AtG Missile Mk. 1 in nearly all cases (since it adds +0.2 proc coefficient while the AtG adds 10% of the original), its low proc coefficient means that the extra stacks inflicted will have extremely low duration. However, this is still useful for attacks that have a low proc coefficient themselves.
Notably, because stacks of   Bleed from the  Tri-Tip Dagger and  Shatterspleen are refreshed when a higher-duration stack is inflicted, the extra stacks of Bleed from the Plasma Shrimp can be reset repeatedly.
It is worth noting that unlike the  AtG Missile Mk. 1, Plasma Shrimp cannot be used at the Wandering CHEF, potentially locking the user out of the recipes for  Runic Lens,  Pocket I.C.B.M.,  Disposable Missile Launcher,  Molten Perforator and  Charged Perforator. This has the added effect of making  Sautéed Worms significantly harder to obtain.

Void.name: Pluripotent Larva
Void.desc: Upon death , this item will be consumed and you will return to life with 3 seconds of invulnerability , and all of your items that can be corrupted will be. Corrupts all Dio's Best Friends .
Void.notes:
The Pluripotent Larva is a void item added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of  Dio's Best Friend. 
Upon dying, the holder will be revived after a few seconds. This will trigger any on-death effects, such as the ice explosions from {  Glacial Elites. Upon reviving, the holder gets 3 seconds of {  invincibility, and the item is consumed. Additionally, all items in the player's inventory that have a void variant will become corrupted.


== Notes ==
The following lists all items that will be corrupted by Pluripotent Larva:

 Lens-Maker's Glasses →  Lost Seer's Lenses
 Rusted Key →  Encrusted Key
 Tri-Tip Dagger →  Needletick
 Tougher Times →  Safer Spaces
 Bustling Fungus →  Weeping Fungus
 Fuel Cell →  Lysate Cell
 AtG Missile Mk. 1 →  Plasma Shrimp
 Ukulele →  Polylute
 Will-o'-the-wisp →  Voidsent Flame
 Chronobauble →  Tentabauble
 Kjaro's Band /  Runald's Band  →  Singularity Band
 57 Leaf Clover →  Benthic Bloom
All boss items (excluding  Artifact Key) →  Newly Hatched Zoea


== Tips ==
Due to a Legendary items' rarity,  Dio's Best Friend is much harder to find than Pluripotent Larva. As a result, the Pluripotent Larva is an excellent alternative to extra lives and can be found much easier with the use of  Encrusted Keys.
Depending on how many items can be corrupted at the time of revival, this item could be detrimental depending on the corruptible items in question.
 Lysate Cell may be useless with certain abilities such as   MUL-T's   Retool, where its uncorrupted variant could be far more useful.
Converting 57 Leaf Clovers into  Benthic Blooms removes the player's luck and also begins randomly upgrading their items to higher tiers, which could remove valuable common/uncommon items.
 Newly Hatched Zoea will convert all boss items, which can take away very powerful sources of damage.
Converting  Lens-Maker's Glasses  into  Lost Seer's Lenses can be very detrimental if the player has several skills or items involved with crit, or is planning to fight one of the final bosses.
 Runald's and  Kjaro's Bands will be converted to  Singularity Bands, which can be devastating to high burst damage survivors like   Loader,   Artificer, and   Railgunner, as the Singularity Band deals much less damage than the other bands, and has double the cooldown.
If the player encounters a  Benthic Bloom and has access to a  Recycler, they can convert the item into a Pluripotent Larva 100% of the time. This is because these are the only two Void Legendary items in the pool and the Recycler cannot recycle something into the same object.


== Lore ==
"Life finds a way. Even in the depths of creation, there's bound to be something crawling along the sand, just hoping to make it through the day.

Why don't you take a ride in their shoes, just for one day? You may come out of the experience with a brand new perspective."

Void.name: Polylute
Void.desc: 25% chance to fire lightning for 60% TOTAL damage up to 3 (+3 per stack) times. Corrupts all Ukuleles .
Void.notes:
Polylute is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void update.
When the holder hits an enemy, there is a 25% chance to create a blast of void energy targeting that enemy. This blast will hit 3 times (+3 per stack), with each hit dealing 60% total damage, for a total of 180% (+180% per stack) damage.
This item is the void variant of the  Ukulele. When this is picked up, all stacks of Ukuleles will be converted into an equal number of Polylute stacks. In addition, all future Ukuleles picked up will be immediately converted into more Polylutes.


== Notes ==
The Polylute has a proc coefficient of 0.2, like the  Ukulele.


== Tips ==
The Polylute is in theory similar in power to Ukulele. Ukulele applies TOTAL×80% on 3 other targets, while Polylute applies TOTAL×60% on the same target 3 times. While losing the area-of-effect of Ukulele seems to be significant, Polylute allows the holder to kill the original target much faster and then turn their attention to other enemies.
However, the Polylute supersedes the Ukulele in power when there are 2 or fewer enemies near the original target. This makes the item extremely valuable over its original counterpart against the final bosses;   Mithrix,   Voidling,   False Son, and   Solus Heart.
It is worth noting that unlike Ukulele, Polylute cannot be used at the Wandering CHEF, potentially locking the user out of certain recipes, notably the ones for  Sentient Meat Hook,  Unstable Tesla Coil, and  Electric Boomerang.

Void.name: Safer Spaces
Void.desc: Blocks incoming damage once. Recharges after 13.5 seconds (-10% per stack) Corrupts all Tougher Times .
Void.notes:
Safer Spaces is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of  Tougher Times.
When the holder would take damage, if this item is charged, the damage is completely negated, displaying "Blocked!" instead of a damage number. After blocking damage, the item must recharge for 15 seconds (-10% per stack) before another hit can be negated.


== Notes ==
Choosing between Safer Spaces and Tougher Times can depend on what enemies you encounter during your run. Safer Spaces can be used for a guaranteed block against burst damage enemies like   Lunar Chimera (Golem),   Stone Golem, and   Mithrix. Tougher Times has no cooldown, allowing it to block multiple hits from enemies that attack rapidly, such as   Clay Templar and   Lunar Chimera (Wisp).
Stacking Safer Spaces or Tougher Times will allow for more frequent blocks. It's possible to reduce Safer Spaces cooldown to 1 frame (0.0167 seconds) with 65 stacks, effectively granting the user immunity to attacks. However, reaching 100% block chance with Tougher Times is impossible; the maximum is 99.9%. 65 stacks of Tougher Times will instead give 90.7% block chance.
The   Safer Spaces Ready status effect above the health bar will indicate whether it is charged or not, and a circular shield appears around the Survivor. The effect changes to   Safer Spaces Cooldown while it is recharging, but unlike   Elemental Rings Cooldown and   Singularity Band Cooldown, the recharge period is not indicated with multiple stacks.
Safer Spaces cannot block damage inflicted by the   Void Fog debuff.
It can, however, block damage inflicted by opening a Void Cradle.
If this item is on cooldown when the   Mithrix steals it, it will grant instant cooldown restoration on every frame when it is given back, making the player virtually immune to damage for the rest of the stage. This bug can also be triggered by  Wake of Vultures and killing a Voidtouched enemy (more details and a technical explanation can be found in that item's page).
Keep in mind that upon defeating the third phase, it takes 6 seconds before Mithrix starts stealing items and he does so every 0.21666666 seconds. For 9 stacks of more of this item, the shield cooldown will always expire before Mithrix has a chance to steal it. For fewer stacks, it depends on how many items he has to steal before he steals this.
  REX can trigger the cooldown on demand with any of its skills that cost HP, which can be timed right before the item is stolen, bypassing any stack requirements.
The same applies for   Void Fiend's Void Corruption.
Any survivor can trigger the cooldown on demand by intentionally taking damage from any lingering sources of damage, i.e., the   Lunar Chimera's (Exploder) blasing pools, and the blue flame pillars created by phase 3 Mithrix.
Taking fall damage can be relied upon, but the player must be near the ramps at the edge of the arena before killing the third phase in anticipation of this. Having items or equipment that give enough height boost is another alternative. However, playing as   Loader or holding  H3AD-5T v2 makes the player immune to fall damage, making this not a viable method.
Equipment and skills that can hit the player, i.e.,  Helfire Tincture,  Glowing Meteorite, and   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike can also be used. Note that Diablo Strike may require precise planning if timing is of the essence.
With the Artifact of Chaos survivors can harm themselves. Some allied monsters will also return friendly fire upon being hit, but the player should be mindful they will remain aggressive and pose complications for the last phase of the boss.


== Tips ==
Activating the  Blast Shower recharges Safer Spaces immediately.


== Math ==
The charge cooldown is determined by the formula f(x)=15∙0.9x, with x being the amount of Safer Spaces.

Voidtouched enemies gain the shield recharge behavior without any item stacks, therefore their cooldown is 15 seconds.
The minimum cooldown is 1 frame (0.0167 seconds), achieved with at least 65 stacks of Safer Spaces.

== Trivia ==
This item appears to be a tardigrade, a microscopic animal sometimes known as a "water bear". Tardigrades are known for their incredible survivability and resilience, being found in locations that would kill almost any other animal.
The name "Safer Spaces" is a reversal of Tougher Times, as "safe" can be thought of as an opposite of "tough" and space is the opposite of time, as well as both names being alliterations.
When a hit is blocked, a deeper version of the squeaky toy sound effect that Tougher Times uses is played.
The lore quote is a direct reference to the comic Insufferable issue #6, where it is spoken by a character who is wearing makeshift armor made from multiple babies taped onto his clothing.

Void.name: Singularity Band
Void.desc: Hits that deal more than 400% damage also fire a black hole that draws enemies within 15m into its center . Lasts 5 seconds before collapsing, dealing 100% (+100% per stack) TOTAL damage. Recharges every 20 seconds. Corrupts all Runald's and Kjaro's Bands .
Void.notes:
The Singularity Band is a void item added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of  Runald's Band and  Kjaro's Band. 
When striking an enemy with an attack that deals 400% or more base damage, the Band creates a 15m black hole, which pulls enemies in its radius into its center. After 5 seconds, the black hole explodes, dealing 100% (+100% per stack) total damage to all enemies inside its radius. This bonus attack has a cooldown of 20 seconds and a proc coefficient of 1.0.


== Notes ==
The cooldown for the Singularity Band can be seen above the player's health bar as a {  status effect with up to 20 stacks. 1 stack is removed every second, and when the last stack is removed the Band is {  ready and can be activated again.
Because this status effect is considered a debuff, activating the  Blast Shower will reset the cooldown immediately. However,  Ben's Raincoat does not prevent it from being inflicted.


== Tips ==
Unlike its uncorrupted counterparts, this item has a proc coefficient of 1.0, so it can activate certain items such as  Sticky Bomb,  AtG Missile Mk. 1,  Ukulele and  Brilliant Behemoth. Because both Sticky Bomb and Brilliant Behemoth deal area-of-effect damage, they pair extremely well with the black hole effect of the Singularity Band. A single stack of Brilliant Behemoth, for example, will increase the single enemy damage to a total of 160% of the value of the attack that brought the Singularity into existence. More enemies will further increase this value by 60% per enemy (or squared when it comes to total damage).
In this situation, it takes just 5 enemies for the total damage of Singularity Bands to surpass that of an equal number of stacks of Kjaro's Band, and just 2 enemies to deal almost as much single-target damage as an equal number of stacks of Runald's Band.
While it has double the cooldown of its uncorrupted counterparts and a 5-second delay when dealing damage, this item has neither the single-target limitation of Runald's Band nor the need for targets to stay close to the activation point of Kjaro's Band.
However, since it cannot pull   Magma and   Overloading Worms, they are very likely to avoid the explosion.
Since the Singularity Band deals considerably less raw damage than its uncorrupted counterparts, it can be useful for Survivors who lack extremely powerful single-hit skills but who can still activate the Bands with their skills. In this case, the Singularity Band's utility for grouping up enemies may be more useful than the pure damage of Kjaro's and Runald's Bands.


== Lore ==
"Whether light brightens or fades,

Whether space holds or buckles,

We will draw near.

We will end as one."

-The Syzygy of Io and Europa, Apocryphal Verse

Void.name: Tentabauble
Void.desc: 5% (+5% per stack) chance on hit to root enemies for 1s (+1s per stack) . Corrupts all Chronobaubles .
Void.notes:
The Tentabauble is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of the  Chronobauble. 
On hit, the item gives a 5% (+5% per stack) chance to inflict {  Nullified on the target for 1 second (+1 second per stack), reducing their movement speed to 0. The chance to Nullify a target is multiplied by the hit's proc coefficient. 


== Notes ==
Just because an enemy is Nullified does not mean it cannot move at all; flying enemies can still ascend and descend, and other modes of movement such as the   Parent's teleportation still function normally.


== Tips ==
While {  Nullified targets may help players immobilize enemies, the loss of guaranteed {  slow from the  Chronobauble can make activating  Death Mark more challenging without more stacks of Tentabauble.
Like most status conditions, the   Mithrix is not immune to the Nullified status. With enough stacks or a high fire rate, it is possible to lock him in place repeatedly.
Note that his dash skill cures all his debuffs and can be used even when Nullified, giving him a way to break free.
Although the Tentabauble's chance to Nullify an enemy is hyperbolic, the increased duration means that it can still see increasing returns, not diminishing, with high stacks.
This is in stark contrast to the Chronobauble, which is generally useless past the first stack.


== Math ==
The base chance to Nullify a target can be found with 1 - 1 / (1 + 0.05 ⋅ amount)

Void.name: Voidsent Flame
Void.desc: Upon hitting an enemy at full health , spawn a lava pillar in a 12m (+2.4m per stack) radius for 260% (+156% per stack) base damage . Corrupts all Will-o'-the-wisps .
Void.notes:
The Voidsent Flame is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corruption of the  Will-o'-the-wisp. 
When the holder attacks an enemy that is at full health, the enemy is struck with a fiery blast. The blast has a 12m (+2.4m per stack) radius and deals 260% (+156% per stack) base damage. This damage suffers from sweet spot damage falloff.


== Tips ==
This item's effect triggers 0.2 seconds after the initial hit, meaning this item won't benefit from  Crowbar's damage boost unless the triggering hit deals less than 10% of the target's health (including other instances of Voidsent Flame).
Similar to the Crowbar, this item becomes harder to use with offensive drones and other players, as a single hit from anyone other than the holder will prevent Voidsent Flame from activating.
Since barrier does not count towards full health, if an enemy has any barrier while being at full health, e.g., a Scavenger with Topaz Brooch and activating it with Thqwibs, it is possible for the item to be triggered multiple times for the same target.
Despite slightly reduced damage, this item can easily become more deadly to enemies in groups than  Will-o'-the-wisp.
Instead of needing to kill one enemy, the player can simply damage any target to set off a chain reaction of explosions that can wipe out groups of small enemies and heavily damage or even kill larger ones.
When paired with  Gasoline, this effect is even more pronounced, as any enemies that die as a result of Voidsent Flame will also activate Gasoline and strengthen the chain. Afterburn from the Gasoline can even cause enemies to die after a delay, and potentially even trigger against enemies who weren't there for the initial wave of explosions.
 Helfire Tincture can trigger Voidsent Flame's effect on yourself and allies. However, the resulting explosions only damages enemies, resulting in a huge damage boost as long as you stay at or above full health, which can be done using  Repulsion Armor Plate and regeneration,  Planula,  Topaz Brooch,  Aegis, et cetera.
This combo is particularly powerful on   Loader due to her ability to counter damage from Helfire Tincture with barrier generated by her primary attack.

We take kindling and throw it in the fire.

The fire is pleased. The fire grows.

We take fruit and throw it in the fire.

The fire loves this gift. Embers pop from the fire and perform dances of joy before fading. Compounds inside the fruit are undone, returning to their base components. There are so many colors. So much energy.

We take a body and throw it into the fire. It will not be missed. He has more to spare.

The fire loves this gift. Fat in the body burns, producing a rainbow of beautiful hues in the flame. Muscles contract and snap, stimulated by the gnawing heat. The fire claims its meal, and returns it to energy.

So much energy. I believe I can work with this.

Void.name: Weeping Fungus
Void.desc: Heals for 2% (+2% per stack) of your health every second while sprinting . Corrupts all Bustling Fungi .
Void.notes:
The Weeping Fungus is a void item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Survivors of the Void expansion, and the corrupted version of  Bustling Fungus.
While the holder sprints, the item grants the   Weeping Fungus Regeneration buff, which heals the holder for 2% (+2% per stack) of their maximum health per second.


== Notes ==
The fungus heals 2 times per second, for 1% (+1%) health every tick.


== Tips ==
Weeping Fungus is stronger on Survivors who have the Agile keyword on their skills, such as   Huntress and   Mercenary.
Although   Power-Saw doesn’t count as an Agile ability, it can still be used while sprinting.
Conversely,   Engineer may want to avoid Weeping Fungus when using his   TR12 Gauss Auto-Turrets, as they are unable to trigger the item due to being stationary. However, it does provide strong healing to Engineer himself.
Although the Weeping Fungus may seem like a perfect fit for the   TR58 Carbonizer Turret, turrets never sprint unless there is an extremely long distance between them and Engineer, making this item only effective on Engineer himself.
  Void Fiend will have difficulty transforming into its corrupted form with this item. Two stacks of Weeping Fungus provides enough healing to effectively lock Void Fiend in his uncorrupted form.
Weeping Fungus is particularly effective in Simulacrum as it allows the player to withstand some of the suffocation effects of Void Fog.

Equipment.name: Blast Shower
Equipment.desc: Cleanse all negative effects. Includes debuffs, damage over time, and nearby projectiles.
Equipment.notes:
The Blast Shower is an equipment added in the Skills 2.0 Update. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Warm For Life Challenge.
When activated, it removes any and all negative status effects from the user. This includes, but is not limited to, the frozen effect from   Glacial Elite explosions, the   burn from   Blazing Elites, the   Tar applied by explosive pots and   Clay Templars, and even the   heal block applied by   Malachite Elites.
The Blast Shower also destroys all projectiles in a very small radius around the player, with emphasis on "very small." Removing incoming projectiles is very difficult, but it reliably clears bombs attached to the player by   Overloading Elite attacks.


== Notes ==
 Tonic Afflictions cannot be removed with the Blast Shower, as they are stored in the player's inventory and are not actually a status effect.
The acid pools left behind by   Beetle Queens, the fire fields from   Mini Mushrums, and Malachite spike pits are all technically projectiles and as such can be removed by the Blast Shower if the player is standing on them.
Counterintuitively, the Null Safe Zone barrier effect of the   Void Fields is considered a debuff and is removed, though it is instantly reapplied while inside an active vent. This only results in the player's screen changing color very briefly. This is no longer possible as of the Survivors of the Void Update, due to the Null Safe Zone effect being replaced with   Void Fog.
The Blast Shower cleanses timed debuffs and thus does not cleanse   Permanent Armor Reduction and   Permanent Curse (from   Eclipse 8).
The Blast Shower does not reset the out-of-combat timer. This means that the regeneration from  Cautious Slug, shields (including from  Transcendence,   Overloading and   Perfected), and the  Oddly-shaped Opal armor buff will not be regenerated when the Blast Shower is used.


== Tips ==
The 10 second cooldown of  Runald's Band and  Kjaro's Band is tracked using the stacking   Elemental Rings Cooldown buff, and when all stacks are removed the Bands are   ready. This means that activating the Blast Shower instantly recharges the Bands, making it surprisingly powerful when combined with a  Gesture of the Drowned,  Fuel Cells and/or a  Soulbound Catalyst.
20 Gestures will reduce the Blast Shower's cooldown to less than 0.5s, which is lower than the minimum cooldown of all skills. Cooldown recovery beyond this will only be beneficial when using items that can activate the Bands, such as  AtG Missile Mk. 1.
The cooldown buffs   Singularity Band Cooldown and   Safer Spaces Cooldown function similarly. Continually resetting the cooldown for  Safer Spaces removes the need for stacking the item and allows for higher uptime on damage blocking, to the point of near-invulnerability if enough  Gestures are stacked.
Similarly, the Blast Shower recharges  Ben's Raincoat. Although it might seem the items' effects are overlapping and redundant, the Blast Shower can be useful to negate debuffs received while the Raincoat is on cooldown, and to bring its protection back again to defend against more.
The Beetle' Queen's flying beetles repeatedly inflict   Beetle Juice on players nearby, and the   Grandparent's solar flare attack continuously inflicts   Burn and  Overheat in a large area. When suffering from these debuffs, the player should make sure to move out of these attacks' areas of effect before using the Blast Shower, or else the debuffs will be immediately reapplied and waste the equipment's charge.
The Blast Shower is similarly unhelpful for removing the  Cripple inflicted by the Pillar of Design's repeated shockwaves, and one should just jump over them instead.
There are several telegraphed attacks that can be cleansed with Blast Shower's ability to destroy projectiles such as the pools caused by Lunar Chimera (Exploder) and Beetle Queen, the ground attacks of Solus Control Unit, Alloy Worship Unit, Stone Titan, and Clay Apothecary, and the rotating attack used by phase 3 Mithrix
In order to properly cleanse these attacks, it is important to stand at the center of the attack, making the pools caused by Lunar Chimera (Exploder) and Beetle Queen less practical to cleanse.
Following this logic, it is possible to cleanse the entire rotating attack used by phase 3 Mithrix with only 4 fuel cells by standing at the intersection of all the pillars and activating Blast Shower's effect whenever the pillar's appear.


== Lore ==
Order: Blast Shower

Tracking Number: 152*****

Estimated Delivery: 06/19/2056

Shipping Method: Standard

Shipping Address: Frontier Gate, Outer Edge Zone

Shipping Details:

Outer Edge thanks you for your rewards redemption! It takes a real explorer to make their living on the frontier. As you undoubtedly know, REAL exploring is REAL messy. This portable unit will equip you with the modern convenience of taking a shower anywhere at any time!

Disclaimer: Wear your protective suit while cleansing. Do not use product directly on skin. Blast Shower is only rated for B-class toxins and C-class foreign organisms. This company does not accept any responsibility for incidents as a result of an incomplete cleansing.

Equipment.name: Deus Ex Machina
Equipment.desc: Briefly enter a countering stance that lets you parry any and ALL damage . A successful parry nullifies incoming damage , reduces your equipment cooldown by 75% , and grants Blessing , causing your next attack to ALWAYS activate your on-hit effects.
Equipment.notes:
The Deus Ex Machina is an equipment in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Alloyed Collective expansion.
Upon use, gain 0.5 seconds of parrying, during which ANY damage can be blocked, granting a blessing afterwards.
Only skill damage will be able to consume and use the blessed status.
If a blessed attack kills, chance based on-kill effects are also guaranteed.
 


== Tips ==
A big synergy with this equipment is  Lost Seer's Lenses, as it can be used to guarantee a one shot an enemy.
Or entire groups of enemies with AoE items such as  Ukulele.
As any damage can trigger the parrying effect, this can lead to some quirks and strategies.
Predictable damage like fall damage, blood purchases,   REX attacks can easily be parried.
Damage over time effects that are less timing heavy. (Burn, Void Fog,  Warped Echo)
Void Implosions can be blocked, similar to   Mercenary.
As the blessing also guarantees chance based on kill effects if the blessed attack kills, this equipment can be used to guarantee  Sonorous Whispers drops from Elite enemies.
Activating this equipment too quickly will cause it to not work.
Having two  Fuel Cell's is enough to refund the cooldown upon a successful parry.
Having a  Gesture of the Drowned and 25  Gesture of the Drowned/ Fuel Cell's is enough for permanent parry window uptime.
You can transfer the cooldown refund onto other equipments with   Retool or  Functional Coupler.
  Operator's   H3-11 OCR Custom Ricochet shot's all trigger bless.
Parrying   Void Fog resets the damage over time scaling.
The effects of this equipment are not granted to the meteors spawned by  Runic Lens due to how that item does not retain information regarding the proc chain, and as such are not guaranteed to trigger any on hit or on kill effects. (Deus Ex Machina still guarantees a  Runic Lens to be triggered otherwise if the limit of 1 meteor per character has not been reached.)
Consequentlly this does not make Deus Ex Machina any more able to consistently trigger the potential infinite loop that can happen with  Runic Lens and another on hit item than without the Deus Ex Machina.
