Lunar Equipment.name: Glowing Meteorite
Lunar Equipment.desc: Rain meteors from the sky, damaging ALL characters for 600% damage per blast . Lasts 20 seconds.
Lunar Equipment.notes:
The Glowing Meteorite is a returning equipment in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Moon Worshipper Challenge.
When activated, the world darkens for 20 seconds and "meteors" rain down, hurting all characters indiscriminately. Glowing blue rings indicate where the meteors will strike, giving players a chance to navigate through them safely (although the random nature of the strikes means that damage is sometimes unavoidable).  
Each meteorite deals 600% damage to both players and monsters with a proc coefficient of 1.0, suffering from linear damage falloff. 


== Notes ==
No actual projectiles are created by the Glowing Meteorite; instead, the game simply places explosions on the ground near characters. This means that explosions will still spawn inside caves or under ceilings, and  Defensive Microbots cannot protect the player from meteors.
When activating the Teleporter, since monster spawns are concentrated inside the Teleporter's radius, nearly all the meteors will fall inside or near the Teleporter.
Multiple uses of the Glowing Meteorite (with  Fuel Cells or sufficient cooldown reduction) stack, causing more meteors to fall.


== Tips ==
  Artificer's   ENV Suit makes her jumps much more floaty than other characters', making dodging meteor strikes easier; a full-height jump followed by a hover can easily avoid most meteor strikes that don't land directly on top of her.
For extra security, Artificer can use   Ion Surge to fly high above the ground, allowing her to rain down destruction with impunity.
The  Strides of Heresy can help the player dodge meteor strikes and recover any HP they may have lost. This becomes especially effective when stacking the Strides, enabling the player to spend large amounts of time invulnerable while the meteors fall.
The  Soulbound Catalyst is particularly effective at recharging the Glowing Meteorite's cooldown, as any kill scored by the meteors will instantly reduce its cooldown. Given the high damage of the meteors and the fact that they attack all across the map, just a single use of the Glowing Meteorite will be almost sure to score several kills.
If the player is confident in their ability to navigate the meteors, giving the Glowing Meteorite to an   Equipment Drone can devastate enemies easily. Due to the Equipment Drone's large cooldown reduction, it will automatically use the Meteorite approximately every 28 seconds. This strategy becomes progressively more dangerous as the run goes on, however, since Equipment Drones use the ambient run level and not the player's level.
For reference, an Equipment Drone has the same base damage stat as a   Brass Contraption, and each meteor strike inflicts more damage than a single Brass Contraption spike ball (600% versus 500%). In long runs, dying to the Equipment Drone becomes a very real possibility as its stats increase.


== Lore ==
What a... peculiar piece of the stars that serendipity has brought us. I'm sure you can make more. The ratios are simple. It should be quite fun.

The Glowing Meteorite is (currently) the only returning equipment from Risk of Rain 1 that was changed from a regular equipment to a lunar equipment.
Using this equipment in multiplayer can be detrimental to other players without movement options, especially on smaller environments.

Lunar Equipment.name: Helfire Tincture
Lunar Equipment.desc: Ignite ALL characters within 15m for 12s. Deal 5% of your maximum health /second as burning as damage . The burn is 0.5x stronger on yourself, 0.25x stronger on allies, and 24x stronger on enemies.
Lunar Equipment.notes:
The Helfire Tincture is a lunar equipment in Risk of Rain 2. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Multikill! Challenge.
When activated, a sphere of blue flames surrounds the holder for 12 seconds, continuously inflicting the invisible {  Helfire debuff on everything within 15 meters (including the holder and their allies). Once a character leaves the fire or the Tincture's effect expires, the Helfire debuff persists for an additional 3 seconds. 
The Helfire debuff deals damage 5 times per second. Each tick deals 0.5% of the holder's max health to themself, 0.25% of their max health to other allies, and 24% of their max health to enemies. This means that the damage per second is 2.5%, 1.25%, and 120% of the holder's maximum health to themself, to allies, and to enemies, respectively.
The Helfire debuff is nonlethal to the holder, so it will never bring them below 1 HP. 


== Notes ==
Correction: The in-game description of dealing 5% of your maximum health to yourself and 2.5% to allies is technically correct, but does not account for how all friendly-fire damage (including self-inflicted damage) is halved.
Correction: The in-game description of 8m radius is incorrect, and the description does not specify the duration.
Survivors with natural armor take less damage from Helfire Tincture.
It's possible to gain permanent uptime of the flames by having a  Gesture of the Drowned and at least 4  Fuel Cells, though proper preparations must be taken to ensure the player can stay alive.
Although the Helfire debuff is invisible, it still counts towards the  Death Mark.
However, the  Ignition Tank changes the Helfire debuff into {  Stronger Burn, which will combine with other affected fire sources such as  Gasoline.
 Ignition Tank provides increased burn damage to enemies and yourself making the choice risky but powerful. Despite the increased self damage, the burn  is never lethal.
Allies can still die from the burn caused by  Ignition Tank, so be wary when using this combo near drones or other players.


== Item Effects ==


=== Beneficial ===
 Tougher Times can block self-damage ticks.
 Repulsion Armor Plate reduces the damage taken while on fire, and because it ticks extremely fast for low amounts, it's easy to reduce burning damage taken to 1.
Combining Armor Plates with the  Planula can result in a steady healing over time effect. This theoretical build is limited by Planula’s scarcity.
Since the  Focus Crystal is a global damage increase, it will increase the damage done to burning enemies. However, its range is slightly smaller than the flames' area of effect (13m versus 15m), so the player will need to get slightly closer to enemies to reap the benefits.
Focus Crystal will give a damage boost against allies including other players.
 Razorwire will activate each tick of burning, firing 5 times per second and rapidly triggering on-hit effects.
Pairing the Razorwire with on-hit healing from the  Leeching Seed or  Harvester's Scythe gives the player automatic healing as long as enemies are within the Razorwire's range.
An Aegis can add a considerable barrier with enough on-hit healing.
Stacking Tougher Times will occasionally prevent the Razorwire from activating. It is important to find a balance between Tougher Times, Razorwire, and on-hit healing.
 Titanic Knurl,  Infusion,  Bison Steak,  Pearl,  Irradiant Pearl, and  Stone Flux Pauldron increase the damage dealt by the flames while simultaneously increasing survivability.
Having more max health increases the damage dealt, but likewise increases the damage taken, so more Repulsion Armor Plates are necessary. Taking 1 Repulsion Armor Plate per 1000 max health reduces each self-damage tick to 1.
 Mired Urn helps the player automatically heal when close to enemies, and inflicts {  Tar to slow them down and keep them in the burning area. It also pairs well with Focus Crystal by draining even more health.
Having two  Bustling Fungi allows the player to stand still and recover HP at a higher rate than the Tincture burns them.
 Weeping Fungus can accomplish the same thing but allows the player to continue moving.
All of the healing strategies above are greatly enhanced by the  Rejuvenation Rack.
The  Corpsebloom's recovery ceiling is lower than the self-injury inflicted by the Tincture and still affords the bonus healing that Rejuvenation Rack does. However, the Corpsebloom prevents the player from healing excessively, making Aegis practically useless and damage from enemies difficult to recover from.
 Voidsent Flame will trigger on the player if the burn ticks while at full health. However, these explosions do not deal self-damage, resulting in a huge damage boost with no downside as long as they can stay at full health.   Aegis is the best way to accomplish this.
While shields do make it more difficult to use this strategy, as long as the combined value of the player's health, shields, and barrier is greater than their combined maximum health and shields, Voidsent Flame will still trigger.
 Transcendence will make all burn damage negligible, as the player's max health becomes 1.
The same effect happens upon killing a {  Perfected Elite while holding the  Wake of Vultures.
A lesser effect happens when the player gains the {  Overloading buff by killing an Overloading Elite while holding the Wake of Vultures, where half of their max health becomes shields. This means that, for the duration of the Overloading buff, all damage taken from and dealt by the Tincture is halved.


=== Detrimental or useless ===
 Medkit is near-useless because of how rapidly the burn damage ticks, constantly resetting the 2 seconds necessary to recover. The only way to make use of a Medkit is to proc Tougher Times many times in a row.
The barrier from  Topaz Brooch is consumed almost instantly, and—in the late-game—the stack requirement becomes too high to be sustainable.
 Personal Shield Generator and all shield effects do not increase the damage dealt, and shields require 7 seconds without taking damage to replenish.
 Cautious Slug will never activate because the player is constantly taking damage.
 Rose Buckler can reduce incoming burn damage, but the effect is considerably smaller than a single Repulsion Armor Plate. The armor granted is still useful for approaching enemies.
 Shaped Glass should be avoided as the damage from this item is based on max health, not base damage. Halving your health will halve the damage that the Helfire Tincture deals.
The  Ignition Tank will multiply the damage on enemies and allies. Without plenty of healing, even one stack can make the self-burn damage get out of hand by dealing 10% of the user's maximum health per second as self damage.

== References ==

Lunar Equipment.name: Spinel Tonic
Lunar Equipment.desc: Drink the Tonic, gaining a boost for 20 seconds. Increases damage by +100% . Increases attack speed by +70% . Increases armor by +20 . Increases maximum health by +50% . Increases passive health regeneration by +300% . Increases movespeed by +30% . When the Tonic wears off, you have a 20% chance to gain a Tonic Affliction, reducing all of your stats by -5% (-5% per stack) .
Lunar Equipment.notes:
The Spinel Tonic is a lunar equipment introduced in the Scorched Acres Update. It is unlocked and starts appearing in runs after completing the Cosmic Explorer Challenge.
Activating the Tonic will   dramatically increase all the player's stats for 20 seconds, but after this buff wears off there is a 20% chance to gain a  Tonic Affliction; the affliction reduces all stats by 5% (-5% per stack) if the player is not under the Tonic's buff. 


== Notes ==
While the   Tonic Buff is active, the in-game character model emits dark bursts of liquid, the screen becomes tinted blue, and the camera's FOV increases.
The stat bonuses (other than armor) for this buff are unique in that they are multipliers. For example, not only does the attack speed buff give 70% bonus attack speed, it makes all other attack speed buffs 70% stronger, so a  Soldier's Syringe would give 25.5% bonus attack speed instead of the normal 15%.
The chance to get a  Tonic Affliction is affected by Luck. This means that with a single  57 Leaf Clover, the player's chance to get an affliction is reduced to 4%. However, having a single  Purity instead will increase the affliction chance to 36%.
Having enough Tonic Afflictions can reduce a survivor's maximum health to 1 HP. Unlike  Shaped Glass, further stacks do not kill the player.
The chance to acquire an affliction is determined when the Spinel Tonic is activated.
The Tonic Afflictions are not given to the player until the tonic buff wears off, meaning that if the equipment is activated multiple times and then the tonic buff ends, multiple stacks of Tonic Affliction can be gained at once.
This can be avoided by advancing to the next stage, which removes the tonic buff without giving any Tonic Afflictions.
The Tonic Affliction is added directly to the player's inventory.
Tonic Afflictions can be avoided if the buff is kept up continually, and all afflictions have their effects negated while the buff is active.


== Tips ==
The +300% regeneration applies to  Cautious Slug,  Titanic Knurl, and   Acrid's Regenerative buff, making them all 4 times as powerful.
Extremely powerful when paired with the  War Horn, as it's 70% attack speed buff becomes 119%, and if you have 4  War Horns the attack speed buff will last for the entire duration of the tonic.
This equipment is not as effective when playing as   Engineer, as his turrets are not affected by the buff but still inherit all of his afflictions.
Using the Tonic as the   Heretic will quickly lead to her death, since it quadruples her negative health regeneration.
Pairing this with the  Transcendence allows the Heretic to use the Tonic, since it sets her regeneration to 0. This comes at the cost of being unable to heal normally, however.
It's possible to gain permanent uptime and avoid the buff wearing off by having a  Gesture of the Drowned and at least 3  Fuel Cells.


== Math ==
The Tonic Affliction debuff will reduce a victim's HP by 1 - 1 / ( 1 + 0.1 ⋅ amount of afflictions)
All other stats are reduced by 1 - 0.95 ^ amount of afflictions
